column1: E-Zee M.Fort Worth, TX939611839/3/20183 photosTonight was a very bad night for customer service at this location. I entered the location looked around maybe about 30 people inside and they had about eight waitresses available, and everything looked OK. It took the waitress about 15 minutes to stop and see me after I started giving her strange looks. So I ordered a Pepsi,  chicken wings and a shrimp stirfry. It seems like a simple enough order but it took another five minutes to get the drink in almost 20 to 25 minutes for the wings and at the one hour and 10 minute limit I said that was enough in my main dish still has not arrived. column1: Shea S.Elite '2021Granville, OH2531584668/21/20175 photosI was in the area checking out the dealership for a potential investment opportunity and decided what better way to see the current situation than to use the service department. I took my wife's 2015 Sorento in for service and was greeted with a big smile and hand shake. The car needed an oil change and tire rotation, they explained the process and had me sit in the customer lounge. The lounge is AWESOME, nice furniture, free WIFI and a nice selection of coffee's and snacks. I made a Starbucks with the coffee machine and grabbed a granola bar and about 50 min later they had completed my service. The car was washed and they even swept it out. I definitely think this is a great place to do business and could be a great place to work.See all photos from Shea S. for Ken Ganley KiaUseful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationNikolaus N.Business Manager9/5/2017Shea, we appreciate you taking the time to share your review! column1: John S.Charlotte, NC21512/29/2017If there was a way to give zero or negative stars I would. I'll keep this brief since I've had multiple horrible experiences with this place. They have done about everything wrong I can think of, from horrible customer service, terrible communication to what seems to me to be complete incompetence in actually doing repairs. I have taken my car to them three times for overheating issues. They initially replaced my radiator and sold me on a repair to my front end. The next day I had to get my car towed because they did not tighten something properly, which they admitted and fixed. Another trip in for the same overheating issue and this time they replaced the water pump, but not the thermostat, even though that was their initial diagnosis of the problem. My best guess why they didn't replace the thermostat is they don't talk to each other, or not very effectively. I was transferred to four different people over the course of several days trying to get my car fixed. That repair took, wait for it......FOUR DAYS!!! That was not bad enough, though, because my car was overheating again not long after they replaced the water pump and this time they told me someone had put "stop leak" in my cooling system and it would cost over $1,700 to "clean it out". Thankfully, I smelled a scam and took my car elsewhere and had the system flushed and the thermostat replaced for about $200 and my car now runs fine. I will never take my car to a Pep Boys again and I would not let them work on my car for free. I felt like I was treated unethically and I warn everyone to think twice before taking your car to Pep Boys.Useful 5Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationPep B.Business Owner12/30/2017John, every Pep Boys customer deserves to be treated with respect and provided the services promised. Please contact us at pepsocial@pepboys.com, with details of your experience so that our customer service team can follow up with you to resolve the issue. Thank you.Read more

column1: Sticky L.Decatur, GA435368/7/2018I am from Atlanta, Ga and a old Just Brakes customer!A year ago Pep Boys bought out Just Brakes in Atlanta. So now all JB in Atlanta are Pep Boys!Last October my check engine light started flashing on my Silverado and no one could tell me why!I even took it to the Chevrolet dealership near my home in Atlanta, Ga. and they missed diagnosed the issues!I knew I needed brakes and shocks on my truck and I knew I was coming to Concord, NC for my birthday!So I decided to bring my truck to the Pep Boys here to have the work done!Now here's what I didn't expect, I didn't expect Tanner the automotive Tech to be so dayum good at what he does!Tanner took one look at my truck and saw that my PVC hose had come loose on my truck which was the cause of my flashing cel. He also saw that my value cover gaskets were leaking! He also told me I didn't need a brake master cylinder, but I did need just front brakes!Tanner replaced my front brakes and resurfaced my rotors!Tina the asst manager, made sure that I was able to apply my Just Brakes wannaties,  all the work was going to be completed that day, and have my truck would be back to me before a event that I had to attend that evening!She also made it possible for Lyft to take me home while the work was being done on my truck and then pick me up again!Today I told Mark Davis the store manager, the fact that Tanner was able to address and fix my check engine light issues was enough for me to come back the next time I'm in town!With the new shocks and brakes my truck rides like its brand new!Thank you again Tina, Tanner and Mark for your outstanding customer service!You guys totally Rocks!UsefulFunnyCool 1Business owner informationPep B.Business Owner8/8/2018When our customers are happy, we are happy. Thanks for the feedback!Read more
column2: Business owner informationPep B.Business Owner8/8/2018When our customers are happy, we are happy. Thanks for the feedback!Read more

column1: Christa L.San Tan Valley, AZ84637019645/25/20161 photoWhat a great sandwich shop!  There are so many amazing options...both with meat or without.  And the service is amazing.  The guys who work the front counter make you feel like you're visiting a friend's home.  They are super interactive, enthusiastic, and friendly and they treat each customer the same way, even when they are incredibly busy and the line is out the door.  And despite the lunch crowd, the sandwiches were still delivered in a reasonable amount of time.  Nice job guys!I ordered the Scotsman, which was pretty good.  All veggies were super fresh as was the bread.  Oh, and when they ask if you want your bread toasted, your answer should always be yes.  I only have a couple of complaints, which is why one star is missing.  First off, my sandwich was supposed to come with pesto, which it did because I could see it.  Unfortunately, I really couldn't taste it.  And I found that pretty strange because pesto has such a strong distinct flavor.  The other thing was that the sandwich was SO messy.  It literally fell apart and was more like a salad with a side of bread.  Overall though, I'd definitely recommend stopping in and I hope to return to try some of their other delicious sounding menu items.The Scotsman and potato saladUseful 12Funny 7Cool 10Business owner informationAmber W.Business Owner5/25/2016What a GREAT REVIEW! column1: Ervin S.Toronto, Canada027/7/2015Honestly, this doesn't even deserve 1 star..I recently bought 3 bottles of their house juice. They told me it was 70/30 Vg/Pg ratio, and I asked for 3mg..First, All flavours sucked. Juice is runny, and vapour production isn't good which leads me to believe it is 50/50 ratio. I asked for 3mg specifically but I get unbelievably uncomfortable throat hits... Terrible. Definitely not 3mg, possibly 6mg or higher. Flavours were also not as described. Shitty products aside, customer service was also terrible. The girl was nice, but the other guy was rude. I said good morning and he didn't even look at me or acknowledge my presence.  I felt generally uncomfortable in this shop.. The only reason why I bought the juices anyway was because I was out of juice, and the description sounded good. No dripping samples either.Will not be returning to this shop, and I encourage everybody to find somewhere else to shop for vape products.  Seriously, terrible environment. Very unwelcoming.UsefulFunny 2CoolBusiness owner informationTommy T.Business Owner7/7/2015Hi Ervin, I'm terribly sorry you feel this way about us. First off I'd like to say we do not make our juices and our providers tell us they are a 70/30 vg/pg mix. Second juice is preference based, different for everybody so I'm also sorry again you do not like our juice :(, but others do. Third, I will agree that our 3mg is slightly stronger than most 3's out there, but if you would like to come try a 6mg I guarantee you it will be stronger than the juice you just purchased. Fourth, I am that "other guy" and would like to say sorry for not noticing you said good morning, I simply did not want to interrupt your conversation with my partner, and if it was in the morning I had work to do on the computer so I apologize again though no excuses should be made, we didn't mean to make it unwelcoming for you. Happy vaping!Read more

column1: Jessica K.Scottsdale, AZ3057610/19/2014I lived in Village at Lakewood for approx 9 months and I moved out in 2013.  The location is great.  I really loved the neighborhood.  Being able to walk my dog every morning and evening on the greenway was a treat.  The complex was ok.  The security gates on the parking lots always worked but 50% of the sidewalk gates were broken.  Not nice to know the complex wasn't secure but, nice to not have to carry my keys when out walking the dog.  The pools were always clean and the landscaping was cared for.The unit I moved into was extremely dated.  Old carpet, ancient kitchen appliances, and terrible windows.  It also turned out to have a major roach (water bug) infestation.  How they hid it when I did my walk through, I don't know. Pest control was in my apartment every other week - spraying, drilling holes in the walls and fogging, doing everything they could do - but the bugs wouldn't go.  The living room window leaked water when rain water would run down the front of the building.  Luckily, the outgoing management let me out of my lease before the new management came in.  The roaches avoided my bedroom, which I thought was awfully nice of them.  To be fair, my neighbors claimed to not have the same level of roach infestation that I did.  People on the second floor, directly above my unit, claimed to have never even seen a roach before!  Guess I was just lucky.Minus the bugs, I liked the apartment and the management was very responsive.  It was really quiet and my neighbors were very nice.  Price wise, considering the dated fixtures and bug problem, I paid too much for that little one bedroom.  I went into the complex a few weeks ago to visit a friend and saw that they had my old unit torn apart.  Hopefully its been completely gutted, not just cleaned to turn it over again and let another poor soul deal with the infestation.Useful 6Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationErica M.Business Owner3/8/2015Thank you for taking the time to make a review.  We are sorry that we were not able to make the bug issue go away for you but we are happy that we were able to come to a solution that both parties were happy with.  We are doing some great renovations to the interior of the apartments that make a huge improvement.  Next time you are in the area visiting your friend, stop in the office and take a look for yourself.  Thank you again for the review.Read more

column1: Paul T.Phoenix, AZ2189/20/2015Please accept this short testament of a very personal nature that speaks to the Village at Lakewood's staff.This has absolutely nothing to do w/ bathroom tub caulking; ceiling fan squeaks; pristine pool facilities; loud or quiet neighbors; excessive leaf blowing vs. excessive leaves; excellent, exclusive, taxpayer-rebate-funded (parochial/cult) schools vs. traditionally funded and notoriously neglected (pubic) schools for normal kids; creepy cupboard crawlies or any other such weighty matters.I'd like to thank Wes, a member of the Village at Lakewood office staff, for his professional and discrete handling of an extremely urgent matter that a clearly distraught, non-resident walk-in dumped on his Monday morning desk.Without hesitation and with some authority (no doubt guided by his years of industry experience) Wes rose to the occasion, followed procedure, enlisted the resources of the community, directed activities as necessary and calmly offered comfort and assistance to this complete stranger under duress.Here's where I pull off my "Undercover Boss" disguise and present Wes with a full year membership to the "Jelly of the Month Club", right?  Hold on a sec...That was real life on the phone.  They're out of jelly.  So I'll leave you with this instead:Imagine how well the actual Village at Lakewood tenants are served if the Village staff perform this highly for a stranger in need.Thank you, Wes and Village management for your assistance.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationErica M.Business Owner9/21/2015Thank you for taking the time to complete a positive review for our community and most of all for one of our team members.  We do strive to provide exceptional customer service to all who visit The Village at Lakewood and we appreciate your kind words and recognition in doing so.Best regards,Erica MirelesVillage at Lakewood Community Manager480-642-9700villagelakewoodmgr@greys…Read more

column1: Bahi S.Glendale, AZ025/13/2016I was excited when I was out of my last lease to find a better location and home for my little family. When I had the walk through here at Lakewood I was So excited and eager to get approved and move in! Just my luck... This place is worst than living in my last 4 bedroom home in Laveen! I settled for small, BUT I didn't expect to have my carpet poking my kids and I in the feet, our cabinets peeling from being painted over, a washer that stinks when you wash clothes(what's he point of washing clothes??), the bathroom tubs scoff bc they were painted, my AC unit is ALWAYS leaking water AND the thermostat control doesn't work properly(I have to hit it to make it work), and the drains are all plugged up(continuously), and when your microwave is a Kenmore brand when you get it and it breaks they replace it with a cheap ass microwave! After all these things I for sure pay WAY too much rent for a place like this!!! Management doesn't do much bc they don't work with you and the maintenance line is retarded bc they just call you back and make you feel stupid!.... Example: your AC unit is leaking really bad at 8pm... They call you and tell you to put something under it like a pot and they'll come by first thing tomorrow morning! It's annoying... So whoever reads this you are forewarned!! Do not rent from here! I wish I would've just done a month to month plan bc I've only been here for 2 months and can't stand it!Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationErica M.Business Owner5/16/2016Thank you for taking the time to review our community. We truly are sorry to hear about the items you have had issue with during your time here at Village at Lakewood. We work hard to provide the highest level living experience we can. We would love for you to give us the opportunity to sit down and discuss these issues or misunderstandings with you so we can turn your experience here at Village at Lakewood in to a more positive one. Please contact us at the management office at 480-642-9700 to discuss these issues. We appreciate your review and giving us the opportunity to improve further. We want all of our residents to have an enjoyable living experience during their time at Village at Lakewood.Read more

column1: Felicia T.Phoenix, AZ03155/14/2015I have lived in the complex for 10 months now and would caution new residentsPros:-Great location close to the greenbelt and the lakes.-Quiet complex, I rarely hear noise from other residents that bothers me.-Residents are friendly and there are lots of kids for the little ones to play with.-Maintenance is quick to respond to minor repairs.Cons:-Remodeling job is cheap.  They are just spray painting the old cabinets and putting down cheap laminate and linoleum.  The cabinets stick and the spray paint comes off in little flecks and the flooring scratches and scuffs really easily. -If you are on the first floor, the landscaping crew blows all of the leaves and debris onto the patios  -Even though they have a ban on pit bulls, I see a lot of them in the complex-Jessica is right, most of the sidewalk gates are broken.  One has been broken for  a long time and I talked to management about several months ago- it's still not fixed.-I used to do property management in Texas, and I have never encountered management that is so unreasonable to work with on major issues.  In the 6 months of living here, I had the complex provided washing machine malfunction twice causing damage both times.  The second time it flooded the apartment so badly that we had to remove all of our belongings and stay in a hotel for two weeks while the damage was repaired.  Despite promises from the property manager at the time that we would be reimbursed for hotel expenses, they refused.  The management did not pay for our hotel or pro-rate our rent for the time that we couldn't live there.  That's right we had to pay for a hotel and rent at the same time!  The new manager told me it is their policy not to pay for hotel expenses or pro-rate rent, and that the old manager mispoke.  I've never heard of any landlord with that policy!  Luckily we have good renters insurance through State Farm and they took care of us, but it took 3 weeks to get reimbursed.  The repairs weren't fixed very well either.  They didn't want to replace the carpet, but it couldn't be stretched anymore, so they literally nailed the carpet down.  There are little nails that poke your feet in certain spots and the linoleum was cut jagged and is unsightly.    You'll probably be okay if you don't have any major issues, but I would make sure you have good renters insurance if you choose to live here!Useful 9FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGreystar M.Business Owner8/2/2016Your experiences and opinions while living here are valuable to us. We are sorry to hear that there are items you are unhappy with but we would be more than happy to discuss these with you. We are committed to our pledge of excellent customer service. Please feel free to contact the leasing office at 480-642-9700 so I may schedule a time to sit and discuss any of your concerns with you.Thank you,Erica MirelesCommunity ManagerRead more

column1: Andrew P.Harrisburg, NC117138446/5/2019I've been searching for a trustworthy and reliable mechanic for quite a while now, and have bounced around to all your typical car mechanic chains (Pepboys, Mieneke, etc.). To no avail, every time I went to one of those places with my car, I always walked out disappointed because of the service, quality of work, cost for labor, or a little bit of all 3. I'm happy to say I finally found what I was looking for with Christian Brothers Automotive. Lenny and Scott took great care of my car, and fixed everything I needed in a timely fashion. They were able to do front and back suspension, as well as replace a part that was giving off a check engine light in less than 24 hours. I greatly appreciated the correspondence throughout the entire process to let me know the updates with my car, and I thought it was very convenient that they offer a complimentary shuttle so you don't have to wait around while your car is getting worked on. They did such a great job that I came back the very next day to get front brakes and rotors done that they also got done in an extremely timely fashion. All of these parts needed to get done on my car for a while, and I was completely aware of it, so I know I wasn't taken advantage of like a lot of other mechanics tend to do to people. They kindly let me know of other services my car could benefit from in the not to distant future, but they weren't pushy at all for me to do it right away. Very satisfied! I made sure to let them know that they gained a long term customer in me! Highly recommend. Also, I think it's worth noting that the company's values are centered around Christian beliefs, so if you're looking for humble, honest, and straight forward car service, this is the place to go!Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCustomer S.Business Owner6/7/2019Andrew, your review is such a joy to receive! Thank you so much for sharing your complete satisfaction with our team's trustworthy service and clear communication. We're blessed to have earned your high recommendation, and we look forward to seeing you again in the future! Gratefully, Christian Brothers Coddle CreekRead more

column1: Mizzle D.Fort Ogden, FL051/30/2017I lived here about 4 years ago and I loved it. The entire apartment was very roomy and it felt like a real home. Large kitchen, tons of cabinet space, large pantry, full size washer and dryer and a walk-out patio, professional staff and well-kept grounds and pool area, and relatively quiet neighbors. What more could a person want in an apartment? I would still be living there if I hadn't lost my job. I am now in the market again for a new place and, of course, I checked here. I was so disappointed to hear how high the rent has climbed. The going rate at Lemon and Pear Tree Apartments is now $900/month, which doesn't include water, sewage or trash. YIKES. That being said, if I could afford it, I'd move here again in a heartbeat...UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationTiffany M.Business Manager1/31/2017Mizzle, Thank you for writing a review and all of the wonderful things you said about our property! We strive to provide a happy and comfortable living place for all of our residents.  As far as the current rents and specials go, unfortunately due to inflation and cost of living, rents have increased through-out the Mesa area; this includes us.  Our rent is currently $899 on a 12 month lease and that actually does include water, sewer, & trash and we also offer a $99 move in special; which is significantly less than our competition.  We'd love to have you back as a resident if you feel these rates can work for you! Thanks,Tiffany M. Rental ManagerRead more

column1: Sarah A.Elite '2021Toronto, Canada167132253/31/20191 photoAs someone who grew up with Italian bakeries at every corner and had multiple options to choose from for various cold cuts, pastries and goods, I know my point of view may be a bit differet than those who to an Italian bakery as a curiosity. Please note that weekends and in particular Sundays, are busy Italian bakery days. So, my question is how in the world is only having one cashier, one person at the pastry booth, 5 people behind the bar chatting and giggling excusable? Those lines here are brutal and not to mention, people simply toss manners and decorum out the window to get theri hands on whatever dessert they want (usually not even the traditional Italian desserts funny enough).The food...It is overpriced, not gonna lie. Is it the best quality? No. Are the products hard to find? In Corso Italia? No but elsewhere in the city? Probably if Little Italy is excluded. Foods to avoid: the bread (it will harden in a day), soft cheeses (the thickness of the film gives it a spooky feel), the coffee (I would skip it), and the cold cuts probably to avoid the cost for something unlikely to be of the freshest quality. Foods to get: A Zeppole (although it will be moister than others), the Tiramisu could be worse but most definitely could be better, and chocolates or pre-packed goods that are from Italia.The service...For the 70 dollars I spent on a birthday cake, I would have hoped for at the bare minimum a closed box. I understand that no one wants things squished and smashed. However, why not place the cake in a bigger box? I asked for a bag since it took me well over an hour to reach my designation of this bakery...Denied. When I asked for a bag, just give me a big bag. I saw people with small items leave with huge bags given to them by the cashier. I informed the cashier that I was traveling all the way down to the waterfront/lakeshore. I got two random answers that equated to too bad, so sad, good luck. So a 70 dollar cake PLUS the 21 dollar Uber down to my place because I guess hindsight is 20/20 and I should've brought my own bag. Not.Worth.It. Next time, I will just go to a nearby place and get some cupcakes or something. If you were like me looking for a cannoli cake, there are other bakeries in the city that make them. At the length of time and aggravation this trek costed me, I will simply go to Vaughan next time for something akin to what I ordered.We love a well-placed saran wrapUseful 2Funny 2Cool 1Business owner informationAnnaMarie D.Business Owner4/2/2019We take our feedback seriously but we’re not going to take this one to heart. We use quality ingredients and we have an incredible relationship with our customers in our community that we’re very proud of. I helped you with your cake and when I returned with a bag for you, you were gone.Read more

column1: Christine S.Gilbert, AZ41175325/15/2018Good:  Nice staff.  Flexible lease terms.  Apartments have good space w balconies.  Maintenance issues are handled quickly and responsive.  Office is great to receive and sign off packages.  Grounds are clean.  We love the feral cats.  Lots of the people do.  We rescued an injured one.  You can't pet them because they'll run but you do get to know them and their babies.  It would be great if Mark Taylor partnered w a rescue group that could spay and return them.  They had food trucks too.  Anywhere from 1-4 times per month.Opportunities:  lots of fees that aren't part of their advertising.  So there is a valet waste fee but I was like 20 feet from garbage.  To my knowledge they didn't take recycle.  And I put my bath garbage in there one night and they took the big bag but not that one.  One Monday, they didn't pick it up at all.  And they don't collect Friday or Saturday.  I travelled and some months never used it.  Either build it into rent or get rid of this mandatory fee.   They implemented some required insurance.  You can do a deposit or they offer some no refund option.  I opted for a deposit.The other admin fee was with the monthly water bill.  That was also $25 plus tax monthly admin.  My actual water bill was $5 because of my work schedule but every month I paid $40.Appliances could use an update.  My washer and dryer made some whining sounds.  Two stove burners didn't work.  Microwave would burn food during reheat.  Dishwasher soap dispenser never worked.Parking...I don't know how many people hit the poles for covered parking.  At least 3 that I personally talked.  Think they should get thinner beams, pad them or remove the covered.  Could always be an option for $20 per month for tiny cars.No good cable options.  The service through that cable company is bad.Grounds are nice with a dog park, Volleyball courts and trail.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationSamantha A.Business column1: Kimberly W.Manhattan, NY2212/2/2017This property has feral cats running all over getting into garbage and tracking all over your car making the complex smell like cat urine in places. With all the cats you would think there wouldn't be such a scorpion issue but guess again. I had scorpions in and outside of my apartment. The complex does offer Burns pest control weekly at no extra cost, however their services don't really cover getting rid of them just their food source. There is constant turn over in the leasing office which works to your advantage in a way because some of them are really nice and helpful and some are really snooty, but don't worry they wont be there long anyway. Apparently the corporate office doesn't treat the employees any better than the residents.Speaking of the corporate office..be ready to get juiced out of every penny possible at move out. They changed the polices on some of their refundable deposits over the course of my lease and guess what??? All of a sudden it's no longer refundable! I would give the corporate office a negative star if i could. They don't care at all if you have paid your rent on time and have been a model tenet, you are a number and there are more of you out there, so what do they care? More than anything I'm really disappointed in the way the corporation treated me, but I guess that's how the fat cats stay fat.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMark T.Business Manager2/9/2017Thank you for reaching out, Kimberly. We do our best to control infestation of every kind and we apologize if you've experienced any frustration or issues that made you feel otherwise. We rely on this kind of feedback to make sure we are doing all that we can to provide a comfortable home to our residents, so we really do appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review. We try to be as transparent as possible when it comes to our policies regarding deposits or other payments, and it disappoints us to hear that you felt misled in any way. We assure you that was not intentional. We value our residents and appreciate you making Borrego your home. If you'd like to discuss any of our policies or your concerns in more detail, please feel free to give us a call at (888) 626-9770. Thank you. - The Team at BorregoRead more

column1: Samantha M.Gilbert, AZ301121/1/2017I have lived here for almost 4 years now and it is time to move on. I actually love the apartments, but what ruined it for me is the following:1. CATS. There are feral cats everywhere. They live in the exterior walls of the apartment and breed. People in the complex feed them as well. I have personally called Borrego about this on multiple occasions over the past year and a half and they have chosen to do nothing. Now, there are upwards of 20 cats that live near my building alone. It is to the point where they sleep on my car every night and have ruined the paint on the hood of my car. They a very territorial and will lurk in the stairwells and hallways and hiss at you if you try to go up/down the stairs to get to your apartment. They will also rummage through the trashcans outside resident's doors before they are picked up by the trash service. 2. The front office. The staff itself are nice for the most part. The issue I have is the fact that my rent is always wrong. On several occasions they have added fees into my rent and I've had to play phone tag with them to get these mysterious fees taken off my account. They also rarely get my rent correct on the first try and on the 1st of every month I spend my day trying to get the amount corrected before I start getting charged late fees waiting on them to correct their error. Additionally, it's frustrating that I'm charged an admin fee every month when I have to manually check everything they charge me for mistakes because it is rarely correct. 3. Rent increases every year to the point that it's no longer competitive with newer, larger, upgraded apartments. If you have time to kill and can baby sit Mark Taylor, then I say live here. If you also have no regard for your property or personal safety, this is a great place to live. I'm disappointed that these simple issues could not be addressed in the time I lived here because I love the location and I love the floor plan of my apartment. Choose wisely!Useful 5FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMark T.Business Manager1/13/2017Hi, Samantha. We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review and share your concerns. We're sorry to hear that you experienced these issues during your time here, and we are even more sorry to hear that you feel they have gone unaddressed. Let us assure you that this is not typical, and your concerns are very important to our team. We are confident that we can address each of these concerns for you, and improve your opinion of Borrego. Please stop by the office or give us a call at (888) 626-9770 when you have the time. Thank you. - The Team at Borrego at SpectrumRead more

column1: Mike S.Charlotte, NC054/19/2021Have had two very bad experiences with them in the past couple of months. Having been priority advantage member, I used them for plumbing and AC for past few years. Recent plumbing experience technician quoted $700 to sleeve a main drain pipe. Fifteen minutes late he had broken the entire pipe and it was $3,700. All he could say was "sorry, I won't charge you for the damage I did".Next AC came out for annual service, and granted unit is old and I expected the possibility to replace. Technician said it was needed to be replaced, and I asked if it could still be charged with Freon and he quoted $3000 to charge it. Called some manager who got me on the phone to schedule a quote for system replacement. Get on the phone and he wants to schedule someone to call me on phone, not come out!? I said, whatever, just call after 5 Monday. Billy called and didn't ask any info, just said $10,950. So I have four other companies out since and not one quoted more than $4000 LESS than Morris Jenkins. I think they are actually a rip off and would advise anyone to avoid them.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMorris J.Business Owner4/19/2021Hi Mike, we're very sorry to hear that you had two bad experiences with us recently. column1: Shari C.Mesa, AZ9113/8/2012I purchased a Living Social voucher for Valentine's Day.  You have to order the chocolates online and then drive to a Farmer's Market on one of two days to pick these up.  I ordered 2 boxes of chocolates for $50 and had $10 left that I didn't spend online as nothing would equal that amount.  When I drove to pick up the chocolates there were 2 young girls running the booth.  I told them my name and they gave me the chocolates.  They didn't ask for my voucher so I offered it to them.  They had a few dollar items on the table, so I asked if I could use the rest of the money on the voucher and the girls had no idea.  They called the owner a few times and finally got in touch with her and then explained to me that I could not use the voucher.  I had to use it all at the same time.  They said it was in the "fine print".  And to top it off, the chocolates were not very good.  They look nice, but I could not tell which flavor I was eating.  The flavor did not come out well in the chocolates.  I was not impressed for the price.  I'll take Julia Baker's anyday :)Useful 2FunnyCool 1Business owner informationAngela G.Business Owner3/12/2012Hi Shari,  I'm Angela, owner of The Cocoa Palette.  I wanted to thank you for your feedback and also provide some clarification to your experience.  I do apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received when picking up your order.  The girls running the booth were a last minute substitute for the gal normally there and they were not as familiar with the policies, etc.  When they reached me by phone (I was running a booth at a different market), I had asked them to communicate to you that I'd be happy to redeem the remainder of your voucher but the items do have to be pre-ordered, as detailed in the fine print of the Living Social.  There must have been a miscommunication in the correspondence, as I realize they seemed to communicate a different message than this to you.You expressed the truffles weren't to your liking due to weak flavors and I do appreciate this feedback.  We're a very new business and are constantly working on making improvements to our products.Please contact me directly at 480-719-0707 or orders@thecocoapalette.c… and I'd be happy to get you the remainder of the value you paid for with free delivery to you at your convenience.  If you're not wanting the truffles again, we do have bark, bars, brownies, marshmallows, and other sweets you can apply it towards.Read more

column1: Phoebe M.Elite '2021Gilbert, AZ71180335/8/2019I bought a Groupon for a massage here. The massage was ok. It was not 90 minutes she cut me short too. I was so disappointed coming here.Useful 1Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationKandyce H.Business Manager5/10/2019Hi Phoebe,I'm so sorry your experience did not meet your expectations.  We try our best to limit the noise and our rooms have extra soundproofing, but it is certainly not a spa environment if that is what you were hoping for.  We are a medical office and our massages are more for therapy than for relaxation.  We do care about your feedback, however, and we are reviewing ways we can limit the external sound.  We are also reviewing the wording on the Groupon to make it more clear that the 90 min massage includes 5 min. changing time before and after the massage.  Actual massage time is 80 min.  Please message me so we can find a way to make it up to you.Read more

column1: Warren E.Mesa, AZ80172410/23/20163 photosI wanted to wait a full 6 months to make an honest review. I didn't want to review something after a few months. After all, you lose a lot of the water weight first, then the hard weight loss comes after.  Before joining, I accepted the fact that being large & overweight was just going to be a way of life. This also took a toll on my self esteem and other aspects of my life. I had no desire to look in the mirror where I had to pre stretch my clothes for them to fit "better".  Due to my weight at the time, I had to take medicine to control my acid reflux and blood pressure. Which also includes a few low blood sugar episodes (hypoglycemic) Then came my breaking point... I finally looked at myself in the mirror after years of a poor diet and zero excercise. Disappointed & disgusted in myself for letting me get so badly out of shape. My wife and I decided (after "bugging me" constantly) to start to get back into shape. We wanted to kickstart our weight loss and what better way than a trainer offering the first 4 weeks free (after a few waivers are signed). I can now say after 6 months of hard work, I have lost over 33 pounds, over 58 total inches, lost 3.8% body fat and 19 of those pounds were nothing but fat. I've lost almost 8 inches around my waist, 9 inches around my gut, 6 inches around my chest and hips. I can go on and on.Because of Jennifer, my clothes no longer need to be pre-stretched. no longer do I have to hold my breath to tie my shoes. No longer do I have to hope my button on my pants break loose. No longer do I have the desire to eat bad food. I was starting to wear XXXL shirts to hide my "fat feelings" now I can almost (depending on who makes it) wear a XL shirt. I still have a long way to go in my weight loss. I have made friends here that need the same thing and even though I will still come to My Perfect Body Now Boot Camp for years to come, I will never be able to thank Jennifer enough what what she's given me in just the short amount of time. She's given me my self esteem back, self confidence back, my waist line back . Just to name a few. But the absolutely best part is I no longer have to take any medications for blood pressure or acid reflux.Useful 2FunnyCool 1Business owner informationJennifer S.Business Owner10/23/2016We are sooo grateful for you Warren! Thank you for being so open and sharing your journey and what you have already overcome and conquered! I cannot wait to see what the next 6 months will hold! We love you and your wife Liz and are all sooo thrilled we get to share each night with the two of you! You make Boot Camp soooo FUN!!! Thank you for blessing us with your JOY!!! <3Read more

column1: Liz E.Phoenix, AZ266135/27/2016My husband and I were searching for a gym and personal trainer and we're lucky to have come across this boot camp. We just finished our first month and I can say this boot camp is now something we look forward to everyday. My husband and I were terrified because we are very overweight and saw everyone doing things we thought was just impossible. But everyone was so supportive and encouraging and Jennifer was there everyday to cheer us on (she even memorized our names on day one) and make sure we didn't give up. After one month and going everyday my husband lost 22.25 total inches and I lost an incredible 28 inches and 1% body fat. The normal is about 10" a month so these results were amazing and have really motivated us to keep up the hard work. Join the class, come everyday, be positive and give it all you got and you won't be sorry! Everyday is a different workout so you are constantly using different muscles. column1: Jamie W.Queen Creek, AZ2432632/27/2018I am so happy that I stumbled upon this boot camp! After never working out before I was terrified to start! I was so worried that I was going to have to leave boot camp for a while but instead Jennifer took the time to work with me and she figured out exactly what the issue was!! I couldn't believe it! column1: WtGEnt E.Miami, FL110163/18/20195 photosBLIND DRAGON ALLOWED THIS SCAM ENTERTAINMENT COMPANY TO HOST IN THERE RESTAURANTBamboozled the fuck out of me & many others. Showed up for there R&B / Seafood Dinner event. Spent $110 for two. Expectations? Open champagne bar for 2 hours that was non existent. One drink minimum per person and after that they charge you at bar. I will being requesting a reverse transaction with my bank immediately. They ran out of champagne also. The catering @hotgrill was fucking off and didn't get our food until almost 9PM after I sat down and got only one drink at exactly 5:09PM. Guy name Roderick in the photo walking around looking like Nick Cannons ass motherfucker trying to calm everyone down while he had his affiliates running around looking dumb as fuck. His excuse was we affiliated with Michaels Downtown due to them closing for financial mismanagement issues. Bro that ain't even our issue here. While we strive hard to support black owned businesses you clearly make it hard. @hot97 back in NYC; same scenario. Lured a bunch of party goers onto a yacht and didn't have enough food and overpriced the fuck out of fucking liquor. Terrible way to manage this event. I will be avoiding this event indefinitely. Whoever attended the Scottsdale @blinddragon even this was wack as fuck. Coming from NYC this was total bullshit. Oh btw when I complained about not getting now champagne Roderick whoever the fuck he is excuse was that he had to run and buy champagne elsewhere to provide for the patrons. SMFH! Music was off! It was like 70s genre, don't mislead people ever again! BLIND DRAGON needs not let these scam events happen...!See all photos from WtGEnt E. for The DragonUseful 4Funny 2Cool 1Business owner informationKorey B.Business Manager3/18/2019Hello, we apologize for this and wish there was something we could do to fix this.  Our venue was bought out by a third party for this event so we had zero control over the management of the event in question.  Furthermore the pictures posted on this review were at Dorian, not Blind Dragon, which is a totally different business. Please contact the event coordinators to follow up.  Thank you.Andrew NavarroGeneral Manager | Blind Dragon ScottsdaleMobile: 602.828.8694 | Email: anavarro@hhgaz.comRead more

column1: Terrence F.MI, MI934431/14/20191 photoThe Warning: Just like Lil S said before in another review on 1/7/19. There is a reason why they are only open 15 hours a week. I'll never go back and neither will anyone from our group. I would give them "0" stars if I could. I was in from out of state and getting married two weeks ago, 1/4/19. My wife reserved the largest room (says it should fit 20 people). This was supposed to be a great fun time for our party after our reception... needless to say they failed right from the start and throughout the night. ON TOP of all of the issues with the place I will describe below, they charge a mandatory 20% gratuity (which they did NOT earn at all).Issue 1..."our reserved room wasn't ready"... We arrived on time for our 10pm-12am reservation, but we had to all stand around awkwardly as there was still another group in our room. This required us to wait while they kicked them out AND "cleaned" the room. (was just a quick wipe and no vacuuming).Issue 2..."thought I got robbed"... When the room was ready the woman told me I had to give an ID and a credit card for the room. This is fine, but turns out that woman was let off early, so at the end of the night I'm trying to find someone that I met for 5 seconds that has my ID and Credit Card. On top of that, I asked one of the managers where the woman was and he at first had no recollection of who I was talking about. Eventually they did. But in the meantime I was scared I had just been fleeced out of my worth.Issue 3... "No instructions/menus/explanations"... there was no one to explain food or drinks or no menus in the room. No one was there to explain how to operate the karaoke system. The 2 microphones they had were super beat up, dented and gross. The walls had "patch marks" where they patched and repainted, which was just very raw and unprofessional for the amounts they charge.Issue 4... "Literally No Service until we complained"... We figured we'd get some liquid courage while we wait. They only had one bartender on duty on a Friday night at 10pm when they were expecting a large wedding party and had the other karaoke rooms full with groups. We patiently waited, and waited...and waited. The bartender did not move from her far corner where she served the 4 people who stood there chatting with her. I had to go out to the bar and ask 3 different people for drinks and why there was not a server in the booked room. Not even waters. I (The groom, had to run back and forth with handfuls of drinks and waters multiple times just so people wouldn't dehydrate in a box) ***Side note, how do you expect some people to sing karaoke without booze? Turns out some women in our party ordered drink right when we got there, but they had no servers so when I went to the bar their drinks had just been sitting up on the bar melting for 30 minutes (no one thought to ask about drinks just sitting?). We were told they were short staffed as they had one server and one bartender. Weird for  Friday Night @ 10PM. Finally, they brought us a few bottled beers and took our drink order. Our karaoke time was half over by then.Issue 5... "Poor design and sound proofing" The place itself has a DJ playing music out in the bar/lounge area for the people not singing karaoke in the rooms. However, the music was sooo loud from the main room that even with the door shut it cut through to what you were singing in the karaoke rooms. Whats the point of singing Bon Jovi or Snoop Dogg or BECK when you just hear DJ announcements and (Thud Thud Thud Thud) over what you are doing.Issue 6... "Questionable business ethics" (SEE PICTURE) Not only did Blind Dragon and their staff really disappoint My wedding party and I, but my friend lil S left a 1 star review similar to some of the things I outlined, and then the manager private messaged them back to compensate for the room costs, (which with the delays at first was negligible) ***IF they delete the bad yelp review!!!*** This to me is a huge no no on Yelp. This site is for people to be educated before they make a decision.... and it looks like we got suckered and they pay to play on here. Truly disappointing.The Result: I could not and will not recommend this place to anyone. I also regret taking my wedding party there. I found the employees to be reactive vs working properly. Their drinks and bottle service is way over priced. The place is too dark in the main room, multiple customers including myself had to walk or place our receipts under a light under the bar rail just to see what we owed. They were understaffed. I also found it odd that instead of the managers jumping behind the bar to at least get waters and bring them over to the customers, or help out, they just called people on the phone or on their headset or just told the 2 women dressed in basically lingerie (one bartender and one server) what to do. What a disaster!Useful 8Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationKorey B.Business Manager1/16/2019Hey Terrence, as we mentioned with the other negative reviews from the other people in your party, we fully accept responsibility for dropping the ball during your visit.  Although we were understaffed during your visit, we're not hiding behind excuses at all, we recognize that your experience should have been considerably better than it was.Keep in mind that it's a very common practice to ask for a review to be removed once we have all come to an agreement and put this situation behind us.  This is the normal process that almost all bars and restaurants use.We're more than happy to refund your room fees but we'd like to also make sure you are interested in actually coming to a resolution and not just interested in writing additional negative reviews.  If you'd like to discuss in person please reach out to me at your convenience.  Thank you.Andrew Navarro General Manager | Blind Dragon Scottsdale Mobile: 602.828.8694 | Email: anavarro@hhgaz.comRead more
column2: Business owner informationKorey B.Business Manager1/16/2019Hey Terrence, as we mentioned with the other negative reviews from the other people in your party, we fully accept responsibility for dropping the ball during your visit.  Although we were understaffed during your visit, we're not hiding behind excuses at all, we recognize that your experience should have been considerably better than it was.Keep in mind that it's a very common practice to ask for a review to be removed once we have all come to an agreement and put this situation behind us.  This is the normal process that almost all bars and restaurants use.We're more than happy to refund your room fees but we'd like to also make sure you are interested in actually coming to a resolution and not just interested in writing additional negative reviews.  If you'd like to discuss in person please reach out to me at your convenience.  Thank you.Andrew Navarro General Manager | Blind Dragon Scottsdale Mobile: 602.828.8694 | Email: anavarro@hhgaz.comRead more

column1: Suzy M.Scottsdale, AZ0107/22/2019I want to give a big shout out to this place.  I've been going here for about four years.  Mike has bent over backwards to help me with my poor 1991 Honda.  I drove it for twenty five  years and he literally kept it running for me.   Finally in October, I was able to get a new Honda Accord.  I wasn't used to such a long front end and I tapped it on the pole next to my parking space.  I absolutely freaked out.  There was a dent and some plastic hanging out on the wheel well.  I called Mike on a Monday morning and asked if someone could look at it.  Now, mind you, they are not a body shop.  Mike told me to come on in anyway just to see it and possibly refer me to a body shop that could help me.  Jordan went out to the front of my car, looked at it, popped the dent out and was able to cut away the plastic that was hanging down.  All at no charge.  Mike and Jordan, you don't know how much that meant to me.  I'm an elementary school teacher and don't exactly have the best salary.  Thank you for helping me out.  Seriously, these guys are legit.  I hope you can visit them to see for yourselves. If I could give ten stars I would.  Thank you Mike and Jordan.  I hope you'll be able to see this review.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJasmine W.Business Customer Service7/22/2019Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience with us, Suzy. column1: Alisa L.Las Vegas, NV0201910/30/20201 photoHonest company! Hallelujah! I just got a free, 2nd opinion (technically my 3rd and last) from the owner of Air Done Right, Mark. I was told by the HVAC company who did my fall tune-up that I needed an entire new unit on my roof due to rust in my heater that would cause my heat exchanger to crack and send carbon monoxide through my vents. I had planned to get 3 bids for a new unit, but as you can see from my reviews, the 2nd company (I also got the owner) said my unit was fine. Well, that should have been enough but the 1st company is accusing the 2nd company of giving me incorrect information on my unit and now they claim I'm not stating the facts so I felt the need to really prove them wrong on my terms, not theirs. Let's get a 3rd opinion from another company with 5-star Yelp reviews so people can make an educated decision on their own.As mentioned, Mark came by and I just said I wanted another opinion. I didn't mention anything about rust because I didn't know if I could trust him or not. I also mentioned that I wanted the entire unit looked at, so the AC and heater. He asked if I currently had AC and heat and I told him I did. He was on my roof for a while and then came back down and told me that my circuit board had been replaced within the last few years and that is apparently a common problem with my brand so they keep them on the vans but it's fine, just has some burn marks on the old wires from the former circuit board. I saw a photo and the insulation on the wires is brown on the bottom but not melted. He also said the AC capacitor had been replaced but eveything else looked fine. I specifically asked if there was rust in the heater. He told me that rust was inevitable but it was mild and not a problem. He said I don't need a new unit if someone told me that. Ha! I confessed what had transpired and he said he does lots of follow-ups for a different company who likes to tell people they need new units. Once again, I had another local owner walking away from a big sale and who inspected everything for free. He told me to just make sure to get a spring maintenance and gave me a magnet for my fridge. No pressure to get a maintenance contract, either. I'm not sure they even do that. The 2nd company didn't. Good sign. So, if you are worried you are getting duped, you know who to call for an honest 2nd or 3rd opinion. See my HVAC reviews. Now I have 2 companies to go to for future maintenance and an install in due time and both are smaller, locally-owned operations. Thanks, Air Done Right, for being an honest company in Vegas.Now I won't forget their name!Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKaui T.Business Employee10/31/2020Wow, what an amazing review and we thank you greatly for sharing your experience with all of us! We pride ourselves in customer service and taking care of our community. Mark is an dedicated owner as well as a knowledgeable technician and I am glad he was able to assure you of your HVAC concerns. We appreciate you taking the time out of your day to write such a great review and we look forward to having you as a long-time client!Read more

column1: Mahreen C.Mississauga, Canada0518/15/20161 photoDO NOT GO TO THIS SALON. Owner is extremely rude and unprofessional. I walked in for the first time today. Asked clearly the price to have shellac removed ONLY and nothing else as I had no time. The girl told me the price and I agreed. She put the acetone and foils to remove the shellac. A few minutes in, the girl tells me she got the price around and its actually double. I said well i asked clearly the price for the service when I walked in and decided to go ahead based on that price. The owner tells me the girl made a mistake, works part time, doesn't know the right price. I said regardless, if you quote a price to the customer then you should honour it. The owner says no problem, you don't like the price, we take it off and you go. I was so shocked. Had she even apologized once or even suggested a compromise, I would have stayed. They took the foils off with my shellac partly removed and did not clean up or anything. Told me I could go if I wasn't happy. I am in total shock! I only walked in there because it's close to my house and I needed a quick removal. I WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN. With a nail salon on every corner, I'm surprised they are still in business. column1: Annie S.Phoenix, AZ289/5/2020So here's the thing. I have worked in the medical field for many years and am familiar with Nationwide Vision. From my experience in the past with them there is a huge difference in the doctors and the store staff. Usually the front is terrible and customer service is non existent, but the doctor is knowlegable and informative. That is NOT the case for this location. The doctor (Dr.Taddonio to be specific) was rude and answered everything with no tact or patient care. My husband went into this location with a possible medical emergency (constant increase in floaters and sudden vision loss in his one eye) and was told to come in later that day. Okay, that's doable (considering they are the ONLY O.D practice open that takes medical cases on the weekend, unfortunately) and glad they took us the same day. There were no problems with the staff and everyone was nice. The doctor though is very short (and I don't mean height) and rude. He diagnoses him with a medical condition and says to go to the retinal specialist. Does not explain to him what it is or how it could of occurred. Along with other comments made throughout the exam that were completely unprofessional and nothing close to knowledgeable. He left the office with a prescription for glasses (smh.. why would the doctor give him an RX before getting his eye looked at?!) and confused on what just happened. I would never recommend this location to anyone with any sense in their head. Because, more then likely you have more sense then this doctor.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationTracy K.Business Owner9/11/2020Hi Annie,We take our customers experience very seriously and we apologize that your recent trip in was not up to our usual level of service. column1: Jim P.Phoenix, AZ21409/13/2020I have never heard of an insurance agent that doesn't have a direct e-mail system...you have to call in person.  His official farmers site has direct email but wont let you leave a message only your phone number which defeats the point of email.  I dont like talking on the phone. Oh well.I only left 3 stars because I have to leave something or I cant post.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJayson H.Business Owner9/22/2020Jim,I would love to chat. This is a Farmers issue that I can't fix. I understand you don't want to chat on the phone however as you read all my reviews say they met me in person. A 3 star review isn't horrible but I would like the ability to earn your business and earn a 5 star review (I hope). I am happy to do a face to face as I never write insurance over email or rarely over the phone. Insurance is never written properly over the phone or email. Discounts are always missing, coverages are always missing. I almost died July 2, 2002 from an 89yr old man running a stop sign. I learned very quickly how insurance is supposed to be written. My settlement check, almost dying was $7,147 which was supposed to cover my injuries forever. I suffer headache 3-6 times a week, so far for 18 years. That $7,147 is a joke. I explain all this in an appt. This is why I don't recommend a phone or email insurance policy. At the end of the day, clients decide what they want after they have been educated. Please, lets do a face to face, or I will ask to update a review. 3 stars hurts our agency. Thanks for understanding!jhoffer@farmersagent.com480-518-0747 cell - call before 10pm 7 days a week.480-948-6115 officeRead more

Please, lets do a face to face, or I will ask to update a review. 3 stars hurts our agency. Thanks for understanding!jhoffer@farmersagent.com480-518-0747 cell - call before 10pm 7 days a week.480-948-6115 officeRead more

column1: Bill J.Geneva, IL0152/12/2021Poor was job, left back end of car filthy.  Water looked dirty prior to car being washed.  Just another fly by night car wash , which doesn't care about quality just cares about the quantity of drivers it can get through its sprinkler system.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationDavid M.Business Owner2/12/2021Hi Bill,I’m sorry to hear you feel you had this experience but are you confident you have the right wash? As you can see from our stellar 4.5+ star reviews on all social media, we are NOT just another wash. We are a family owned business and I am personally on site almost every single day. We use 100% fresh, reverse osmosis and deionized water and spend more on our chemistry than any other wash in the state. We are the exclusive developers of our very own Ceramic Shield Process and have a chemical cost that is approximately 2x higher than your average operator. As car fanatics, we obsess with being the best and ensuring our process cleans, shines and protects your vehicle. We would love to invite you back to the wash to come tour our facility as well as give you a Ceramic Shield Process on us so we can educate you all about everything that goes into it. Give us the chance, and I assure you we can change your mind. Just ask for myself or Dustin when you come back by!Thank you,David MillerOwner, Wash WerksRead more

column1: Jason M.Gilbert, AZ38122110/23/2019First off, let me be real. I cancelled my last membership because it was just ok, but not great.That said, I tried the highest-tier option Wash Werks had and dude was talking about some "acryllic coating" or some such sales-man's pitch, but was like whatever man let's do this.I rolled up, my man handed me an individually-wrapped "wet-wipe" for your dash and steering wheel, and another individually wrapped air-freshener square you put under your seat right before your cars about to shine. (Damn, color me impressed at this point.)Ya'll... When my car came out, even the bumpers were shining like the metallic hood and trunk (bumpers aren't metallic anymore and usually aren't as shiny for this reason.) This car wash is like the honey badger. This car wash don't care. This car wash don't give a F*#k!!!! It's about to make everything that goes through it shine and make you proud, like you're taking a pornstar to the prom! When you're done, they have complimentary (free) vacuums and air-hoses to blast away any residual wet spots so your baby is looking glossy and not spotty like Sprint's coverage. In  another unexpected perk, the dressing that went on my rims and tires, made the black shine like it was just elected President. I didn't know black rims and tires could shine like that.I bought my Tesla, brand new, from the factory.  It came out here shining way brighter than the day I picked it up from the factory.This car wash is legit! That acryllic game their talking about isn't idle noise! Get that shit!!!!!Obviously, I bought that top-level membership immediately!!!!Useful 4Funny 3CoolBusiness owner informationDavid M.Business Owner10/23/2019Jason,Let me begin by saying that was hands down the greatest yelp review we have read in all our days. column1: John C.Elite '2021Billings, MT386117367489/25/20203 photosI'd say the experience overall was good but could use some improvement. Scheduled an appointment over the phone on a Saturday afternoon for a Monday morning drop-off. Got there about 15 minutes before the scheduled appointment and was checked in within a couple of minutes. Got the shuttle to drop me off at the house (I was told they service a 20 mile radius) and got them to take me back later in the day. My truck was serviced and ready to go within 4 hours. I had the initial 5,000 mile service completed on a Duramax which includes oil and filter, tires, and an inspection. An issue I had with the remote clicker not being able to remote start the engine was an issue I had and got diagnosed as a low voltage reading on the battery: it was replaced at no charge. My feedback: one of the shuttle drivers could not locate my house even with the correct address and was very frustrated on the phone; the check-in was very mechanical and the service tech did not introduce himself, which would have been nice; I called from one number but asked to have all communication sent to another number and that request was not met. But in the grand scheme of things the overall experience was far better than I have had at most dealerships.Useful 1Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationCoulter A.Business Customer Service9/28/2020Thank you for your kind words! column1: Whitney S.Las Vegas, NV9224113/30/20173 photosDecided to try the new neighborhood coffee shop today at the suggestion of a friend. First off, I will say this place is very cute. It is a good spot to meet up with a friend or just sit and work on your laptop; very quiet. It is immaculately clean.  There are plenty of places to sit inside and there was a sign inside suggesting the addition of patio seating soon, which will be nice. I ordered the cafe latte with macadamia nut flavor added. I am not exactly a coffee connoisseur but am an avid coffee drinker with plenty of experience trying different roasts and blends. I thought the coffee was just ok. I think it would have been better if a stronger brew was used for this type of drink; I tasted more of the flavoring and the milk. In addition to the drinks offered, there was a nice assortment of gelato (upwards of 10 flavors) and numerous desserts. All of the desserts are homemade per staff. The desserts looked very good but I would just suggest a different presentation instead of having them covered in saran wrap. I could tell that the cakes were iced beautifully but the saran wrap mushed it down and made it unattractive. I think I will give their coffee another shot, but will just try a regular cup of jo before completely passing judgement.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationEdward R.Business Owner3/31/2017Thank you so for your kind words. We have been working very hard to be ready for our grand opening. In this time we will be baking all of our pastries in house and implementing a widely expanded breakfast menu. We have covered the cakes to maintain freshness until our big grand opening event. We would love the opportunity to make your drink again for you. Please email us at eat@zikizwraps.com to tell us more.Read more

column1: Kevin L.Reno, NV35125318557/2/2017That was not a croissant. It's advertised as one, sold as one, but no: it was a dense loaf of bread shaped to look like a croissant, glazed on top with some unidentifiable sweetness. A solid disappointment if there ever was one in the croissant department. Do some folks not know what these are? They are the best-know gem in the world of morning pastries. Croissants are light, buttery, flakey, and golden; the opposite of which this was is heavy, dry, spongy, and monochromatic. This was sacrilege. Coffee?  Coffee is served in a gas-station inspired paper cup, even if you're staying for a spell. The taste was similar. Not bad, but not memorable. How about atmosphere, you ask? Cupz is clean. Big windows. Kind of goes for the Modern Blah motif. Free wi-fi. The killer, though, what chases a seated customer out the door: a display case cooler rattling out of control. Isn't this place new? Why the faulty equipment? An endless annoyance turning off, then on, then off, then ON again. SHUT UP. JUST SHUT UP. So why the generous three stars? Two reasons:-- they offer fresh-fruit smoothies, which is a rarity in this town. I just hope they are good. Bonus just for offering. -- a super-sweet young woman serving by herself. She was cheerful, helpful, patient, and just an easy-going delight. The latter was even more notable because I soon overheard the owner/manager some others have griped about in their reviews. I'm the only customer in there so I can't imagine how anything could be stressful at the moment, but he's swearing and giving gruff directions to this cool chick like some dude wrestling with his inner machismo. How she remains upbeat with him as her only company, I dunno. So far as I can tell, she's the best thing going for Cupz, so maybe chill out, stressball. I'd stop in if I needed a coffee or smoothie on my way to/from Blue or RedRock, but not worth going out of one's way for.Useful 5Funny 4Cool 3Business owner informationEdward R.Business Owner7/2/2017Thank you so much for your patronage. Could you please tell us more by email at eat@zikizwraps.com. We would really like to understand your experience a lot better because the person that you speak of was not even there during the time that you were there so we would like to understand who would be speaking to our employees that way.Read more

column1: Julia M.Elite '2021Charlotte, NC343116586212/11/2011Updated review1 photoThis place is so inconsistent... some visits have been really good and others not so good. I really do wish these guys would up their game!   Yesterday's visit rated only 2 stars because there were issues with both the service we received and with the food.  For starters, it was a bit busier than normal because of the Groupon special.  When we arrived, we were told the wait would be 15-20 mins, but it turned out to be 30+ mins.   However, we decided to wait, because by the time we got in the car to drive somewhere else, we would have burned that much time anyway.So, when we were finally seated, the waitress came by pretty quickly to serve us coffee and take our order.  She left the carafe on the table, which is nice, but sadly, she did not check on how much coffee was in it, because when we were ready for a refill, the carafe was empty. That wouldn't be so bad, except for the fact that our server disappeared and did not come back to check on us.   In fact, our food was brought to the table by someone else and then she finally reappeared.  It took her a while to fill the carafe and return it to the table.  Now, for the food... it was a disappointment all the way around.  David ordered an omelette, which was cold and pretty flavorless. Plus, he said it was a litte runny from being undercooked. I ordered one of the specials - gingerbread pancakes w/side of scrambled eggs and chicken sausage. The eggs were cold. The gingerbread pancakes were cold and did not taste at all like gingerbread.  They simply tasted like whole wheat pancakes.  In fact, I asked our server if they had brought the correct plate because not only did the pancakes not taste like gingerbread, they were missing the side of cranberry compote.  Which she said they had run out of (it would have been nice to know that upfront).I'll give them one more chance, but if its not a good experience, I may just stick to Le Peep instead.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationNoreen E.Business Owner1/7/2012Julie, thank you for your feedback on Skillets. Sorry to hear your most recent experience wasn't as expected. Please ask to speak to Angela or Brock our managers, if you should encounter any of these issues again. Thank you for returning and I hope you come again and try some of our most recent winter warmer dishes such as -Shepherd's Pie.Read more7/15/2011Previous reviewWent to meet a friend for lunch today and decided to try the Spanish Omelette this time. It was very good - definitely rich and creamy.  The potatoes were not exactly what I was expecting but they were good. Instead of traditional home fries or hash browns, these potatoes were shredded and baked in creamy/cheesy casserole style. In addition to potatoes, it also included a small cup of fruit and your choice of toast.  It is a lot  of food so take your appetite with your (or do like I did and take half of it home for later!)  My friend got the cranberry pecan belgian waffle and it looked outstanding! Again, I was pleased with the quality of the food and the service was fine on this visit as well.Read more5/28/2011Previous reviewJust went back for my second visit - I would say this place really rates 3.5 stars but not quite a 4.    The first visit was during the week  at lunch time and today's visit was Saturday at around 10:50.  On both visits, our wait time was under 10 minutes.  (However, we once tried to go once on a Sunday and the line was out the door so we didn't even try to get in.) The place is open, sunny and cheery with a sort of country-kitchen  decor. The service has been so-so on both of my visits, but not terrible.  But no matter, the food  was good.  Today I had blueberry-banana whole wheat pancakes with scrambled eggs. The dish also comes with 2 pieces of thick-cut smokehouse bacon.  However since I don't eat pork, I asked for the chicken apple sausage in lieu of the bacon.  The pancakes had good flavor and texture. (The syrup was decent, but they really should serve pure maple without charging extra for it.)  The scrambled eggs were tasty with a nice texture and the sausage had nice flavor and textrure as well. David ordered the potato pancakes with scrambled egg whites and pork sausage.  He thought the potato-pancakes were pretty good but he prefers applesauce rather than the diced apples (just a personal preference on his part).   The coffee is decent - not the best in the world, and not the worst.  We do like the fact that they bring a carafe to your table so you don't have to wait for refills. (This is a big deal for me & David - we need our coffee!) The only thing that almost ruined today's experience for me was the fact that after our orders were put in, our server came over and told me that there would be a charge for substituting the chicken sausage for the bacon.  I said that was fine.  But he didn't explain what he really meant is that I would be charged for the plate (including the bacon) plus charged for a side order of chicken sausage (despite the fact that I did not get  bacon - If I had known that, I would have just kept the bacon on my plate - to give to David - and ordered a side of Chicken Sausage).  Now, don't get me wrong,  I have no problem paying an "upcharge" when the item I want to substitute costs MORE than the item that comes on the plate... but when the item I wanted costs LESS than the item that I asking to leave off, I think it is silly for the restaurant to charge more.  (Plus, it just leaves a bad taste in my mouth and makes me think twice about whether I want to go back or not.) In the case of the bacon here- (which I did NOT want ) - a side order costs $3.95 while a side of the chicken sausage costs $3.50.  We did complain at the checkout and said that we were willing to pay a "upcharge"  but we did not think it was fair to simply be charged for a side order of chicken sausage when we didn't also get the bacon.  So, the hostess/manager quickly took care of it  and took the extra charge off our bill. I thanked her for taking care of it, but I have to say the restaurant needs to rethink their policy because a lot of people may have just walked away angry. The prices were pretty standard  for breakfast places that we frequent  (between $26 - $28 for 2 before tip).Read more
column2: Business owner informationNoreen E.Business Owner1/7/2012Julie, thank you for your feedback on Skillets. Sorry to hear your most recent experience wasn't as expected. column1: John H.Elite '2021Charlotte, NC361160414125/16/2011Capital Y-U-M!  This place is great for breakfast/brunch.  Haven't tried their lunch yet, but they are only open during the day for these meals specifically.  My first trip we lucked out and didn't have much of a wait but if you time it incorrectly it seems to be a popular spot.  If you do have a wait, there are some inviting benches in the entrance and the turn-over seems pretty quick.I tried their corned beef hash, eggs, and hash browns.  Really was blown away with their buttery hash browns - I guess I had become complacent with having generic (sometimes burnt too much) hash browns at certain other breakfast places that stay open 24hrs and will not be named.  The servings are very generous and definitely has their own unique "skillet's" spin on it.The dining room is cozy and we actually got into a conversation with the table next to us.  Apparently the word on the street is that skillets is family owned and the owner's husband is very crafty with wood.  He created all the benches and furniture in the place which adds a nice touch and feel in ambiance points.  The room actually made me feel like I was eating a home cooked meal up in the mountains with all the wood work and the rooster paraphernalia around.I don't find myself on this end of town very much, but if I do - this is definitely the "go-to" breakfast place.Useful 3FunnyCool 1Business owner informationNoreen E.Business Owner1/10/2012So glad you classify us as Y-U-M John. We always offer fresh food made from scratch along with freshly baked signature SKILLETS SCONES hourly. Thank you for your positive feedback.Read more
column2: Business owner informationNoreen E.Business Owner1/10/2012So glad you classify us as Y-U-M John. We always offer fresh food made from scratch along with freshly baked signature SKILLETS SCONES hourly. Thank you for your positive feedback.Read more

column1: Bryan P.Marietta, GA056/3/2011We visited on a recent Sunday morning and the good news is our wait to get a table was not that bad - maybe 20 minutes. But that's where the good news ends.Once inside, maybe another 5-10 minutes before our server stopped by. Then another 5 minutes or so to get untensils and water. Then, another 40 minutes for our food to arrive!! During this time, no communication from the server, no smiling faces or apology from anyone on the staff. When our food finally arrived it was stone cold! If we hadn't waited so long, we would have sent the food back; but at this rate we would have been there all day.  After mentioning the problem to our server, he did the right thing and gave us the meal free. Even still, not once did anyone from the front of the house stop by to say one thing. Passed by our table often to frantically bus or set tables nearby, but couldn't be bothered to acknowledge the issue. Even when we left, no "thank you" or "come again" from the hostess. Basically they really could not have cared less about us as customers.
