column1: Jeff W.Waxhaw, NC131165/13/2020Updated reviewYou were the one that told me I could have the phone repaired on Saturday. It was the reason I chose your business over others. This was not a mistake on my part, this was an error on yours. With that said, the right thing to do would be to return my deposit but you did not. That's being petty if you ask me. For the record, I took my phone to a competitor who had it fixed for me within 1 hr. of walking in to their store. They were also $40 cheaper than you. I hope the $20 deposit you took from me was worth it. You live and learn.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationScott L.Business Owner5/18/2020Jeff, we've been in business a long time now, and we wouldn't be able to say that if we did anything like the shady practices you're describing here. Please understand that whether you're dealing with a phone repair shop, an auto repair shop, or really any kind of business in any kind of industry whatsoever, there's a reason why the popular term used is "estimate" rather than "guarantee." Every technician gives an estimate for how long they think a repair or job will take, but that estimate is exactly what it sounds like: an honest approximation of the time, parts, labor, and costs involved. Once the phone is opened up -- just like a car, an air conditioner, a computer, or whatever -- there's always a possibility that the expert will learn more about the problem at hand, and this new information can alter the original timing of the estimate. While we can understand how that'd be frustrating from a consumer's standpoint, it's also the reality of practically every industry and business on earth. We hope you can understand this even if you can't appreciate it, and we wish you all the best moving forward.Respectfully,Mason Lambert, ManagerRead more5/5/2020Previous reviewI went here because they told me they could have my phone fixed on a Saturday. I gave them a deposit so they could order my parts. Well, saturday came and went and no phone call to bring my phone in. It's now Tuesday, still no call. I called them to ask that they refund my deposit and they refused! Be cautious if you use this place and DO NOT give them a deposit. They have lost my business.Read more

column1: Guy M D.Waxhaw, NC0516/19/2020Here is the whole story, you decide: When I called they told me they would charge me $35 to open and clean it out and let it air out overnight after using some alcohol to help dry it out. I let them know I need the phone for work in the morning and 10am is too late. She said not problem, come in and we will take care of it immediately and have it done by closing. So I head over and drop off my phone. I ran some errands and headed back over at 5:20. I walked in and I asked if the phone was ready and she said yes but.....When we removed your screen the water shifted and fried the screen because it went out while he was working on it (so sounds like he left it on while he was working on it). So we changed your screen for you (without asking me) since you said you use it for work. Also the Face ID still doesn't work.They were really nice about it and instead of charging me $35 plus $150 for the screen they charged me $90 total. I told her I appreciate the consideration to fix it for me so I can use it for work but I wouldn't have given them permission to fix it as I could just go buy a new phone since that's half of what I owe on the phone. I then noticed that the back camera had condensation in it still. I told her they just need to pick up the camera and wipe under it. The woman said it's all one piece so I need a new camera but they don't have any in stock. It's another $85 for that. I said I'm pretty sure it's 2 pieces but she told me it was indeed one. I told her had I known all of this I definitely wouldn't had fixed it since that's the same amount I owe on the phone and could just buy a new one since I would at least have a warranty on the work. I walked out and as I went to place a call. I noticed green muck around the front camera and a fuzz on it. I went back and after 5 minutes of them looking at it they thought it was a glare. When I pushed harder they offered to look at it closer and see if they could do anything about it. I told them no, I'd just come back another day (they seemed reluctant when they offered since it wasn't a big deal to them since it still took pictures. Also since they told me I needed a new camera anyhow and it was about 15 minutes before closing). I went back the next day and told them I was able to use my phone for work and they could keep it the rest of the day to dry and get the water they missed and finish cleaning both cameras. The woman said they would be happy to do it for $35. I told her the only reason I left was because she told me nothing could be done about the back camera and I needed a new one. Now that I know that was wrong I came back to fix it to insure no missed water could hurt my phone since they won't warranty their work due to water damage. She told me they offered to do that last night and I said no. I explained I said no because of the whole one piece camera thing. She argued that I or she must have misunderstood the question and answer (I literally pointed at the camera as I asked the question). She also said since I insisted that I needed the phone for work in the morning they couldn't keep it overnight which didn't allow for enough drying time. I explained had I known she was wrong about the once piece camera comments I would had them open the phone and dry it again before leaving or would had figured out a way to start work later in the day.She said it's his time we have to pay for and we offered to help last night. I said well I'm not paying you $35 again when all I did was go home and go to bed. It's not like I dunked it in water again. You guys missed water and when I asked about it I was told you didn't and it was a camera issue. So now I'm back because of the workmanship. She didn't budge so I walked out. Even if there was a misunderstanding and she is right about trying to explain the parts of the camera, who lets a phone go out the door with water still in the case? Or at least say, hey it's still wet, I know you need the phone but you really need to let it air dry. They are the professionals here not me.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationScott L.Business Owner6/26/2020Thank you for your extensive review, Guy. We care about what we do, and we always try to communicate effectively and charge our customers fairly. We apologize for any miscommunications, and we hope you'll reach out to us by phone to discuss the specifics of your situation one-on-one. Looking forward to setting things right,Mason Lambert, ManagerRead more

column1: Alec C.Tempe, AZ129119/25/2017First to ReviewI was the first person to live in this complex June 2016. They appear luxurious from the outside but don't be deceived, they are very cheaply built with shoddy construction. The floorboards were peeling up, our garage motor fell down because they used nails instead of screws not to mention our countertops were not secure. Three doors down a neighbor has already had problems with a termite infestation. They are overpriced for the value you receive. The amenities? Little to none. Only a small pool without a Jacuzzi. The location is in great proximity to campus for ASU students but the surrounding neighborhoods are not the best. I've had  packages stolen from the front door and multiple items stolen out of the garage. The trash pickup has been an issue from day one. Many times, it is left sitting outside for days and no one picks it up while the homeless scavenge through it. The trash guy claims he's too good to pick up a pizza or amazon box when we pay 30 dollars a month for the trash pickup service. May 2017, NorthStar Property Management took over out of Tucson. Google their reviews for yourself. Since NorthStar took over, no one is ever in the front office. The new leasing manager lacks communication, rarely responding to emails, calls, or texts. It is very frustrating when you are trying to get things accomplished. I do not recommend living here until they make some drastic changes. There are a ton of other town home communities in Tempe that offer better value. Do your research and live elsewhere.Useful 5Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationNorthStar M.Business Owner9/28/2017Hi Alec, thanks for taking the time to write us a review.We are sorry to hear you had some issues when you first moved in. With any newer construction inevitably there will need to be some minor repairs as the first wave of residents start settling in. We're not showing any current or pending work orders for your apartment, so it appears the previous management has addressed those issues for you. If you still have anything needing fixed, please let us know right away. Also we're sorry to hear you were having trouble reaching our manager, the hours that we are available is clearly posted on the front door of the office. Please remember that because of the smaller size of this community that there is not usually someone physically stationed at the office on a regular schedule (the same went for the previous management company). All showings/tours/repairs/etc are all by appointment only. Our property manager also manages another property that is only minutes away, so she can get to the property fairly quickly if needed.If for any reason our manager can't answer the phone, please leave us a voicemail and we'll return your call right away. Please be sure you are using the new office number which is (480) 757-4117, please reach out to us anytime.To address your issue with the trash being left by your door, looking at the community rules, it does appear that while the property does offer an 'at-your-door trash pickup service', all trash must be bagged and tied. Throwing out old pizza boxes on the ground in front of your apartment and leaving them there is actually a violation of our community policies. If you have any questions regarding our trash service, please let our office manager know. Again thanks for taking the time to write us a review, please let us know if you need any further assistance,John HisermanNorthStar Management & Consulting, Inc.Read more

Again thanks for taking the time to write us a review, please let us know if you need any further assistance,John HisermanNorthStar Management & Consulting, Inc.Read more

column1: Hayden E.Las Vegas, NV18551/2/2020Ordered a veggie burger, flatbread, wrap, and smoothie. 30 min wait (I understand cooked to order and fresh but come on). After I grabbed my food and left I remembered that they forgot the smoothie also, came back to ask for it, they made it previously and put in a refrigerator for the 30 minutes and it became a bland juice from sitting for so long. Also they ran out of sweet potato fries and to compensate mixed in regular fries without saying anything. Just for 40$ and 30 a minute wait there's better optionsUseful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCole C.Business Owner1/2/2020Hayden, we apologize for any inconvenience or lack of service.  We are actually in day 2 of a new cook/chef.That should only explain the wait.  But, he was making a delivery as other staff couldn’t drive, and the staff there has been on record, slower then we are comfortable.  I can’t make sense of the smoothie issue, and will address that with them, and hopefully correct immediately.Please find your way back to us this weekend, I plan to be there all day Sunday, and would love to provide you a better experience than you had today.In all honesty, this review helps me make the hard decisions, as the service has been subpar, and will be addressed, as current employees are about to be shown how to appropriately serve guests, or be asked to leave.  You can email me, I would love to chat and offer a solution to your experience.Thank you,MMG ownership.Read more

column1: Keith C.Los Angeles, CA6963210/23/2019This was my second bad experience with customer service at this location, and I will no longer be giving my business to this location. First issue was resolved after arguing back and forth with the employees about the rewards system not working properly, then the owner resolved and I placed several 10 meal plan orders with no problem, and several one off meals that were always good. This is not a random bashing, or just trying to start stuff. Especially when I have no complaints about the food, which I think is good. But I cannot continue to give my money to a company that has such absolutely horrific customer service. Today's incident was the last straw.-I placed a 10 meal plan order to be ready at 11:10am.-I didn't arrive until 1:55pm, 2 hours and 45mins after the food would be ready. (This is not relevant)-When I arrived, my food was sitting on the counter. - I was on my phone, didn't realize the length of time at that moment how long it would of been sitting there.-halfway home (5mins) it dawns on me chicken/steak can't be out after 2 hours, along with a warm salads now. I call back and ask for a manager. The exact response is "uhmmmmmmmm okayyyy????" As if what I am asking for is an absurd request. This is always the type of customer service I receive via the employees. Rude, flat, condescending tones on the vast majority of visits. The owner was literally the only one who was a cool dude and I would talk with a bit when visiting.-Justin comes on the phone, I know his name because I specifically asked. I verbatim said "I placed this order, it's been sitting out for almost 3 hours, I need the food replaced I will have my gf come back and drop it off. She is going to go the gym, and will pick up the new order at 4pm so the new order is fresh. He verbatim said okay will be ready at 4pm. I once AGAIN said okay great so she will leave the gym and see you at 4pm. He said okay sounds good or something similar to that effect. My girlfriend arrives, and the lady with glasses immediately tells her she can't take the food back and she called the owner because the food has left the restaurant so they can't take it back. They call me, put me on speaker. Justin says "I never said I would take the food back". This is verbatim what he said. I respond "you're saying I am lying about you would take the food back? Wtf would I send my gf down here with the food then?" I literally was floored. I would rather have someone curse me out than to call me a liar. That's just the cloth I'm cut from and my morals personally.Justin: You said you would drop the food off, not that we would give you new replacement food.Me: Why would I drop off food I already paid for, and not get replacement food?Justin: I just said yes you can drop the food offMe: Why...would I drop off...food...that I paid for...and not get replacement food?Justin: repeats same thing.Me: This would make no sense. If anything, I would keep the food I paid for, not send my gf back to drop it off. Also, you said the new food would be ready specifically at 4pm when my gf was done with the gym. That literally implies/is understood, that NEW food is being picked up at 4pm. This isn't a concept or situation that would or could be misinterpreted.At this point, everyone started yelling at my girlfriend, the lady continuously was talking over me when I was on speaker and my girlfriend asked her to let me speak and stop talking over me. She continued to talk over me when I was talking. But for them to take something so basic and simple, as them not refrigerating chicken/steak/salad, after being left out on the counter for 2hours and 45mins, not willing to replace it, then literally telling me on the phone via Justin yes we will replace it, CONFIRMING the 4pm pickup time for the new food (this is how it's impossible for confusion: if he thought I was just "dropping off the old food" which in itself makes 0 logical sense when I already paid for it, why would he agree SPECIFICALLY to a 4pm pickup time of the new food? That literally means he is replacing the old food with new food that would be ready for pickup at 4pm.)   It's so insulting and rude you're literally calling me a liar. I talked to you 10 mins ago. Do you think I would randomly send my girlfriend down there if this wasn't already discussed? Do you think I'm trying to scam some new hot meals? What would my motive be? Why in the world would I do that? I literally already paid for my food, there is no "angle" possible. This is what is seriously flabbergasting.  Why have these issues NEVER happened with the 3 other meal prep companies I use? I value my time over money. I would rather pay more for a service and receive good service, than to save a few bucks and receive terrible customer service. But to literally do this to a customer, who has a verifiable track record of several meal plan orders, and random single orders over the course of a year, is just terrible.Useful 1Funny 2CoolBusiness owner informationCole C.Business Owner10/24/2019You may feel it is “not relevant” but that’s a huge point in your frustration.You ordered at 10:10 to pick up at 11:10.We don’t open until 10:30, which means everything we made for you was fresh and ready in a short period of time after you placed the online order.Quick note, cooked food can stay out in a controlled environment, and when prepared hot, should not be put into a fridge until after it has had a chance to cool to acceptable temps for prevention of bacateria build up in a hot to immediate cold environment.Keith, I’ve met you several times, and you have been a customer for a few meal plan orders as well as several take out orders.  There has never been an issue, you’ve made me aware of, in the past.We take the time to make your order and have it ready, fresh for when you ask.  11:10.  It was ready at 11:10am.  I know as I helped make it, before leaving at 11am for a catering delivery.  I am sorry the interaction with my cook, Justin, was misinformed or misleading or incorrect.  And his commitment to you shouldn’t have given the impression we could take the food back.  I do wish you would have reached me directly for a resolution and explanation before committing this amount of time to social media, with incorrect and false claims about us as a company.The manager, with glasses, is an owner, and was told to shut up by you girlfriend, when explaining the situation.  That’s not a way to resolve a situation.  Nor should there be an expectation that you can order fresh cooked food, and we would Immediately refrigerate it.  You came later than you initially claimed when you placed your order, and are now frustrated and complaining it needed to be remade without cost, where we don’t have refrigeration to store everyone’s meals that get ordered. If you wouldn’t have picked up for several more hours, we would have put in the fridge for you.  But your food was out of 90 minutes in containers in bags, awaiting your arrival.  We are a business, and as a customer for a year, you would hopefully appreciate our service and quality.  But after a year, you chose to open forum bad mouth is based on your late arrival and repercussions subsequently following.I apologize you feel wronged.  But my staff and co-Owner are instructed we cannot take food back, that has already left the building.   Also, they are instructed they should not tolerate disrespect from a customer when it’s given, as your girlfriend was clearly aggressive in her communication.Regardless,  sorry for your experience.  And if refrigerated food is your preference, as you mentioned there is plenty of options in town.  We are sorry to lose your business, but understand your position.Lastly, if you knew you were going to be late, and not make it at 11:10 as you agreed when placing the order, you could always call and ask us to put in fridge until you arrived, if it was as serious as it now seems to be.We wish this ended differently, but also understand what decisions are needed to be made.Thank you,Cole C.Your comment deserved better attention, and sorry for that, but your girlfriends is blatantly not worthy of civility.I don’t disagree with the outcome, as we couldn’t take the food back and just remake yours (for anyone reading it was a large meal plan, not just one item) But we couldn’t spoken directly, as we have many times, and handled it.  There was and is nothing wrong with that food.  Hope you at least are enjoying it after all this.Read more

column1: Samson S.Los Angeles, CA857/9/2019This is in the running for the most bizarre customer service experience of my life.   Came in as a new customer for a men's haircut with Leah, let me preface-- she is a talented hairstylist, the review is NOT about quality of cut, the 1 star review reflects the abysmal customer service and manners shown by the owner (mainly) and the hairstylist (secondly). My haircut was booked as a $45 dollar men's haircut, supposed to take in ballpark of 40-45 minutes.   Leah, was wanting to communicate constantly including asking me how I felt about the cut every 5 minutes along the way, assumingly she wanted to do a great job so I would return and possibly even tell more people about the business makes sense right? ... She spent about 1 hour and 15 minutes on the cut (WHICH I HAD NO IDEA OF UNTIL WE FINISHED) I had no problem as I had no more commitments that day, I paid, left her a tip, we shake hands all is good... or so I thought.    When I returned for a follow up cut the next month, I literally get pulled aside by the hairstylist Leah who was bent out of shape and disturbed with me that she spent 1 hour 15 minutes on my haircut and didn't charge more money.. (BUT SAID ABSOLUTELY NOTHING ABOUT IT BEING AN ISSUE DURING MY INITIAL HAIRCUT), so while I am trying to respond to Leah and tell her how I perceived what happened the OWNER of the salon, literally came over and sat down in the chair in front of me with a wide eyed, crazy scathing look on her face to further interrogate me and issue stern warning that Leah could only spend 45 minutes on my cut or the price would go up to $65.... Let me reiterate, I did nothing other than initially book a regular men's haircut with this place and the hairstylist went over without saying a word about it while it was happening or immediately after and I didn't realize we went over... maybe the stylist should keep eyes on the time and communicate with me that we have to stop??  How at all is that my fault??  HAVE NEVER EXPERIENCED anything remotely like this and have gotten my haircut for 25 years...  Oh, and during the owner's rant at me.. she exclaimed  "LEAH IS THE BEST HAIRSTYLIST IN THE CITY!!! I CALLED HER FOR 5 MONTHS TO COME WORK FOR ME!!" Ummm what does this have to do with my haircut running over time??  Completely Bizarre, unprofessional, rude, and undeserving of my hard earned money even with the decent haircut, I would have rather gone to fantastic Sam's and saved my self the trouble of dealing with such lunacy.  Good riddance to this place.Useful 1Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationAmanda W.Business Owner7/16/2019Thank you for coming in, Samson. We understand that you were unsatisfied with your service after your second haircut at our salon. We had no issues addressing any questions during the service; in fact we love to educate our guests on our services and products used to maintain their look. We will check in with our guests if we feel the guest is showing signs of uneasiness or continuously interrupts the service. We understand that you need constant verification and reassurance about your haircut while it is being cut. We want to ensure the best quality outcome for our clients, especially if a guest has expressed dissatisfaction elsewhere. With that being said, we charge for our time and we will always inform our guests ahead of time if the standard price changes. We understand that telling you the price before you pay and setting the expectation for the service made you feel uncomfortable. We understand these things are difficult to discern and can be stressful, which is why the I had to help Leah explain the expectation and price for the service. We always strive to provide clarity in this area for guests to have a good service and enjoy their experience. We’re sorry that you see this as “bizarre, unprofessional (and) rude..” You were given two awesome haircuts. We will go ahead and cancel your third pre-booked appointment and wish you the best of luck in finding a salon home.Read more

column1: Jason D.Las Vegas, NV813554/9/2016This gym is disgusting. I've never seen a single cleaner here and it really shows. Yes there's hard  after in Las Vegas but their water fountain is absolutely disgusting and it shows. Their urinal is closed in the men's room and the smell of shit is seeping out into the main fitness area. They do have a full lifting rack which is great but this is a small overpriced gym for lifters. There's roughly 6 treadmills 4 elliptical 3 stair steppers which is cool and the Dumbbells go up high enough to fit anyone's needs (200 lbs) but I'm sorry I cannot go back this place is utterly disgusting. My girlfriend when she goes without me gets lots of inappropriate looks. I cannot recommend this gym to anyone. Get your shit together.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationEdge F.Business Manager5/19/2016Jason, we are so sorry you felt this way and had this experience. column1: Valencia D.Elite '2021Scottsdale, AZ30322167611/1/2019If you are looking to paint, and want to ensure your home is safe from toxic chemicals may I recommend Sherwin Williams?  My favorite color options they offer is their various whites.  Some brilliant whites that go with everything and brightens up every room without that cold, blue feeling some whites give off.  Sherwin Williams has the best LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification program compliance paints.  Meaning: they meet the U.S. Green Building Council's requirements for standards for environmentally sustainable construction, as well as meeting the highest safety standards for exposure to people, read: children.  They offer zero VOC and no alkylphenol ethoxylates (APEs) in the Harmony Interior paint line.  You WANT this for your family, your children, your home.   The service here has always been fantastic and I appreciate that they always offer you the specials or deals they have at the time and give you options to save money.  The different color options are amazing and up to date with what is modern and contemporary.  Happy Painting!Useful 16Funny 10Cool 16Business owner informationCustomer ServiceBusiness Customer Service11/3/2019Hi Valencia, Thank you for recommending your local Sherwin-Williams store! column1: Jessica G.Elite '2021Charlotte, NC9296132/13/20211 photoMy friend and I decided to try somewhere new for lunch and I'm glad we did. We arrived at about 12:45 and were given the choice between indoor or covered balcony seating with heaters by every table. We picked the balcony, and the hostess had no problem when we asked to sit at a table farther from other parties. We were given cornbread and honey butter and I ordered the she crab soup to start. Delicious! The short rib sandwich special that the waiter described sounded too good to pass up, and it was! I felt like the entire sandwich melted in my mouth. My friend thought her crab cakes were too salty but did enjoy her mimosa. I will definitely keep Pump House in mind in the future.She-Crab SoupUseful 1FunnyCool 1Business owner informationChristopher J.Business Manager2/14/2021Thank you for joining us and for the great five-star review, Jessica!  We look forward to the next visit!Read more

column1: Jessica P.Elite '2021Albuquerque, NM1723825671/5/2021Okay, let's just talk about how awesome this massive brick building is.... right on the waterfront!  You walk in and there is the hostess, nothing else there, except an elevator and the stairs.... fancy? Creepy?  What did I walk into?What I walked into was a well oiled machine for reservations, getting people seated, and getting greeted by name (ingenious!). I didn't have a reservation and just wanted to sit at the bar.  She called up my name and the number of my barstool and away I went in the elevator, "top floor please".  Only one table per elevator ride, yeah, I rode COVID free, alone!  I get up to the roof and I'm greeted immediately, by name, and shown to my seat.   Okay, not creepy, fancy!  I wanted a local brew and decided on an espresso porter, hello!  It was sooooo good!  Now onto food. I'm not terribly hungry, although I wish I was!  One page menu,  you know it's legit!Venison or black and blue?  Well they ran out of venison (seasonal menus, which I love!  Means they make what's fresh and what they have, NOT the frozen crap you see with places with 100 page menus!). So the choice is made black and blue....Holy shnikes, legit foodgasm!  I'm gonna be real for just a minute and say, the explosions of flavor in my mouth were not normal. This is another level of holiness. The beef tenderloin is a perfect mid-rare, with a touch more rare, chimichurri, whipped Gorgonzola , all on top of 3 slices of a baguette and soaking in a cajun butter. Now any of these would pair nicely on their own with the tenderloin..... think infomercial, "wait there's more".... every bite was an exploration of all of my tastebuds.... you, my chef, are potentially my new life partner!  The bartenders were so nice (switched halfway thru my meal and I'm sorry I don't remember names.... younger kid joking around with me, The Ohio State Won kiddo and man with the beard and glass we shot the shit for a bit)I am so sorry I do not live closer, HOWEVER, road trip worthy, 4hrs I'm in the car,  and I will be planning another one in a few weeks, just to eat here... sound crazy?  Not for me, food whore at your service!  I can't wait to try more!!!  I will be making sure that I have a crazy appetite, I want dessert too...I wonder if they supply wheelchairs for those that overindulge and can't walk after an awesome meal?  If you don't give this place a whirl, kick your own ass!Useful 4Funny 3Cool 5Business owner informationChristopher J.Business Manager1/6/2021Jessica,Thank you for the amazing and very descriptive five-star review!  We certainly appreciate you stopping in and will be patiently waiting for your return.  We look forward to your next visit!Christopher JohnsonGeneral ManagerRead more

column1: Michael W.Elite '2021Winterset, IA110163644/24/20211 photo1 check-in5 star without question. Building, atmosphere, wait staff and food. It was a complete package. I ordered the Tuna and a side order of the grits. Absolutely amazing food. The tuna was cooked perfectly over a bed of grits and a slaw. It gave you 2 very distinct flavors and worked separately as well as in one glorious bite. We also shared some of the deserts. Specifically a chocolate brownie type cake and the crepe brûlée. column1: Stephanie T.Pittsburgh, PA104671810/29/2010I went here for dinner with a couple friends about a month ago. Seeing as Italian is one of my absolute favorite cuisines, I have a slight bias towards Italian restaurants.I ordered the Ravioli of the Day, which consisted of Sweet Potato and Goat Cheese Ravioli in a light butter sauce topped with walnuts. (Sounds absolutely divine, right?) Upon first bite, I thought the dish was DELICIOUS. After the third, I was completely and utterly sick of it. In hindsight, I realize the sweet potato was TOO sweet and totally overpowered the sourness of the goat cheese and richness of the butter sauce. The walnut topping definitely helped balance out the sweetness, but it was still too much. I could barely get through 5 bites before my taste buds conceded defeat.My companion diners seemed to enjoy their dishes, but perhaps it was due to their ordering simpler menu items (gnocchi with alfredo sauce) or choosing dishes that are typically on their menu every day. I'm guessing it might be the latter, since sweet potato seems to be more of an autumnal menu item.Aside from the food, the ambiance was pleasant and "romantic" and the service was decent (nothing atrocious, but also nothing to write home about). Perhaps I just need to give them a second try, but seeing as there are hundreds of other dining options in Pittsburgh, I highly doubt they'll be given that chance anytime soon.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationSusan P.Business Owner2/8/2012Hi and I want to thank you for commenting. I am very proud of the food service and ambiance we offer at PIZZUTTI'S and I do not get to go on line to check for reviews as much as I should. No big corporation here. PIZZUTTI'S does every thing with love and a devotion to delight our guests.  Had I seen your comments, I would have mentioned that we have never done a sweet potato and goat cheese ravioli and our menu has never included gnocchi with Alfredo Sauce. I am confused. If you asked for gnocchi with an Alfredo sauce we would accomodate, but it has never been on my menu. I am  happy you came to PIZZUTTI'S and we look forward to serving you again soon!Introduce yourself when you are in and I will be more than happy to talk with you about your thoughts and our menu choices.Read more

Their chai is like no other I've had, and it a delightful treat. Iced tea is reasonably priced, comes in 32oz (yay) and tastes amazing unsweetened. The staff is always friendly and smiling. A few months ago, before we moved to the neighborhood, I spent a few hours working here, and enjoyed the small friendly crowd and was never made to feel unwelcome for spending so much time. column1: Mark H.Toronto, Canada695107/11/2013I signed up for a Yelp account just to warn people about this place. I walked into Taste of Mediterranean today for lunch and saw the man behind the counter drop tongs on the floor, pick them up and place them on the counter. No washing, no wiping, no big deal.This seems suspicious, but I thought "okay, maybe he's going to wash them later... he just wants to do my order first - obviously not using the floor-tongs."I ordered the quarter chicken, rice, potatoes special as advertised in the window. He picked up the tongs that were JUST on the floor and used them to pick up the piece of chicken from the warming tray. That is disgusting and unsafe. I can't help but wonder what safety standards he ignores when a customer isn't standing right in front of him. I strongly suggest everyone to avoid this restaurant.UsefulFunny 1Cool 1Business owner informationTaste Of M.Business Owner4/3/2014First of all thanks for the feedback and comment. We totally agree that what the employee did was completely wrong.We rarely have a negative Review Since we opened 10 years ago and suddenly in 2013 we started getting some Negative reviews about this Location. The problem was the management and staff and as of 2014 we have taken care of this problem. We now have completely new Management and New staff at this location.  All the new staff is now trained by franchise company directly and they are making sure on a regular basis of what's going on with this Restaurant.Read more

column1: Jenny B.Belmont, NC63816/6/2017Do not use this law firm! Sean misrepresented me in a case where my X husband tried to sue me over a cell phone bill.I was asked to put down 10,000.00 before even getting to meet with him! My parents took money out of their retirement so we could get "the best" there was and we were sadly mistaken.Because my X was "unemployed" it was impossible to receive child support. This is mainly what delayed the case. Nevertheless Seans exact words to my mother and I were, "easy as pie" that he would be able to take care of everything and NOT to worry. Instead, my parents lost a chunk of their retirement, endless nights of sleep and many tears shed because he ripped us off and he did nothing!!!After 10+ months I came up with a solution because Sean advised me to settle! I thought of the idea, not him to the terms so I could end this nightmare and almost causing me to file bankruptcy!If he tells you it's, "easy as pie" run and don't look back!  Jennifer BallardUseful 5Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationAngela M.Business Owner10/29/2017I have attempted to reach out to you to discuss your review but you haven't responded. Your review is very troubling as we do not represent people in disputes over phone bills or phone calls. Having looked into your case, I see that we did not represent you in that type of case. Your case was much more serious. Unfortunately, our ethics do not allow me to post the pleadings and all of the details of your case here so that Yelp users can make their own determination as to whether you received good service. Anyone that has used Sean as an attorney or that knows him personally knows that he would never use a phrase like "easy as pie". Lawyers are a highly regulated group and we never guarantee results. We even go as far a to have clients sign a contract acknowledging that we cannot guarantee the results. Settlement is always the right of the client. If an attorney tells you that you should consider settling the case, it's because the facts of the case mean that you can get a better deal by reaching an agreement that going in front of the judge. Your case was greatly impacted by your decision to move four hours away in the middle of your case. It's my recollection that Sean actually left our family vacation and met you to sign the settlement agreement so that you wouldn't have to drive four hours back to our office to sign it. Most people would consider that excellent service. It's also troubling that you didn't post this review until almost a year after your case had closed. We appreciate constructive criticism and feedback from clients. It helps us improve and become better lawyers.  We wish you the best of luck in the future. Angela McIlveenRead more

column1: Binish M.Grier Heights, Charlotte, NC016/9/2020I made a mistake to reach out to this company for a home inspection.  From the time we contacted this company, Joe was unprofessional and rude. We still went ahead with the company thinking to give them a chance to prove us wrong. We were told home inspection agreement will come via email soon after the appointment was confirmed but we didn't receive an email until 2 HOURS before the scheduled appointment! We were then asked to sign the agreement in a rush.  When we asked to reschedule the appointment in order to read over the agreement, we were simply told, "Find someone else." Very unprofessional, rude and childish behavior!!Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJoe F.Business Owner6/10/2020The complainer is the wife of the person I dealt with. She doesn't have all the facts. If I was rude with her husband from the time he contacted me why did he want me to do his inspection and why write a nasty review when I didn't???? He received a docusign contract at least TWELVE hours in advance of the inspection, the evening before the inspection, which had been planned about a week in advance. Honestly, I should have sent him the contract well in advance and that was an oversight on my part because I was so busy. When I realized I had forgotten to send him the contact, I contacted him and informed him of the oversight and told him to look for it in his email. I sent him a text the night before asking him to check his email and sign the contract. He could have signed it on his phone in 5 minutes! The morning of the inspection he informed me by text at 5:30 a.m. that he needed to postpone (because he didn't have time to read a one page contract). (A cancellation at the last minute is very rude to a business owner. I had to sit home that half a day and earned no income. Quite frankly I don't want to work for the type of person who wants to postpone at the last minute and thinks that's OK.) I told him my calendar was full for the next week and I could not postpone and he would have to find somebody else. (The beautiful thing about America is that he can hire whomever he wants, and, I don't have to work for people who treat me badly.) The bottom line is HE NEVER SIGNED THE CONTRACT and that is why he didn't get the inspection that he wanted. Let the reader go to Angie's List to read reviews from 200+ satisfied customers who didn't cancel at the last minute.Read more
column2: Business owner informationJoe F.Business Owner6/10/2020The complainer is the wife of the person I dealt with. She doesn't have all the facts. If I was rude with her husband from the time he contacted me why did he want me to do his inspection and why write a nasty review when I didn't???? He received a docusign contract at least TWELVE hours in advance of the inspection, the evening before the inspection, which had been planned about a week in advance. Honestly, I should have sent him the contract well in advance and that was an oversight on my part because I was so busy. When I realized I had forgotten to send him the contact, I contacted him and informed him of the oversight and told him to look for it in his email. I sent him a text the night before asking him to check his email and sign the contract. He could have signed it on his phone in 5 minutes! The morning of the inspection he informed me by text at 5:30 a.m. that he needed to postpone (because he didn't have time to read a one page contract). (A cancellation at the last minute is very rude to a business owner. I had to sit home that half a day and earned no income. Quite frankly I don't want to work for the type of person who wants to postpone at the last minute and thinks that's OK.) I told him my calendar was full for the next week and I could not postpone and he would have to find somebody else. (The beautiful thing about America is that he can hire whomever he wants, and, I don't have to work for people who treat me badly.) The bottom line is HE NEVER SIGNED THE CONTRACT and that is why he didn't get the inspection that he wanted. Let the reader go to Angie's List to read reviews from 200+ satisfied customers who didn't cancel at the last minute.Read more

column1: Stacie A.Fourth Ward, Charlotte, NC1871156/9/2020Joe from Alpha and Omega home inspectors was absolutely fantastic! He reviewed two properties for me and was extremely thorough. He explained things so that I could clearly understand the issues that needed to be fixed, provided an extremely detailed report and was extremely pleasant to work with. This was my first time buying a home and after the first home inspection, due to the issues identified by Joe, I declined to continue with the purchase of the home (which I am extremely thankful for as there were a lot of major concerns). He then inspected the home that am about to close on and made me feel so comfortable and confident going into this purchase. Joe is friendly, very detailed and has the home buyers best interest at heart. I highly recommend Joe for your home inspection needs! Thanks Joe!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJoe F.Business Owner6/9/2020Thank you for taking the time to write this review. I appreciate your business!Read more

column1: Paige J.Elite '2021Sacramento, CA5473268356/3/2016First to ReviewJoe is incredibly thorough and by the book. He might even be more OCD than me, which is saying a lot. He was great about communication via text/email beforehand, and kept me updated day of when he was late. His inspections will most likely take longer than other companies because he's very diligent. He's a dream inspector for a buyer, but probably a terror for the seller because he will find everything. His report is awesome because he records the process and later dictates it to the report so you get all the details. He uses laymen terms, which I appreciated. And with that he'd explain what is acceptable vs what isn't so you know what you're looking for or what you'll need to do to fix things. Price wise he's spot on or even slightly less than the competition, so no worries there. Definitely recommend him for your home inspection, but he does stay booked so get him early!Useful 6Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationJoe F.Business Owner10/6/2016Thank you for taking the time to write this review! I really appreciate it and thank you for your business.Read more

column1: Amber R.Charlotte, NC201395/8/2017Joe was my 3rd or 4th phone call to home inspectors today and the only one with availability the same week.  Our closing is moving really fast and we needed to have the report before our walk-through with the builder(new construction).  A+ for being accommodating.Joe was very thorough at the inspection, showing us examples of issues that would be in the report.  He gave us suggestions on how to verify items were fixed(missing insulation).  He even splashed water around the sinks to make sure they were sealed correctly(they were not).  We would rather have an abundance of documentation than not enough and miss something important.  Got my report back in less than 24 hours from completion of the inspection.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJoe F.Business Owner9/2/2019Thank you AR and PLEASE forgive the tardiness of this reply! Thank you for your business! It was a pleasure to help you.Read more

column1: Hasil P.Charlotte, NC081/6/2018The inspection report states that there is a furnace powering the heat in the house and that the heat in the house is powered by natural gas.Six months after purchasing our home, we need the heater working and it isn't.  Three separate heating and air companies have come by to look at our system, and by all accounts (except Alpha & Omega's) our heat is running exclusively on electrical heat strips (no natural gas, no furnace).  Our energy bills are through the roof to run these heat strips and every heating and air professional has indicated that running electrical heat strips is a completely ineffective and inefficient way to heat a home.While Alpha & Omega inspection pointed out some useful superficial changes we should ask the seller to make--now that we own the home, we would much prefer he had knowledge of and pointed out the substantial issues with the home (like "There is no way that this heating system will keep this home warm in the winter.").  I believe that this is information an inspector should be able to determine without calling in a specialized HVAC inspector.  Hugely disappointed with the lack of relevant information provided in the inspection report.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJoe F.Business Owner1/10/2018The inspection was performed on a 50 year old house with a 20 year old HVAC system in May of 2017 and had so much wrong that the inspection resulted in a 39 page report. The inspection lasted from 9:30 am. to 2:30 p.m. The HVAC defects outlined below are NOT "superficial" and the buyer didn't address them until the current cold snap arrived. Likely, he didn't do anything else I recommended in the report.I had this statement in the report: "The home contains and abandoned furnace in a bathroom closet and and abandoned duct work in the crawlspace. The ducts contribute to restricted ventilation and restricts access to the crawlspace. The furnace and ducts are essentially trash that should be removed like any trash and especially to increase access to the crawlspace."I also said: "One or more furnace(s) is at the end of its design life and you should budget for a new system. It could last a few years or fail tomorrow. It should be more closely monitored, serviced bi-annually, and have its filters changed frequently. It would also be wise to keep a home warranty policy current. You should consider having it thoroughly evaluated by a licensed HVAC contractor prior to the close of escrow." And, "One or more AC condenser(s) outside is estimated to be very old and is at or beyond its anticipated design life. You should budget for a new system immediately. It may last a year or more, but could easily fail tomorrow. You should consider having it thoroughly evaluated by a licensed HVAC contractor prior to the close of escrow because the cost of replacement could affect your valuation of the property."I also said: "No central heat or AC was provided for the rear right bedroom, and the family room considered a 'habitable room'. All habitable rooms are required to be provided with a direct source of heat according to commonly accepted building standards. Service by a licensed HVAC contractor is recommended."And: "We were unable to find the return air compartment filters. We therefore recommend an evaluation by a licensed HVAC contractor who should confirm its location and ensure it is in acceptable condition."I described he HVAC installation as "UNPROFESSIONAL". Yes, in bold and all caps.Finally, the report stated: " Therefore...it is essential that any recommendations that we make for service or a second opinion be scheduled before the close of escrow, because a specialist could reveal additional defects or recommend further upgrades that could affect your evaluation of the property...... [if] the current owner cannot demonstrate its service within the previous year should be evaluated by a HVAC contractor prior to close of escrow, particularly if the unit is nearing the end of its expected life span."Did he do any of the things I recommended? Nope! In summary, the report is filled with statements urging him to have it evaluated and serviced prior buying the home. He was also warned that the house was sold by a flipper, that it had numerous modifications, that it had failed city inspections, and that we could not endorse the modifications performed in this house. The house had problems galore with the crawl space, attic, electrical, roof, standing water in the crawl space, animal feces in the crawl space, parts of the crawlspace that were inaccessible, and on and on. Basically the house was an example of someone trying to make a silk purse out of a sow's ear and charge a premium for it due to its location. Any reasonable person would have called his inspector to discuss the report. Most reasonable people would have run as fast as they can away from this house. He didn't call to discuss anything and now wants to blame me for his buyer's remorse due to his electricity bills when it's 10 degrees F.I have 170 reviews on Angie's List to date. 162 of them are A ratings. I perform about 400 inspections a year and have for 15 years. This client's satisfaction is disappointing, but an anomaly. You can't make everyone happy, sadly. As you know, the vast majority of the satisfied customers don't provide a review so you only hear from the occasional hard to please customer online.Read more

column1: Gabi M.Elite '2021Phoenix, AZ3771216038134/19/2008First to ReviewWhen I needed fliers made to distribute at Pat's Run, I called around to get pricing and Graphic Ideals (known as AlphaGraphics at the time) was above and beyond the best.  In addition, their staff was friendly and efficient...I went back and forth with the # of finished fliers I needed and I had to get several estimates.  I spoke several times to Lena - you would think with my many phone calls, she would get annoyed, but she was patient with me and even went so far as to give me her cell phone so I could call her after hours if necessary.Needless to say, the fliers turned out great!  PM me if you want to see a copy - they listed 8 top suggestions for places to refuel after the race (yummy breakfast places near Tempe).  You may even be quoted on there?!Thanks Graphic Ideals - I'll be back for all of my future printing needs for sure!Useful 6FunnyCool 3Business owner informationAlice M.Business Owner4/29/2015Thanks for your kind words. column1: Steve W.Calgary, Canada81886537/15/20188 photosWe had a great dinner here. I haven't been to one of the Cactus Club Cafe establishments in many years. The food was well prepared and well presented. I found our server to be right on the ball with bring dishes, checking in and taking away empty plates. We tried the Tuna Stack which just seemed to be advertised everywhere including the bathroom in there. It was delicious with the avocado. The other appetizer we tried were their salt and pepper wings. For entrees we had the salmon, tuna poke bowl and the angus steak. All were perfect. Usually you expect the salmon to be slightly over done, but that was not the case. The desserts were awesome too especially the cheesecake. The prices were getting up there. Most entries are close to $30 and the appetizers are $15 or more. The interior was a bit dark and uninteresting and the music was quite loud.See all photos from Steve W. for Cactus Club CafeUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationStacey S.Business Owner8/5/2018Hello Steve,Thanks very much for the five star review!  We are a smaller location and can get a little loud and lively when we are full with guests, however we are very happy to hear that your experience overall was great!We hope to see you again soon.Sincerely,Stacey SDay Manager, Macleod TrailRead more

column1:
Jaden B.Elite '2021Calgary, Canada1317522158611/12/20172 photosI have been here so many times that when I sat down and looked at the menu yesterday I wanted to try something on the menu that I hadn't tried before and that was hard for me as I have tried almost everything on the menu. Everything from the modern bowl with all the different additions you can add to it such as salmon, tuna, chicken, etc. The butternut squash ravioli with prawns is my favourite and I have had that both in the meal size and in the starter size. The tuna stack is also delicious for a starter. I have had the salmon dijon for a main meal. My favourite drink on the menu was called a frose or a rosini as I like to call it. Well that was there summer drink so now they have a new one in replace of it called the blackberry harvest or something along those lines which is just as amazing and good. Highly recommend it. So to find something I hadn't tried for a main meal yet- I got the short rib sandwich and my boyfriend got the Rob's Chicken sandwich and both were amazing. My waitress suggested that I don't get the short rib sandwich as she didn't like it but I am glad I did because I loved it. Yes she was right that it could have used more flavour like a BBQ sauce or something but there was cheese and it was served on sourdough so it was great. Also, it was like a beef dip because you dipped it in beef au jus. I won't be getting this again because I have a rule when I go to a restaurant to get something different overtime and my boyfriends chicken sandwich was better than the short rib sandwich. The only thing I did not like about the restaurant and what I thought was weird was that they started vacuuming the carpet while we were eating. Yes I understand that they were cleaning but it was loud and that place is half carpet. I think they should just do it at the end of the day.because I have eaten so much from here, I have decided to write a full list of everything on the menu (past and present) that I have tried under every category on the menu and whether I recommend it or not. Updated at the beginning of February 2018: Drinks (Cocktails)- I have had almost every cocktail on the menu but none of the wines or beers: - Passion Fruit Bellini- RECOMMEND but tastes like a peach bellini with a gooseberry in it and it is seasonal - The Belinni- RECOMMEND- Whiskey Giner Smash- Recommend but the ginger is strong - The Brazilian- RECOMMEND this is my favourite drink - Signature Cesar- Recommend but it is typical- Signature Sangria- Recommend but it is a typical drink- Nothing but Pink- RECOMMEND- Flirtini- RECOMMEND- Frose: RECOMMEND but it is seasonal - Rosini: RECOMMEND but it is seasonal - Blackberry Harvest: RECOMMEND but it is seasonal Start and Share:- Szechuan Chicken Lettuce Wraps- RECOMMEND- Tuna Stack- Recommend BUT its becoming popular everywhere - Edamame- Don't recommend as it is too typical - Ceviche- Don't Recommend- Ravioli and Prawn Trio- RECOMMEND- Calamari- Recommend but its nothing special - Beef Carpaccio- RECOMMEND Steaks- Mains- Butternut Squash Ravioli with Prawns- Recommend but only in the Start and Share size - Fresh Greens- Modern Bowl with grilled Avacado- RECOMMEND-Modern Bowl with Grilled Chicken- Don't recommend- Modern Bowl with Grilled Salmon- RECOMMEND-Burgers and Sandwiches:- Cajun Chicken Sandwich- RECOMMEND- Rob's Crispy Chicken Sandwich- RECOMMEND- Short Rib Sandwich- Recommend but I don't think it is on the menu anymore- Casual (I have had and recommend everything in this section):- Chicken Tacos- RECOMMEND- Baja Fish Tacos- RECOMMEND- Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowl- RECOMMEND- Chicken Tenders- RECOMMEND- Jambalaya Rice Bowl- RECOMMEND-Desserts (I have had and recommend everything in this section especially the Key Lime Pie): -  Chocolate Peanut Butter Crunch Bar- RECOMMEND- Caramel Chocolate Mousse- RECOMMEND- White Chocolate Cheesecake- RECOMMEND- Key Lime Pie- RECOMMEND- Chocolate Lava Cake- RECOMMENDRobs Chicken SandwichShort Rib SandwichUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGraham A.Business Employee11/14/2017Hello Jaden,Thank you for taking the time to write a review for Cactus Club Cafe Macleod Trail. We greatly appreciate all of our guest feedback and reviews.
We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us and look forward to seeing you again soon.
Sincerely,
Graham Andersen, Senior ManagerRead more

column1: Vanessa M.Whiteville, NC55252510/3/2020I had my first visit and can't wait for my next.  Karen did my 60 minute deep tissue massage and she was absolutely amazing.  I explained to her what was going on with my shoulder and neck area and she worked magic with her hands and had me feeling like a new person when I left.  I hadn't been able to sleep for days before my massage because of post operative shoulder pain but when I got home that night I slept  the whole night with no pain.  She is very experienced and knows the perfect amount of pressure to apply.  The front receptionist was very nice and attentive.  I am looking forward to another session here with Karen.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKeith L.Business Manager10/8/2020Vanessa! column1: Amber A.Huntersville, NC037/24/2020I was really disappointed with the massage I received here. I booked an hour long Swedish massage because I just wanted to relax and have a nice soothing massage. My therapist talked to me the entire time and kept stopping the massage to explain things using her hands and the massage itself had to rhythm or flow to it and was just a bunch of what felt like poking and prodding. My massage was at 5:45 and was ended at 6:22. It was just an overall very disappointing service and for the price I feel a bit ripped off. There are other spas in the area and I feel like I should have taken my business elsewhere.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKeith L.Business Manager8/8/2020Hi Amber. I apologize that I'm just seeing of this experience. I don't recall hearing of this at the Center. column1: Crystal P.Las Vegas, NV0810/9/2020As much as I wanted to like this place I will say I did not have the positive experience that the reviews mentioned. I was a first time client and wasn't really introduced at all. Cathy did apologize in the end for not realizing I was a new client but there were many things that for me were not good. 1) there was no explanation to what was being done to my face. This worried me since I have very sensitive skin and since she didn't know me or ask any questions about my skin I feared a bad reaction. 2) During the facial someone was in the waiting area and due to no receptionist she went to check on who was out there. TOTALLY fine but there was no change of gloves upon entering and working on my face again :/. 3) after massaging my arms with body like she began working on my face again without washing or changing gloves. Like I mentioned before I have sensitive skin so I again feared the oil doing harm to my skin. Just like I predicted I had a major major major reaction and what seemed like clogged pores after this facial which as never happened to me in the past. I think the protocols with hand washing and changing gloves was a major issue for me! Leaving this review so that hopefully the owner doesn't provide this  to anyone else!!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCathy L.Business Owner10/22/2020I’m sorry you feel you did not have a good experience with me. I pride myself on good customer service. One thing you did not see is that I have sanitizer on my counter and use it repeatedly during the service and between going from the hands back to the face I use sanitizer and a hot towel to clean my hands. You experienced a purge after a facial that is not a reaction. A reaction after a facial is hives or severely swollen skin due to a reaction to a product. Breakout can be expected sometimes after a facial especially a hydrating facial like you got. Now as far as touching the door handle- since I had completely sanitizer it prior to your arrival I did not think to change my gloves but I did sanitize them but I will remember to change them in the future.  Normally when a new client comes in I go through a list of everything we are going to do but because I thought I did you the month before  I thought I would let you relax during the treatment during the treatment since I thought I already did that with you. . However the appointment I remembered being on the books was cancelled so that’s why I remembered your name.Read more

column1: Stacy B.Gilbert, AZ155/20/2019Hook and bait law firm. I was referred by a two different individuals. My expectations were high only to be let down from the consultation. I should have known better when Jonathan repeatedly referenced my "good looks" and how this will "help my case" and also tried to embellish my story because it "sounded better."Being naïve, and having never been in trouble before I fell for their car sales man pitch!  Bottom line they knew I was a single mom and had not problem taking my 7500$ and not getting any result for me.Oh! and also tried to swindle another 3500$ to go to trial. This place is a rip off and unethical and I am reporting them to the board!Useful 3FunnyCool 1Business owner informationCraig R.Business Owner5/21/2019Thank you for taking the time to review our firm. I'm sorry we weren't able to provide you with what you were looking for, unfortunately no law firm could. The reason why you were referred by two of your friends is that we get amazing results for our clients by doing hard work on their behalf. More importantly we don't sugar coat or lie to our clients. In your case, we were able to provide you with two viable options, take a really good reduced plea offer from the State or execute a trial strategy that we spent the better part of a year preparing (which is why we got the good plea offer). We even offered to reduce the trial fee for you because of financial difficulties you were having. The fact that you're a single mom didn't move the Prosecutors to dismiss your case, frankly it shouldn't. Like I explained to you on the phone, we can't change what happened. We can, however, provide you with options that you didn't have before retaining our services. We certainly did that. It saddens me that you weren't more pleased with the hard work we put into your case and fruits of that labor. Best of luck to you in the future.Read more

column1: Lisa F.Las Vegas, NV7235910/3/2015WOW! WOW! WOW!I have been unbelievably impressed with AVS...from the receptionist...to customer service...to the installer...to the General Manager. I actually did not believe that this level of customer service even existed anymore!I had my security with another company here in town and had called them to make some changes to my Alarm.com account. After not receiving a return phone call, I turned to AVS. AVS was quick to jump in and help me with changing my Alarm.com profile details. It was fairly difficult to do, but between Jessika and General Manager, Nicola Oakie they were relentless. Nicola came to evaluate my alarm system and let me know it was close to being outdated. She helped me upgrade the system that worked for my budget and was able to get me into their schedule even sooner than I could have imagined!Installer Mike C. was VERY thorough and meticulous! I loved that he pays so much attention to details. Overall I was SUPER happy with AVS! And I would STRONGLY recommend them to others!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationNicola O.Business Owner10/3/2015If you have a 2G Radio Communicator which will be affected by "The Sunset Clause" from AT&T 2015-16. column1: David K.Box Elder, SD234161/27/2017I needed my holding tanks serviced while I was in Vegas last December and Daisy Fresh had some good reviews so I called and set up an appointment. Robert is a very likable man no doubt! What I didn't like was paying before he told me that he didn't have the equipment needed to clean my gray tanks!  So after the $ I spent with Daisy Fresh, I still had to find someone that could hydro-flush my gray tanks using the most modern methods of going up through the drain tubes. He flushed my black tank by going through the toliet, and after he did this I had problems with my toilet seal leaking.  Because of this I cannot recommend his services.Useful 4FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationRobert E.Business Owner8/28/2017In response to David K's comments:   I always quote the price up front, before ever scheduling a service appointment.  The price is $175 to flush RV holding tanks, and is a flat rate for all types of RV's, and has been the price for 5 years.  We always enter the tanks from the outside unless otherwise requested by the customer, or when there is a clog that requires special attention.  The pressure applied to the flushing is regulated and non-damaging.  Prior to any service, and to protect both the customer and Daisy Fresh, a form is required to be signed outlining specifically our services and procedures.  We regret that you were not satisfied with our services, and you failed to contact us immediately so we could rectify any concerns.  We have thousands of customers who have been very pleased with our services, and who return time and again.Daisy Fresh RV FlushRead more

column1: Meghan V.Elite '2021Pittsford, NY12363193/3/2018The food was excellent, however the service was seriously lacking. We came to celebrate a birthday and did a great amount of research before booking a restaurant to celebrate. Upon reservation and with the hostess my fiancé made sure to say this was for a birthday. There was no acknowledgment even though others in the restaurant received special recognition of birthdays. We would not come back here for a celebration or for dinner. Felt ignored by our server, but other tables were getting plenty of attention. We literally had to put our hand up and yell excuse me for assistance. I don't know if this had to do with the face that we are from the states or that we are in our 30?? Really disappointing service. Definitely would not recommend again. Maybe for take out??Useful 3Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationRandy O.Business Manager3/15/2018Dear Meghan V.,Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us regarding your recent visit at Hy's Toronto.  I am very sorry that your evening fell so far below your expectations, and our usually very high standards.  We know how much time guests put into selecting restaurants to celebrate their special events, which is why we always try to make these occasions extra special.  I won't make excuses for your experience, we have a professional team, and our job is to ensure that our service is as prompt and seamless as possible for each and every one of our tables. Obviously something went wrong that evening, and for that I am truly sorry. You can be assured that we will do our very best to ensure that such problems are not repeated.We would love the opportunity to discuss further your experience, please contact myself or the general manager at the restaurant at your convenience.Sincerely,Alex PhillipsDining Room ManagerRead more

column1: Madeline B.Charlotte, NC021/6/2021We lived at Mosaic for 2 years and moved out this past summer. Our first year was amazing! Perfect location for everything we were looking for in South End and met our needs at the time.  We ended up re-signing our lease for the second year and everything seemed to go wrong after that. -The office staff was constantly rotating out and seemed to get worse as it went. There were tons of events each month when we first started, but over time they just kind of stopped (this was way before COVID hit).-The main elevator was broken every time you turned around which was the one closest to our apartment and was the only one that went to the top few floors of the parking garage. This was a huge issue when you came home anytime after 6 PM and had to park 6-7 stories above where you lived. -Our AC broke 7 times while we lived there! 7 times!!! The amount of times we had to wait to have it fixed was ridiculous and it wasn't until the week we were moving out that the maintenance guy told us it should have been replaced a few months ago due to how bad it was. I try to be reasonable, but when you are sitting inside an 80 degree box that is not ok. - Valet trash. This is a great service, but over time the people that collected it became awful. They would just throw your trash cans around and leave things everywhere. -You can hear everything! Our neighbors upstairs that seemed to have major anger issues, the cars/motorcycles at the lot next door drag racing at midnight during the week.-We constantly had to remind them we were moving out and already gave our 60 day notice. Our last bill I ended up being passed around to multiple departments and people to get a simple answer on anything. Where Mosaic was when we moved out I would not recommend to anyone. Great location, but that is the only thing going for it at all and there are plenty of other apartments in the area. I hope they have gotten better these past few months, but the way it was going I doubt it.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCommunity M.Business Owner3/1/2021Madeline B., we're disappointed to hear of the negative experience you had at our location. Please reach out to us at (704) 333-1530 so we may assist you in moving forward towards a resolution.Read more

column1: Joe Z.Gold Canyon, AZ117/12/2019Updated reviewWent to this place for bowling and was extremely disappointed with the bowling. Me and my relatives were assigned lane 5, and the bowling lane was low quality. The oil on the lane wasn't active and couldn't curve. I'm not sure if it affected other lanes but it was absolutely terrible. Second, the bowling pins just wouldn't go down. We only striked once when it was 16 pound ball with 14mph and very rarely spared. The bumpers also didn't really bump the ball. Finally, the attitude. I'm not sure if it was this exclusive but he asked if we had a credit card and said no, he sounded really pissed off. column1: Shawn L.Bayview Glen, Richmond Hill, Canada024/12/2021Well Moxies will be our first restaurant that the father daughter food cretic duo does. We will only be talking about the food that we ordered. My Daughter Ordered the Guacamole dip and it was really good (Refreshing) she ate it all. She also had the kids Buffalo chicken tenders and veggies The chicken tenders were more like nuggets, which was fine but not tenders. They tasted good but will try the chicken strips next time. The veggies were just a veggie, 6 tiny celery sticks As for myself I had the chicken strips and fries. I had asked for the fries to be twice cooked (Crispy) They came soft (Uber eats app) . I asked for gravy also and that came at a cost of $2 well that was 3 tablespoons full LOL Thanks Won't be ordering fries or gravy again. The strips were nice and crispy but could have other flavors for variety would be nice. Lemon pepper hmmmm I also ordered the dry ribs which I've had before They are very good and will order again but when asking for them to have salt and pepper This was almost unseen even on the bottom of the container. (I'll add my own next time no biggie)The over all dinner from Moxies was good but we would order with our experience from tonight's picks.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGeneral ManagerBusiness Owner4/13/2021Thanks Shawn for taking the time to share your review. column1: Valerie S.Charlotte, NC12612272/8/2021Had a great experience at this location over the past weekend. I had an issue with the Hertz car rental down the street, they did not have enough cars to rent one to me even though I had a reservation so Enterprise came to my rescue. I got online and made a reservation but then called this office to make sure they had cars available which they did. They had plenty to choose from and it worked out perfectly. Everyone that works there was very friendly and professional. They kept me in the loop on checking in, when somebody would take me out to the lot to choose a car, made sure that it was cleaned and sanitized etc as there was several couples checking in at the same time as me. column1: Sid R.Elite '2021Scottsdale, AZ15390344/24/2016We got a good price and the Camry we had ran beautifully.  So why two stars?  The agent tried to charge us almost a $100 more than our reservation was for.  Once that was corrected, he showed me the car.  It needed washing and vacuuming.  He washed and vacuumed it.  It was dripping wet - hadn't been dried.  We inspected the car, noting the one significant scratch, and went on our way.  About a half our down the road, we noticed the smell of cigarette smoke.  It became obvious that someone had smoked in the car and that the company had done nothing to mitigate that.  I also noticed that the gas gauge was on 3/4, not full.  Guess I need to check that rather than trust that a company like Enterprise would fill the tank or note it on the rental agreement.  They did neither.  The next day, we drove west in the morning, meaning the sun was shining on the rear of the car.  The inside of the back window was so covered with dirt, grime, and film that it was impossible to see out the back in the rearview mirror.  Finally, one of the features of the car I found while playing with the controls was the tire pressure monitor.  According to the monitor the pressures were 36 (LR), 38 (RR), 39 (RF) and 40 (LF).  Being that out of balance and that overinflated indicates a potential safety problem to me.  Obviously, Enterprise does not check tire inflation.  Again, the car was otherwise excellent, we were finally charged what we were supposed to be charged, and had an excellent 10 day trip.  I would go back here, but would be a real pain in the butt about checking our the car including making them check tire pressure before I got in.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationEnterprise R.Business Owner5/7/2016Thank you for your review, Sid. If you can provide a few more details, I would be happy to look into this further for you. column1: Sabrina Z.Gilbert, AZ22131812/17/20196 photosMy sons doctor sent us to this facility for his surgery.  Although all of the staff was pleasant, I became very concerned while waiting in the lobby.  This place was filthy dirty.  The windows to the lobby were so dirty inside and out you could write your name in the dirt.  There was a metal ledge inside with an inch of dust.  The chairs in the lobby are dirty.  The wall had food splatter on it.  The receptionist came over to inspect the carpet and explained they were just cleaned however whoever cleaned them did not move the chairs because there was crud,  paper and a paper clip under the chairs.  I had plenty of time to wait so I complained to the front desk.  She was very apologetic and said she would pass on my concerns.  I showed her a child's table toy with blocks attached to wires.  The colored blocks were black with dirt.  At this point I was thinking "What does it look like in the back where they do surgery".  I was assured the surgery rooms were maintained cleaner.  The hard floors in this place look grimy along with the one bathroom stall they had available for a waiting room that had over 25 people in it.  The button to the elevator looked like it hadn't been wiped down in a week.  Seriously, the bathrooms in Walmart look cleaner than this place.  When my sons surgery was completed, I had to drive around the side to pick him up.  This is when bad turned to worse.  The sliding doors to enter were 10 times worse than the windows and door in the lobby.  This was where my son was recovering from surgery!  Then when I entered I could still see a grimy looking floor and many surfaces that are NEVER cleaned.  I wish I had taken pictures of the dirty lobby but I didn't.  However, when I was waiting for them to let me in the side entrance I was appalled by the poor conditions that  extended into the inside of this surgery center past the lobby area.  Attached are pictures of the entry to pick up your loved one who has just had surgery.  The picture of the chair is an example of the filth in the recovery area.  The picture of the spider web is inside the surgery center where the patient recovers.    I have no idea what it looks like where they perform surgery.  If I had seen this place before the day of my sons surgery I would have never allowed him to have his surgery here. I will be complaining to the doctors office who performed his surgery.  The doctors personal offices where we were seen prior to surgery were impeccable and clean.See all photos from Sabrina Z. for HonorHealth Piper Surgery CenterUseful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHonorHealth SupportBusiness Customer Service12/19/2019Sabrina, thank you for sharing this valuable feedback. The HonorHealth leadership team is aware of your concerns and has assured us they've spoken to you and are actively working to correct all the cleanliness concerns you observed. We always appreciate your feedback and if there is anything else we can assist with, please let us know at honorcares@honorhealth.c….Read more
