column1: Erin M.Phoenix, AZ0211/11/2020I had surgery at this surgery center a few weeks ago and it was anything but pleasant. The gentleman at the front door screening people was very rude from the moment I walked in. There was a mishap with my COVID test so my surgery time was rearranged. When I did go back to pre-op the nurse Anita was beyond rude with me. I had prearranged with the Anesthesiologist to place my IV due to past experiences. When she came in to place the IV I told her I wanted the Anesthesiologist do it and explained why. She told me she couldn't do that. After the IV was placed by what I think was a student, I was told they were unable to get blood and needed to draw from my arm anyways. When the nurse left my room at 12:45 she did not give me a call button and nobody came back to my room to check on me until 2:15 when the anesthesiologist and OR nurse came to take me back for surgery. I needed to use the restroom for over an hour of sitting in the room by myself and had no way of getting out of the bed due to the side rails being up on both sides and having the IV. The entire hour and a half of laying there I was listening to my nurse watch videos on her phone and laughing. I heard every other patient around me get checked up on multiple times during this time. The anesthesiologist was the one who helped me to the restroom and the nurse Anita still didn't offer any help when she saw this happening. The only positive experience was with the OR nurse, anesthesiologist Dr. Borrego, my surgeon Dr. Newman, and PACU nurse Karin. It is also impossible to get ahold of anyone at the facility for questions before scheduled surgery and concerns following surgery. I requested a call back to discuss this matter and never received a response. I am very disappointed in the care at this facility and will never be returning.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHonorHealth SupportBusiness Customer Service11/13/2020Erin, I am so very sorry to read about this disappointing experience. Thanks for letting us know. I'm escalating your concerns, along with your Google review to the Patient Relations Coordinator. We'd appreciate the opportunity to reach out to discuss your concerns. If you're open to a conversation, please email us at honorcares@Honorhealth.c….Read more

column1: Trish S.Phoenix, AZ51712/22/2020By far one of the worst run facilities I've ever been to. I have had many surgeries since having stage 3 breast cancer and had one of my reconstruction surgeries done here. I was called 5 separate times prior to review my procedure and pre-op details, confirm insurance ect. Told not to bring anything with, don't worry about ID, medical card as they had all that on record. 5 times I had this call, I thought it was excessive but most healthcare companies keep poor notes and don't know what the left hand is doing from the right. Check in for surgery, we need your drivers license and insurance cards. ....  also here is a bill that we think will be owed after insurance how will you be paying for that? Flabbergasted again by the calls I received just the day before, even showed her the numbers on my phone from the day before. No F's given by this peach behind the counter. I said you can bill me, that amount won't be accurate anyhow, and you have my info on record and I didn't bring anything as you guys told me NOT to. Now the nurses getting me ready for surgery, getting the IV, reviewing the same old what meds are you taking all the same conversations you have 1000 times, they were all very nice and had their shit together. My surgeon comes in, we head into the operation room and I wake up in recovery. Apparently they had no "clean rooms" available and said we would need to wait about 30 min, had my family go up stairs to wait in that lobby while I was waiting for the room. Over 3 hours, yes you read that right. Almost as long as my surgery itself it took to get a room cleaned. Even the nurses in the post op were making remarks about how embarrassing it was and unacceptable to not have a clean room available for me after such a surgery. Once we got the room some time after 4, surgery had been done since 12noon, as we got settled into the room we could all very clearly hear the lady in the next room talking shit about having to clean the rooms how it's not her job and she shouldn't have had to do this shit going on and on. That was lovely to hear, my family thought it was funny but I was so out of it I didn't care at that point. The nurses I had at that point were great. Then came the overnight nurses. By far the worst I've ever had. Not only did I have to constantly use the call button  each time I was in pain because instead of staying on top of the pain and being ahead of the meds wearing off it wasn't until I was crying out in pain, reminding them it was time for more. I suggested we keep a schedule for a more proactive approach to pain management and she said let us worry about that. She had no idea how to drain or deal with drains which are common after such invasive surgery. I asked her to empty out the fluid in the tubes and she said that's not needed. They she removed the ball drain off completely to dump in the toilet to flush. You don't remove it! You open the top squeeze it out in a cup and measure the liquid. I told her this and she basically cut me off and said it wasn't needed at this time. As you're laying there in severe pain, can't move, need help just to sit up or use the bathroom you're basically trapped and can't argue any reason and at the mercy of an untrained nurse who takes no pride in her job with no F's to give. My pain meds had worn off again and I used the call button asked for my nurse, 10 min later nothing. I pressed it again and was crying at that point and asked if anyone was available and was told they would find my nurse. Someone walks in the take my vitals and when I asked about my pain meds she said oh I can go get your nurse after this. Again the right hand doesn't have a clue what the left hand is doing. The next morning, the same crap, used the call button at 2:06 to ask for my nurse, 2:38 two nurses come in to help me go to the bathroom, I said that's not what I asked for. I needed to check to see if I could have the pain meds yet and so they left. 10 min later my nurse gets there, oh you weren't ready for your next round until 2:50, so that's why no one came in, not even to tell me but to make me wait crying there in pain for 45 min? So my advice, if you're having a bilateral mastectomy, reconstructive surgery this is not the place to go. They have extremely poor operations, their staff is not very attentive, and don't like to be bothered when you use the call button. If you want a facility that's ran well, makes your pain management after such an extreme surgery the number once priory DO NOT go here. Banner has a great facility off McDowell, the 5th floor is for female patients only and they know how to change dressings, drain your drains properly!!!!!!!! I asked to check out early, I was supposed to be there one more night, I asked for them to start the discharge paperwork because I couldn't handle being there another day to only feel ignored and not a priority.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHonorHealth SupportBusiness Customer Service2/26/2020Trish, I am so very sorry to read about these disappointing experiences. Thanks for taking time to share your concerns. I'm escalating your review to the Patient Relations Coordinator so they can look into this and do what's necessary to make sure it doesn't happen again. If you're open to a conversation, please let us know at HonorCares@Honorhealth.c… and we will be in touch shortly.Read more

column1: Cheryl G.Cave Creek, AZ01069/10/2018I had a laparoscopic vaginal total hysterectomy at Piper Ambulatory Surgical Center. Nursing staff excellent. Center did inform me verbally several times that the anesthesiologist who was excellent, may not fully accept Medicare. I appreciated being verbally informed several times. What I did not appreciate is the fact that a certified surgical assistant would bill more than my physician, and that the service would not be billed to and paid by Medicare. There are several alternative options as assistants that can bill Medicare, why use a CSA. Perplexed as to why no verbal information or introduction to individual before procedure. That is wrong. As a retired medical physician who can afford the additional bill, I sympathize with individuals whose income is extremely limited and can not pay an additional $500. I think HonorHealth should consider the financial strain to their loyal patients.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHonorHealth SupportBusiness Customer Service9/11/2018Cheryl, thanks for sharing this valuable feedback. We'll pass it along to the hospital's leadership so they are aware of your experience. If there is anything else you'd like to share, please send it along to honorcares@honorhealth.c…. Thanks!Read more

column1: Kim G.Elite '2021Corte Madera, CA32375311/24/2020One of the slowest and most boring rounds of golf we've played in quite awhile. They start groups off every 8 minutes which guarantees backups along the way. We actually quit after 13 holes, a first for us, and we'd been out for 3 hours and 20 minutes. At that rate it would be dark when we finished. This is a flat track without much character. One long straight flat hole after another. With so many interesting courses around, can't imagine why people play here.All that said, the greens were in great shape and the staff was friendly and accommodating.Useful 1FunnyCool 1Business owner informationBailey H.Business Owner11/25/2020Hello Kim,Thank you for your feedback, and I'm sorry to hear about your experience yesterday and that we let you down.  After looking into it a little further, the groups that tee'd off before and after you finished in 4 hours and 30 minutes.  I know this isn't acceptable for everyone but we take a very proactive approach to maintaining pace of play so that all of our guests have a great experience even when we are sold out like yesterday.  I hope you come back and give us another chance to make it up to you.  If you have any further comments or concerns please give me a call anytime on my cell phone at (925)-980-1006Best,Andrew FrazierDirector of Sales and ServicesDobson Ranch Golf CourseRead more

column1: Brantley P.Charlotte, NC08156/16/2017Three important issues Caution I hate writing this reveiw......... But1. 6 months of harassment from DMV, implying our tags will be cancelled unless we paid the fines of $55.42....  first time. Six months later the issue still wasnt fixed then the owner Mr Dimeri J Aposdale would correct the issue. He said he assumed it was fixed until now etc..2. We were over charged for one our work vehicles for a month and half still waiting on this $ to be placed back into our account.3. Home owner insurace account # was mishandled as well. Our Morgage company contaced them to verfiy the account #. We recieved a cancelation letter from our moragage company Brightway, said they will handle it. Dimtri, the owner said they don't have time to deal with this issue.So another hugh mistake Brghtway made.4. "Communication" is the key in which this company has no how to do.....UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationDimitri A.Business Owner6/18/2017I appreciate your feedback and dealing with the DMV, in this situation, was extremely frustrating for you and for us, please allow me to clear some items up below.1) Melissa, on my service team faxed the DMV proof of liability on 2/21 and called back on 2/22 where she spoke with Camille. She indicated to us that it had been received and NC DMV would clear the file. You brought to our attention another letter you received. Melissa then spoke to Allen at the DMV, on 4/24, who stated "to resend to him and he would add clearer notes in the the system regarding the letter the insured received". Melissa then faxed them again on 4/24. I then faxed the NC DMV on 6/12 and called and spoke to Ann with you on a conference call so that you were comfortable knowing everything had finally been cleared. You did NOT incur any fees with the state.2) You weren't overcharged for your vehicle insurance. I had emailed you a cancellation form to sign on 6/12, you sent it back to us on 6/14. It was too late to stop the automatic payment as the request was sent to the bank to withdraw the funds for the amount due. I informed you that you could go to the bank and reject the transaction, but you indicated " you were too busy". So my office emailed you to inform you the refund check would be mailed to you in 7-10 business days.3) First, I've NEVER said I was too busy to work on your issues. On 5/3/2016 we received a fax from Danielle Daniels, from your mortgage company, to update the loan number, which we did. Apparently the mortgage company made an error and sent us the wrong loan #. We received the correct loan# from Kelly on 5/4/17 and promptly sent that to your mortgage company. We then followed up and spoke with Cynthia @ the mortgage company and she advised payment was sent to the carrier on 5/6/17 and to allow 7-10 days to arrive. Payment was posted on 5/16/17. Again, had the mortgage company not given us the wrong information, this would have been avoided. I'm glad that my service team was able to go the extra mile to make sure you were taken care of.I truly wish you the best!Read more

column1: John B.Indian Trail, NC5435/6/2015First to ReviewWe we're quoted insurance on 4 vehicles 2 which had full coverage. Three months later we find out that all 4 only have liability. Dimitri on the phone said he would fix this right away and not to worry. Six weeks later they draft $500.00 out of our account for a monthly payment. We find out then that our insurance increased from $2400 to $5100 a year. You know why he didnt say anything? Because we would have canceled then. Our full coverage insurance at Farm Beauro Indian Trail with Mark Rains is only $2400 a year ,why would we pay more then twice that amount. They made the initial mistake and had us driving a brand new car without full coverage. In fact they still owe us for the windshield on that car because we couldnt claim it because of their mistake. Please call Mark for insurance and dont make the same mistake we did.Useful 4Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationDimitri A.Business Owner5/8/2015This is not an accurate representation of the facts. First, Dimitri didn't write this auto policy for you. It was written by a former agent of Brightway and an acquaintance of yours. Dimitri fielded a phone call from you and reviewed the policy on the carrier website and pulled the original application, signed by you, to make certain the policy on the carrier website was the same as the contract that you and the former agent agreed to. You indicated that you wanted to add coverage's to the policy, this was processed immediately, per your request. Dimitri indicated your new annual increase in premium. Had you requested a policy re-quote with a different carrier, we would have provided you with one--had you requested a cancellation, a form would have been provided immediately for your signature, however, none of these were requested. At Brightway Insurance, we go to great lengths to make certain all of our clients needs are met with honesty and integrity.Read more

column1: Amber K.Charlotte, NC55517/28/20201 photoOkay.... So I'll start from the beginning by saying this was my first time at this location, and they're definitely following all precautions with Covid-19. Upon my arrival, I was asked to sanitizer hands, and to fill out paperwork stating that I hadn't traveled, and as far as I knew I didn't have any symptoms. A kind faced gentleman took my temperature, and then pointed me to the direction of a sink, as to wash my hands before being serviced. I was then asked to seat at the station of a middle woman, (NOW THIS IS WHERE THINGS GOT DIFFERENT) she kept insisting on me getting a Jelly service, but upon reviewing their many options, I still wasn't impressed, but she was for a lack of a better word PUSHY. The young man from earlier, then began to explain to me in detail what made this experience (his words not mine) so different, and honestly I was sold. I chose my jelly scent, and mentally prepared myself for the "experience" ahead of me. I'll be honest, his pitch was better. The older woman , then began to provide what I can only call mediocre service. She nipped the skin on my toe, and failed to check if I were okay. The water was HOT, and she never asked me if the temperature was okay, or if I'd like it to be adjusted. The bottoms of feet were not scrubbed, and she kinda scrubbed on the sides. She never offered me a beverage, even though another guest was offered, and she failed to start or even instruct me on how to operate the massage chair. At the end of my service she dropped my shoes by their dying station (while people were still standing there), and then proceeded to tell me my total. My pedicure alone was 55.00, but regardless of the price, good service trumps cost for me ANYDAY, so unfortunate for her, she didn't get tipped, which is a shame because I'm an awesome tipper. While I did love the location, and was extremely impressed with their safety concerns, I WILL NEVER let this particular woman do any of my services again.Jelly PedicureUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationLinh V.Business Owner8/11/2020Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about  this issue.We apologize that our customers service did not satisfy your expectations. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met in your interaction with our business. Your happiness is our number one priority. We will tell the technicians to pay more attention to the customer service. Hopefully, your next visit can meet your expectations and has better experience.Read more

column1: Brittany L.Indian River, Chesapeake, VA13454326/6/2020I'm traveling and after a 6 hour car ride I needed an adjustment. I called ahead and was told the wait was about 8 people. With two doctors working I assumed it would move quick. I came in as a walk-in and filled out my paper work and sat for over 45 min. I watched the receptionist accept 3 people who had gotten there well after me while I waited. When I finally spoke up, I was told I was next. (But I still waited another 20 min) It took over an hour to be seen from the time I handed her my paperwork to the time the doctor saw me. If I wasn't in pain, I would of just left. Suggestions: manage your appointments better. You lose all credibility of a "walk-in" service when you cannot properly set expectations. I had a slim window to get serviced and I would have went elsewhere if the proper expectations were set.Updated my review. Dr. Allen was not only sweet but educated meUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationClaire H.Business Manager6/10/2020Brittany,Thank you for your feedback. We truly apologize for the inconvenience you experienced. Typically new patients experience minimal wait times which are usually just enough time to complete your initial paperwork. We are sorry to hear that you experienced a longer wait time than expected. As a convenient, walk-in clinic, it can be difficult to predict wait times, though we do our best to establish proper expectations when you come in. Unfortunately, there are popular times when peak wait times may occur. Our goal is to give convenient and quality care to every patient who walks through the door.  We would appreciate the opportunity to properly address your experience and make this right. You may be glad to know that follow up visits usually only take 5-10 minutes to get you back on track to chiropractic health and on your way to the rest of your day. Please, email or call us to confirm the best way for management to contact you.Best in Health,The Joint ChiropracticRead more

column1: JW F.Ottawa, Canada015/14/2020Too expensive.  They estimated that several people would need to be involved to do the job, and it was just one guy who did it pretty quickly. I definitely feel like a sucker.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationSunder P.Business Owner9/13/2020All our price’s are detailed and published online on our website since 2012. We are the only audio video professionals that display all our prices for complete transparency. Our prices are very reasonable, justified by lots of reviews. We provide the best white glove service in Toronto. For unlisted service prices, we need a customers full acceptance before proceeding with a job. We commence work once you are fully excited to work with us.Our aim is to earn your good review for doing a perfect job. Starting from your first interaction till the completion of the job, our goal is to delight our customers so that they will introduce us to their family and friends without even asking for a referral. Obviously this was not the case for you and we are ashamed for it. We hate for our customer to think they overpaid for the value we bring. We do have to agree that the two weeks before the COVID-19 lockdown surfaced, we restricted the number of technicians that can be allowed into a home for the safety of our customers and technicians. Doing this did not safe us any money as you may think. In fact the opposite happen, to ensure that all of our existing customers were serviced before the official lockdown we had incurred extra costs. We got our senior technicians and backend management staff onto trucks to help complete the backlog. We respect your position and we are really sorry that you felt that you paid more for the excellent service we provide. As for all the other prospect customers who read this review, please note that our pricing is transparent, service level unbeatable. Our support relentless. Call us and email us or go to our website today and learn more about our services. The quick response over email, phone and the attention to detail that we provide to each of you will blow your mind.Read more

column1: Ashley T.Chandler, AZ091/30/2020Overall, I had an OK experience here. The ladies at the front desk were super nice. My hygienist was great - effective yet gentle. She removed some stains from my teeth that I have been hating - so that was splendid! I even enjoyed Dr. Zahiri until she came up with my plan for care. I came from a small town in Ohio where my dentist was a family friend and he took care of my mouth as if it were his own. His main goals were to keep my existing teeth healthy so that they would last me a lifetime. It is frustrating since moving to Arizona to only find doctors who want to prescribe $$ earning treatments before they are necessary. Before moving to the West valley I FINALLY found a dentist in Gilbert that was SO conservative on their treatments plans and I just LOVED him. My last dental check up with him, I was told my teeth were all looking great. That there was one spot that they wanted to keep an eye on and two areas where there was a gap between my filling and tooth where decay COULD eventually occur. Dr. Zahiri came back to me wanting to put porcelain inlays in both of those areas - where there was currently no decay.. and she wanted to cap one of my back teeth which was also showing no signs of decay. I worked for a dentist office for years, so I KIND OF know what I'm looking at in a dental x-ray. I asked to see my x-rays and she could not show me any reason for this work. She said she saw it "clinically".. whatever that means. She blamed my concern on my defensiveness from past experiences and tried to console me while putting me through the exact same experience. It sucks because there was one cavity I probably really do need filled and do not want to return to this office.. I will be looking for a new dentist. Peace!Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationSheyda Z.Business Owner1/31/2020Ashley, thank you for taking time to leave us feedback.  A radiographic exam and a clinical exam (actually looking at the teeth) are required for a proper diagnosis, this is standard of care.  We take time to do a compete set of xrays, intra-oral photos and do a compete exam and oral cancer screening to make sure we are providing our patients the proper treatment plan. Like I mentioned at your visit, I am more than happy to provide you your xrays and intra-oral photos so you can seek a second opinion and/or treatment at another office.Read more

column1: Eric R.Las Vegas, NV035/30/2019Sick of kids who believe riding is only for Instagram trying to sell you products they have no knowledge of? Tired of being talked down to like a newby who has just received a learners permit just because you asked a basic question? Bellissimoto isn't a business. They are your friends and fellow enthusiasts who you choose to offer your money to in hopes it helps them fulfill what you know and believe to be a passion for bikes and riding that my be equal to or surpass your own. These guys will go way beyond the service of any shop I have personally been to.  (MANY)Riding is my passion for real. It's not cuz it's cool...it's cuz it's my therapy. These guys relate to that and that's how they communicate. Stop by to say hi and look around at their exotic gallery of jaw dropping bikes. They'll be as happy to meet you as they would be to become your favorite shop. Before you buy parts for your baby from a stranger online, go introduce yourself and give these guys a chance to offer you options and alternatives you never knew existed. Peace.UsefulFunnyCool 1Business owner informationRandy N.Business Owner6/4/2019Eric, if I could pick a favorite review for my shop, to have everyone see, I'd make it yours. column1: Ryan W.Phoenix, AZ264/29/2021I'm giving them 2 stars because my initial communication with them was great. Regina was friendly and Carlos was friendly and helpful when chatting through our project goals during our quote consultation. Unfortunately things went down from there.I was told I would receive a follow up quote within two weeks after the consultation. I did not hear anything back for a month, so I reached out again and was told they would look into it.Again, two weeks later, no response. I followed up again only to be told that "the rep informed you that you did not meet our minimum". Mind you that the only thing I was told during the consultation was that I'd hear back in two weeks, but I never did.Additionally, when I got an explanation, they claimed that there was a 5k minimum on projects and that "the rep indicated to me that he told you that the day of the consultation". I had told our rep that we were looking for 4k-10k for our project during our consultation. In fact, when I had asked him what their minimum was, he instead said that they don't like to give minimums and that he'd just like to know our price range instead (4k-10k). The Owner was the one who handled the last email response to me and clearly showed no interest in trying to keep my business. All they needed to do was ask me a few questions to clear things up. It's really that simple when it comes to earning and retaining a client base. Instead they decided to make assumptions and trust the word of a rep (who is no longer there?) about what price I was apparently willing to spend.I'm shocked, really.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationIrene L.Business Owner5/5/2021I contacted you several times regarding the rep no longer being with us. column1: Angela M.Las Vegas, NV01611/21/2020Felt the need to give an honest review because my experience is keeping me up at night. Be cautious booking with 4c hair. They will say it's full service and includes a wash and a blow dry but my hair was not washed or blow dried properly. Soap was left in my hair after her second attempt of washing it. The blow dry was painful because it was being combed by the root wet and not stretched and dried to prevent tugging and breakage which would have been the proper method of drying 4c hair. She also did not completely dry or detangle my hair which made the braiding process hard on her and hard on me. The hair was so tangled it was being yanked as she tried braiding down the shaft. At one point I wanted to cry but I tried to stay polite because it helps keep the peace. I just don't think the stylist had adequate experience working with my hair type which disappointed me. I could've washed and blow dried my hair straight before the service to prevent the worst part of my experience from happening but when I called and asked about it they said it was included in the sew in service so I came with my hair unwashed and detangled in 4 braids. My service was for a sew in and it took 7 hours. I got seen at 10:45am and ended around 6pm. The sew in portion was good but the braids in the back could have been flatter if my hair was properly detangled. The stylist might say it was the length of my hair that prevented it from being flat but I have had my hair flatter than this and there's much bulk in the back. I appreciate the work my stylist Ashley did but I was very disappointed  with how my natural hair was treated. When I take this out I know it will be a nappy mess and it just felt like so much breakage was happening from her technique. Ashely is a lovely person but that doesn't constitute for a job well done. Really wanted to write this because I just moved here and wish I read something like this that would have helped me choose a proper salon for my black hair needs.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAshley B.Business Customer Service12/19/2020Thank you so much for your faux review!Please beware, the account of events in review are false.This review was left by a person who came into our salon during a pandemic, utilized our salon, our products and services. She later thanked our stylist and even gave her a $30 tip and never complained once during her service.If I had a horrible experience, or if I was unsatisfied with a service I personally would have made mention ofit to my stylist. Angela, never mentioned beinguncomfortable even when asked by stylist on multiple occasions. If I was unhappy with how my hair was being treated, I also wouldn’t have left a $30 tip. But Angela left a $30 tip and thanked her stylist before leaving.Just doesn’t make sense.Angela also let us know she is a formerly licensed cosmetologist from Seattle now here in the Las Vegas area unable to work due to issues with her license.The following day Angela reports her service to her credit card as an unauthorized transaction. A scam and crime against a small business. This is a fake review, from a competitor who cameto our salon and literally stole product and services.Read more

column1: Sabrina J.Las Vegas, NV1813/21/2017Horrible customer service..I decided to call before booking an appointment and asked a few questions about the hair extentions that this "salon" provides. But when i asked about ombre extentions I was asked in a very rude tone by a woman named "Ashley" if i was prank calling her. I responded"no I just wanted to know if you had ombre hair , before I make appointment" then she quickly responded "If you were a real client you would just make appointment"and hung up. Wow horrible customer service. I guess they really are just after a$ 35 deposit insted of $ 400 or more  for me to get the look I wanted. So my bad next time i wont call if i have questions about hair i want to purchase!!!Useful 5Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationAshley B.Business Customer Service4/27/2019I am so sorry you were upset by that phone call. We truly wish we could have helped you on your hair journey, but our only interaction is one over the phone, we have never done your hair.We have never portrayed ourselves as a stand alone salon, we are a sew-in weave service located, inside of a larger salon. Our stylist are licensed by the State Board of Cosmetology and we have access to our location 24/7. Our location includes a private suite in which our clients are privately serviced. From my understanding we really tried to help you when you called. It was after hours but we still tried to help. You explained you were having trouble booking your appointment and needed assistance, so we helped you out by attempting to walking you through the booking process... It wasn't until you specifically stated that you would not pay a deposit for the  bundles wanted to purchase or appointment you wanted to book, is when you became upset.All of our clients pay a deposit, it is a policy.You requested next day service and to purchase 4 bundles of 28"-30" hair, you also requested to have the unpurchased bundles of 28"-30" hair pre-dyed for your next day appointment a light grey to dark grey ombré and then you wanted all 4 bundles installed in a vixen sew-in...All of these services were requested but you continued to state you did not want to pay a deposit... This behavior is typical of someone who is not a serious client, but someone who’s a competitor looking to create false reviews.We never quoted you a price, but in your review you mention a $400 price, this price did not come from our business. That is just not true.We wish you luck on your hair journey!Read more

column1: Coda B.Tampa, FL7589179/25/2009First to ReviewI will never consider going to this "stealership" ever again. If I hear that someone is interested in a vehicle here my only response will be to ask why they would go all the way out to Apache Junction when I could easily punch them in the mouth and save them some time.First, I would like you to read something that these liars have posted on their site:"GUARANTEED credit approval for ANYONE! Even if you have bad credit or no credit you will qualify for financing. If you have had slow payments, bankruptcy, divorce, repossession(s), foreclosure(s), or marginal credit in your past, NO PROBLEM! We can approve financing for your new vehicle... GUARANTEED*!"These cheesy bastards had this same guarantee going when I went out of my way to check out what was a decent looking car. I went in with $1k to put down, an above average credit score, and a very decent full-time job at a fortune 500 company. They first said it maybe difficult to find me financing, being a first time buyer. That was understandable, but still contradictory to the "ANYONE!" part. So I did something that I had been very against through the entire experience of buying a car, I asked my parents to cosign for me. After talking to my parents and assuring them I would have no problems with the payment, they agreed. I was sure I would have no problems with the financing after the addition of their stellar credit.Keep in mind, this was also BEFORE the economic downturn.I completed the applications and went through the entire pain in the ass of getting my parents info. They said it would be less than an hour until they heard back about the APR and other specifics, so I went to get something to eat nearby. When I got back over an hour later without hearing from the kid who I was dealing with, I walked inside... and he was nowhere to be found. After finally finding someone by poking my head into random offices a man informed me the kid was in the back of the lot. I walked to the back to find him tossing a football around with a fellow slacker of a coworker.Waiting...waiting....waiting...Then, what do you know!? They COULDN'T get the financing! I couldn't believe these assholes put me through all they did to just leave me high and dry. They even had the nerve to try to talk me into the various POS cars that had been sitting around because no one wants an ugly POS car. As you could probably guess I got my ass out of there and quit letting these chumps waste my time.Two weeks later I was being handed the keys to the same year, make, and model car with lower miles at a certified dealership.I guess I do technically owe these dbags a few thanks: thanks for the hard inquiry on my credit report, thanks for  wasting my time and leaving me in a worse position than when I came, and thanks for giving me the chance to go to a dealership that could get the job done.Useful 19Funny 13Cool 12Business owner informationKevin U.Business Manager4/29/2011We work very closely with a wide variety of lenders.  While everyone is guaranteed to be approved for financing, not every one is approved for the amount they want.  I'm sorry your experience was less than satisfactory.Thank you for your feed back, it helps us as we strive to improve our quality in products and service for future clients.Read more

column1: Jackie V.Elite '2021Orlando, FL19023216624/21/2018Updated review12 photosFriday April 20th, 2018PICU doctor Benari says we are ready to go home. We disagree. Our child is still struggling to breathe, she's not sleeping at all and is having a hard time getting rid of secretions. We request that another x-ray be done. This morning Dr Sterrett says the x-rays came back and the lungs are clear. Pneumonia is all gone. We are excited and he also says they're going to move us to peds unit until she is able to sleep without oxygen. Which is what we had been fighting for. Later in the afternoon Doctor Martinez comes by says Hey I'm gonna be your doctor on the other side and we just got lab results back that show food particles in the lungs. (So we were going to be released without all lab results being back) let's do more tests while you're with us. Ok. Next Dr. Galves comes by and says he's going to be part of the team treating my child on the peds side. Says we need to get her back on antibiotics because her x-rays from this morning are showing that she still has pneumonia. What? But we were told that those same x-rays came back clean. I am so incredibly dissatisfied with the aftercare my child received from the DOCTORS in the PICU I want to reiterate that 90% of the nurses and RT staff here are amazing and great but the PHYSICIANS need to stop trying to send sick kids home.See all photos from Jackie V. for UMC Children's HospitalUseful 8Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationScott K.Business Employee4/23/2018We take patient feedback seriously, and would like to learn more about your experience. We encourage you to contact our team at 702-383-2376 or feedback@umcsn.com.Read more4/18/2018Previous reviewPediatric Hospital:We brought my daughter here due to complications from pneumonia. Limited by insurance, our only options were here or a hospital in Summerlin and we emphatically chose here. We were 1st admitted on the Pediatric side for 3 days and sent home with continuing antibiotics. The majority of the staff there was really friendly and nice with the exception of a resident doctor who didn't let you finish answering her question before asking another. She seemed to be rushed and lacked bedside manner. PICU:After being home for a full day, my daughter took a turn and we had to call 911 due to her not breathing. (She has Cerebral Palsy as an underlying condition) She was transported to the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit. We have been here for 5 days now and I must say we have received nothing but the best care! All the nurses are amazing and the doctors as well. We especially love Dr. Judith Ben Ari Lazcano. She is so kind, charasmatic and speaks to our daughter, not about her. They are not in any hurry to get her out of here either. Children's Hospital:According to the hospital website, there's a family retreat room here for parents to be able to recharge. We have never been told about it and when I asked, the nurses do not know anything about it. Parental support is lacking. Especially for the parents who are here not wanting to leave their child. It would be nice if they offered a room with a shower, fridge, microwave, water cooler, where a parent could go to recharge, store food, freshen up change clothes etc. without having to leave. Child life program:  Our experience with Child Life has been almost non existent. When she was admitted the 1st time, a child life specialist came to triage and told her that someone in her unit would be coming by to bring her movies, games etc etc etc. No one ever came. We asked for her 2 days and still nothing. She was too busy we were told. Ok why get a child all excited with promises of fun and games and then not follow through. How frustrating. The second stay was the same. Someone showed up on day 1, promising fun, games and movies but again, 5 days and nothing.Read more

column1: Jordan A.Henderson, NV0642/2/2019My son has spend the past 4 nights here. The doctor's are great, helpful and some of the nursing staff is great too. However, other nursing staff is just horrible. Here is an example:My wife had to pump her breasts for our baby at home. A nurse chastised my wife for doing this, as if it was any of her business. Then, later in the night, my son began to violently vomit. This same nurse laid him into his back while he was still vomiting. My wife yelled at her to sit him back up because he was still vomiting. This nurse looked at my wife, rolled her eyes at her and continued to hold him down as he struggled to get up as her vomited. We called for another nurse who came and helped us. We requested to never have her near our son again. You have to share rooms with other people. This is not bad except with every roommate my son had, he would develop an new symptom. They had a habit of moving roommates in and out of the rooms at crazy hours like 10pm - midnight. This would wake up my son and the new kid, who was being admitted. They would obviously cry and no one would get rest. My sons O2 and heart monitor chord kept coming loose. We called for a nurse to fix it and stop the "beeping". They use to come to the room when needed but they just resorted to calling you on the intercom, which would wake up the kids. After asking to fix the monitor chord, we waited for 30 minutes, no one came. My wife went out into the hall to get the staff and found a nurse outside our door scrolling through her cell phone. Nice!If you have an option, never go here, I won't.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationScott K.Business Employee2/8/2019Our team is here to help ensure your feedback receives the attention it deserves. It would be extremely helpful if we could speak with you and gather additional information about your experience. Please contact our team at 702-383-2376 or feedback@umcsn.com.Read more

column1: Keitan T.Surprise, AZ941037/3/2018If I could leave zero stars and still type a review, I would. I found this company through Groupon. I've been a steady consumer through Groupon for the last 10 years, and I've always had good experiences from the merchants I've found on there....until today. I purchased the Groupon and had an appointment for lash extensions booked for today. I was at another appointment right before, which was unexpectedly running longer than anticipated. So I called to inform them that I would be about 15 minutes late for my lash appointment. She informed me that I could be no more than 10 minutes late, and if I was going to be, then they would not only not let me come to my appointment, but would not reschedule me and would nullify my Groupon, and take it as a cancellation. I informed her that I wasnt cancelling, but was running late due to unforeseen and uncontrollable circumstances. She again reiterated the same thing. My husband is a business owner himself and could not believe the way I was treated. I contacted Groupon and got a full refund.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKristina D.Business Owner10/18/2018Thank you so much for your review and giving Beauty Kouture the perfect opportunity to discuss our cancellation policy! Thankfully this review is not based upon the quality of our services but rather one of our policies. In order to avoid any miscommunications or confusions about our industry standard cancellation policy, it is posted publicly on all social media sites, our website and our online scheduling system site. Our spa policies are also included in the multiple emails sent prior to scheduled appointments at Beauty Kouture. Furthermore it is discussed thoroughly over the phone before first time client appointments are scheduled. Following this discussion we collect the information needed regarding the credit card on file we require in order to schedule appointments due to this cancellation policy. Cancellation policies serve a phenomenal purpose and ultimately can strengthen the 'Client-Beauty Kouture' relationship. Scheduled appointments are very important to Beauty Kouture and the team members of Beauty Kouture, as they are reserved specifically for the individual and service requested. We understand that sometimes schedule adjustments are necessary; therefore, we respectfully request at least 24 hours notice for cancellations.Understandably that when clients forget, cancel or show up late to scheduled appointment without giving enough notice, we miss the opportunity to fill that appointment time, and clients on our waiting list miss the opportunity to receive services. Although it is the clients responsibility to remember appointment dates and times to avoid late arrivals, missed appointments and the cancellation fee as a courtesy, our appointments are confirmed 48 hours in advance because we know how easy it is to forget an appointment that was booked in advance. In addition to the 48 hour in advance confirmation, we also send a reminder 25 hours in advance, thus giving another opportunity to cancel within our cancellation policy and avoiding fees. As the services are reserved for the individual personally, a cancellation fee will apply.  Less than 24 hour notice will result in a charge to the card on file equal to 50% of the reserved service amount."No shows" will be charged to the card on file 100% of the reserved service amount.  Late arrivals are considered a no show due to the result of the professional not having ample amount of time to complete the scheduled service with the upmost quality in mind. The cancellation policy allows us the time to inform our standby guests on our waiting list of any availability, as well as keeping our Beauty Kouture team members schedules filled in which their financial livelihood depends upon, thus better serving everyone. All of our policies are presented and provided in multiple sources with the intention of excellent servicing for our established and future clientele. Again, thank you for allowing Beauty Kouture the perfect opportunity to discuss our policies and providing an additional source where our future clients can view our policies.Read more

Furthermore it is discussed thoroughly over the phone before first time client appointments are scheduled. Following this discussion we collect the information needed regarding the credit card on file we require in order to schedule appointments due to this cancellation policy. Cancellation policies serve a phenomenal purpose and ultimately can strengthen the 'Client-Beauty Kouture' relationship. Scheduled appointments are very important to Beauty Kouture and the team members of Beauty Kouture, as they are reserved specifically for the individual and service requested. We understand that sometimes schedule adjustments are necessary; therefore, we respectfully request at least 24 hours notice for cancellations.Understandably that when clients forget, cancel or show up late to scheduled appointment without giving enough notice, we miss the opportunity to fill that appointment time, and clients on our waiting list miss the opportunity to receive services. Although it is the clients responsibility to remember appointment dates and times to avoid late arrivals, missed appointments and the cancellation fee as a courtesy, our appointments are confirmed 48 hours in advance because we know how easy it is to forget an appointment that was booked in advance. In addition to the 48 hour in advance confirmation, we also send a reminder 25 hours in advance, thus giving another opportunity to cancel within our cancellation policy and avoiding fees. As the services are reserved for the individual personally, a cancellation fee will apply.  Less than 24 hour notice will result in a charge to the card on file equal to 50% of the reserved service amount."No shows" will be charged to the card on file 100% of the reserved service amount.  Late arrivals are considered a no show due to the result of the professional not having ample amount of time to complete the scheduled service with the upmost quality in mind. The cancellation policy allows us the time to inform our standby guests on our waiting list of any availability, as well as keeping our Beauty Kouture team members schedules filled in which their financial livelihood depends upon, thus better serving everyone. All of our policies are presented and provided in multiple sources with the intention of excellent servicing for our established and future clientele. Again, thank you for allowing Beauty Kouture the perfect opportunity to discuss our policies and providing an additional source where our future clients can view our policies.Read more

column1: pamela w.Miami, FL182510/22/2020BEST MOVERS are what they say- THE BEST. From estimate to finish they were the finest!  These guys loaded and unloaded us in a little over 24 hours and drove 10 of those hours.  WE moved to Destin, Florida from southpark.  2 years ago- we moved from 2 miles away and the movers did a lot of damage to our fine furniture.  they took over 2 days to get there.  These guys worked their butts off getting us unloaded, furniture placed, etc.  It was hot and sunny for the unload but they worked at the same pace on both ends.  We have a couple of scratches on the foot of one dresser and Juan went and got the furniture marker to fix it before leaving for the airport.  I can't say enough for these guys- polite and worked well under stress.  When things didn't look like they would fit- they somehow got it to fit in the truck, elevator, etc.  they didn't leave messes behind and after watching my daughter do a long-distance corporate move and seeing a guy walk off the job, the packers show up 2 days late (on the day of the move), I was really nervous about this move.  Our experience was fabulous!  Thanks again and I can't write enough good things about them.  so many movers use day labor that appear to be on prison release- these guys are all fine upstanding people that you wouldn't be afraid to be alone with....Juan is such a professional and so were his other guys.  And one more thing- our other estimates would have left us with a truck too small.  Thanks again!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJuan Z.Business Owner3/26/2021Dear Mr & Mrs Etter,We would like to thank you for trusting us to do your move from Charlotte to Destin, FL. column1: Leslie S.Williamsburg, VA26115/19/2018My husband and I hired the wonderful folks at Best Movers US to move our household from Charlotte to Williamsburg, Virginia, and we are absolutely thrilled with the quality of their work.  It began with the first phone call and continued through to a follow-up phone call we received a month after our move.  Throughout, everyone connected with Best Movers US was friendly, capable, and efficient and demonstrated that they cared about making our move as successful and stress free for us as possible.  We needed the company to do all of the packing, and the owner made two trips to our Charlotte home to be sure he had an accurate understanding of what that would entail and the materials and staff it would require.  When packing day came, the crew was exactly on time and worked diligently and carefully to pack every item and label every carton.  They showed the utmost respect for our belongings and did a great job of moving things within our house (and down our stairways) without damaging a thing.  If they had any questions about an item, they asked one of us and proceeded exactly as we advised.  The truck and crew arrived at our new home exactly on schedule and again worked diligently and carefully as they transferred every item from the truck to its appropriate location in the new house.  Everyone worked efficiently, but there was never the sense that they were rushing through things just to be finished.  As they had from the start, they showed that their first concern was making our move as successful and stress free for us as possible.  And they succeeded.  Now that we have unpacked every carton and removed the bubble wrap from every delicate item, we can report that not a single thing was damaged in any way.  This was not our first move, but our tenth, and if I could go back in time I would hire Best Movers US to handle every one of them.  Don't waste time shopping around - do yourself a favor and hire Best Movers US.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJuan Z.Business Owner6/9/2018Dear Leslie,We want to say thanks to you and your husband for trusting us to do your out of state move, we are very happy to learn that our moving services are the best experience you have had within your 10 moves and thank you for sharing it with our future customers, we also feel honored to be your moving company and thank you for your recognition and appreciation of our efforts to achieve our goal, that is to bring a quality smooth move to our customers. column1: Cynthia G.Countryside, Tucson, AZ701211/11/20172 photosI just bought a car from these guys from a Craigslist ad. Ad states perfect condition clean title asking $11,900 for a 2016 Nissan Altima. I should have seen the red flags but I like to believe there are honest people. We ended up buying the car for $10,500 on Monday Nov 6th, came back to Tucson took it to my mechanic where a bunch of codes came up I called them back on Wednesday and they say car is as is. My mechanic shows me so many issues that I feel the dealership should look at it we take it to the dealership Friday morning. They call us the same afternoon and say they don't recommend driving the car, the frame is bent, the codes that come up are longer than his arm and there are NO AIRBAGS. They say the condition of the car should be a salvage title which as mention before the car was advertised as a clean title. I've reached out to them again today via text to Work this out with them. The car is unsafe to drive so I'm left with a car I paid $10,500 for with no use to me. I wouldn't even give a star. I was lied to and taken advantage by these people who claim to be honest that he doesn't like to lie to people. They sold me a car with a salvage title without disclosing this to me. I've reached out twice today with no response. RUN ALL VIN #'s THROUGH  NICB.ORG. Apparently it takes some time for salvage titles to be recognized in other states this website is free and will give you the honest information on the vin so you don't get scammed.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMaria D.Business Owner12/27/2017Hello Cynthia, We have contacted you privately about this matter and have not received a response. This vehicle was not purchase at our business. You had previously posted a picture of the title  showing the dealership you purchased from was located in Wickenburg, Yelp took the photo down but left your review.We are sorry to hear about your situation and recommend you contact MVD or the Arizona Attorney General about the matter. We sent you other resources you can contact in the previous private message.   Our company only has two locations, both located in Phoenix at 2448 W. Van Buren St. and 3420 W. Buckeye Rd. We're sorry about the confusion and hope your situation is resolved.Read more

column1: CarrieSol C.Phoenix, AZ2933/12/2013Horrible horrible horrible! We booked a party from a groupon we had purchased a month ago. We had called and booked it right away as soon as we received the confirmation from groupon. Since the groupon had been such a success they had very limited available times. We had booked a party for March 9 from 10am-12pm. This was ok for us since my daughters birthday was on the 14th. We sent out invitations to all the little girls and they have been so excited about this party for weeks. We were emailed the forms to fill out and we immediately faxed it back to them of the colors and name of the birthday girl. On Friday March 8 we called around 2pm to ask a few questions and confirm everything was ready to go. We were told they did not have us down for a party. They were booked up and nothing we could do. The person on the phone basically argued with us on the reservation and said this is why they don't like sending emails. Nothing was apologetic or not even a notion of helping us fix this situation. We were left to plan a party for 8 girls in less than 24hrs notice an we were left to inform my daughter that she would not be having a party at the place her and her friends have been talking about ever since the invitations were sent out. I am very upset with this company and the lack of concern they had. Not even an hour after speaking with them they posted on their Facebook page on how they were no longer emailing or faxing forms to book parties. Regardless of whether they received our forms or not they should have written down our name and number in the time slot for the time we booked over the phone. And upon reviewing their reservation book they would of seen that they had not received any paperwork from us and called us to see if we were still having the party. We faxed in the paperwork and I understand that they may have not received it but that does not excuse why we were never written in for a phones in conversation of time. I do not recommend this place unless you like disappointing your children.Useful 11Funny 6Cool 1Business owner informationTawnna D.Business Owner3/14/2013First of all, we don't know or have EVER heard of a Carrie! Second, we DONT have a fax machine so I'm curious what number you are supposedly faxing too?! Third, I find it very very strange you had the SAME complaint under another company about a custom birthday. Seems like you make up fictitious reviews! I truly think Yelp should flag this review as it is obvious this customer likes to make up fictitious reviews, not just for us but for the other company that has also been a victim. (You can view her other negative review by clicking her link. It is very hard to believe she's had the same identical complaint with two different companies that specializes in custom birthday parties.)Bake Me a Cake has had over 300+ birthdays with NO complaints.. ever! Happy Baking!Read more

column1: James S.Gilbert, AZ299674/18/2020We needed to have a couple of king-size comforters cleaned and had used a different cleaners and they came back with an oder that made them smell worse than when we dropped them off. I requested a quote thru Yelp and Tracy got back to me within about an hour. She then offered a discount but we declined as we haven't been effected by the current pandemic and the price she quoted was less than our last place that we had them cleaned at.They said they would be ready by Monday the 20th and I got a text on the 17th that they were ready to pick up! Really wasn't expecting sooner but was pleased that they got them done so fast.When I opened them at home and they didn't have any oder I can't tell you how happy my wife was, one of the ones was her favorite before our last cleaning experience. I have found a "new" cleaners for all of my future needs!Thank-you Tracy and the rest of your team for helping out in these difficult times!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationTracy B.Business Owner5/4/2020Thank you so much for the nice review and for supporting us in these difficult times. column1: E S.Mesa, AZ3691617/28/2020Purchased a Yelp DealAccording to current Maricopa County regulations, face coverings are generally required in public establishments where social distancing isn't possible. Island Cleaners doesn't know and doesn't care. As of my most recent -- and last -- visit, none of their employees wore face masks, even in settings where direct interaction with the public is required. When I asked the store cashier about it, he didn't seem to be aware of their value.Although their dry cleaning services are stellar, their total lack of concern for the health of their customers is troubling. If you don't believe in face coverings, fine. But if you want to protect yourself from a contagious -- and possibly deadly -- disease in a state where the coronavirus pandemic has raged out of control, stay away from this place.Useful 2Funny 4Cool 1Business owner informationTracy B.Business Owner8/7/2020We only have one person at a time in the store everybody else waits outside and we have a 6 foot distancing and have move the cash register to accommodate this distancing. We offer hand sanitizing and offer a touchless payment option. We also have a dropbox and a drive-through and plenty of space to social distance which is our requirement. It is about 130° in there during the day due to no air-conditioning because of all the steam required to do our job. We would pass out if we had to wear facemasks in this type of establishment.Read more

column1: Renee N.Elite '2021Las Vegas, NV241597359910/16/20174 photosAlways looking to try a new French cafe and this place caught my eye one afternoon.It is located in a strip mall at the corner of Flamingo and Rainbow Blvd. it is a little hidden so just look for  the sign. When we walked in we were greeted by the lovely owner. The menu features French and Korean choices which I was surprised to see based on the name of the cafe. I ordered a ham/cheese croissant and hubby ordered the Croque Madam. Each entree came with a side of delicious organic greens and veggies. They were just delicious and so fresh. My croissant was tasty but hubby's sandwich was just ok. We then enjoyed some conversation with another one of the gals working there. The surroundings are a couple tables for two and a four top. The cafe features various local artists worksand many are for purchase. In addition, I purchased a couple of chocolate croissants and a baguette. All of my purchases were delicious.Overall we enjoyed our experience and although it was not the best French lunch we ever had, the warmth and friendliness of the owner and staff makes me want to come back.Useful 5Funny 1Cool 4Business owner informationKristin F.Business Owner12/23/2017Renee what a lovely review I am so happy that you thought I would pastries were delicious that is what we strive for here at Bonjour We hope to see you here soon again.Read more

column1: Stefany V.Las Vegas, NV304148671743212/7/201714 photosNew management has totally upgraded this little local bakery! Two sisters run this shop, with one in the front of house and one in the kitchen. The partnership works excellently, with tasty food served with attentive and genuinely caring service. The dining room itself is clean, bright, and nicely decorated, with art on display and available for sale. I've been in twice and am already on a first-name basis with Kristin!The bakery case is always full of beautiful desserts, but I tend to come here for lunch. The ham and cheese croissant is a good classic, and you can add an egg to make it even more indulgent. Their Korean fusion dishes with bulgogi come especially recommended and the burger I ordered had so much flavor! Their coffee drinks are super strong and well balanced, made with Lavazza. It's hard not to pop in every time I go grocery shopping in this plaza.See all photos from Stefany V. for Bonjour Bakery & DeliUseful 33Funny 13Cool 22Business owner informationKristin F.Business Owner12/23/2017Stefany Thank you so much for that amazing review yes sometimes customers come in but they feel more like friends. column1: Taylor S.Denver, CO473853161419/28/20173 photosThe location is under new ownership, and having not visited before, I have nothing to compare it too. I'm absolutely fine with that though, because Bonjour Bakery & Deli was an absolute delight.I wanted a place to pop in for a quick breakfast and a coffee while I got some work done. They are located in a big shopping center, so there is parking aplenty. I walked in to be greeted by a pastry case of the finest treats. They have a large chalkboard menu, and some of their more savory breakfast options include omelettes, croque monsieur, and a ham and cheese croissant. And fear not. They still make the famous almond croissant that I heard nearly every guest order while I sipped my almond milk latte.This isn't the place where you're going to get fancy latte art, but I enjoyed the creaminess of the dairy alternative and the smooth flavor of their espresso. I devoured my ham and cheese croissant. They fly their butter in from France, and you can taste the difference as the flaky pastry dances across your tongue. The side salad that accompanied was a forest of vegetables with a champagne vinaigrette.What really caught my eye was how warm and welcoming the staff and owner were to every guest. They were greeted with either a warm smile or a warm hug. You can tell that they are really trying to build a community and take pride in what they do. This was a little reminder and taste of my time in France, merci!Useful 29Funny 10Cool 17Business owner informationKristin F.Business Owner9/29/2017Thank you so much for this amazing review, we hope that you will come back very soonRead more
column2: Business owner informationKristin F.Business Owner9/29/2017Thank you so much for this amazing review, we hope that you will come back very soonRead more

column1: Ashley N.Elite '2021Boston, MA415123994/14/20191 photoThe staff at Kodak is super nice & so helpful. Their interior is also very modern, organized & clean! The service I received was extremely high quality & I am ecstatic with my purchases.To start, I was slightly late for appointment with Dr. Jennifer Trac - literally running to the store because I got lost in the PATH. The staff was super understanding and checked me in very quickly, breezing through my pretest while asking me all the right questions and getting all the relevant information.Allan & Tate were extremely professional but still friendly during my visit. I felt really comfortable & confident in their ability to help me.When I went back to see Dr. Trac, she blew me away with her attention to detail and her ability to easily translate all her results into regular people language that I could understand. She was extremely patient in answering all my questions, and giving me an updated prescription that was definitely needed. Allan is actually a magician and picked out a beautiful pair of frames for me. They are light-weight titanium and suit my face really well, he has a great eye!Tate is the sweetest, he was on the phone with the insurance portal forever because the website for direct billing was down for maintenance when I got there. Their direct billing service is extremely convenient & definitely something I'll look for in the future.My glasses were ready in about a week & a half, which was expected because my prescription is kind of high and I added a lot of features on the lenses. The blue blockers are highly recommended by me if you spend a lot of time on a screen, it's made my eyes fatigue a lot less than they used to.I highly recommend you come! I think they have a discount for Ryerson students which definitely helps on the student budget, but regardless of who you are they definitely take your eye health seriously. Such an amazing experience, I'm blown away by the quality of service from this establishment.MODO light weight titanium frames with anti-glare, anti-smudge, high index, blue blocker lenses.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationTaylor C.Business Customer Service4/24/2019Thank you so much for your kind words, Ashley. column1: Dino A.Old Toronto, Toronto, Canada076/17/2019Very rude. Terribly unprofessional with regards to appointments and timing. I was so surprised how rude the staff were.Update July 13th 2019:I do not see the truth behind your brand being "all about positivity" when the basis of this issue stems from me being spoken to incredibly rudely at your store. I don't appreciate the duality of treatment in person and on the internet - because it seems that customer service only matters when the truth is being posted for everyone to see. I also don't think an additional discount will rectify the unnecessary attitude and waste of time I was awarded when waiting for my appointment. UPDATE:My response to the company:It's great to hear that you set a high standard for your staff - but the fact that I was spoken to rudely from the moment I stepped into the store, I find to be incredibly alarming. Particularly given that the norm for eye exams is that contacts are to be replaced upon taking them out, and if not, for a contact lens containers to be provided - rather than have the customer all but request to use one. I also need not be squeezed for money and be told that I would have to pay an additional fee for a contact lens prescription. Additionally, if an appointment is made, then an appointment is to be kept - rather than change the "assumed length of an appointment" from 30 minutes to an hour, given that the optometrist themselves were running late. I shouldn't have to wait 20 minutes then be asked if there was somewhere I needed to be...All I could think about as I was storming out was that there was no way on earth that I was going to keep my appointment and PAY this lady to be rude to me. I am never one to cause a scene, but god I could not believe this woman was speaking this way to me.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationTaylor C.Business Customer Service10/24/2019Update for Yelp viewers: Based on the direct messaging conversation from July, we continued to apologize for the experience and tried to offer a solution, but unfortunately unable to work with individual to create an overall positive experience moving forward. From feedback of staff involved and individual there seems to be two different stories and perspectives of this interaction. We truly believe our staff is friendly and accommodating as proved from our 4.8 rating on Google. We take feedback very seriously, try to resolve experiences, and are always improving. Once again we appreciate all feedback and hope to get the opportunity to improve the experience when concerns arises.Thank you for providing your feedback and letting us know about your concern, Dino. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met in your interaction with us. We believe all our staff at Kodak Lens | Toronto Eyecare are friendly and helpful. Our nature is never to be rude to any of our patients and I would like to personally address your concerns. We're sorry if our Optometrist was a bit behind and could not see you on time. The patients before you required a bit more time for their appointment to fully address their eye health concerns. We will try our best to improve wait times and when our Optometrist do get to see the patient, they get our undivided attention and time to ensure all their eye care needs are addressed. Please get in touch with me by messaging us or contacting me at taylor@eyetrusteyecare.ca and I'd be happy to help you out.Best Regards,Taylor ChungRegistered OpticianCustomer ServiceKodak Lens | Toronto EyecareRead more

column1: Becki M.Madison, WI5222/6/2019I did not have a great experience at Healthy Vet. I brought my cat in because my normal vet was closed and I was leaving town. I felt like they used scare tactics to make the problem seem worse than it was, in hopes that I would come back in for another visit, to get more money. Everyone I interacted with (aside from the front desk) seemed condescending and inattentive. I feel as though my opinion/input was disregarded entirely. I have a friend who has had a similar experience leading me to believe this was not an isolated incident. I would not recommend them to anyone.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMike B.Business Manager2/6/2019Good Afternoon Becki.As this is the only communication or feedback that you have given us since your visit, I have not had the opportunity to talk to you about your concerns.  I am very sorry that your experience with us did not meet your expectations.  I have reviewed the audio and video recording of your interaction with the doctor and technician during the examination that day.  The video simply does not support your claims.  Your pet had a potentially serious injury, the doctor provided her exam findings and described to you the possible outcomes which you refer to as, "scare tactics".  The doctor did want your pet to be seen again in 3-5 days due to swelling and other irritation in the area of the injury. That way she could provide a more accurate assessment of the injured area.  She also prescribed medications for your cat's pain and possible infection.  This was done with your cat's health as the top priority, not to "to get more money" as you say.During the interaction with the doctor and our technician you were actively asking questions about the injury itself and at home care.  The doctor answered all of your questions and you seemed to be having a very cordial back and forth conversation.  Both the doctor and technician ended their interactions with you by asking you if you had any questions about anything.  I am sorry that you feel that your, "opinion/input was disregarded entirely."  The video recording did not substantiate your description of our staff's behavior.  I am not certain what would motivate you to post this review and cite things that just didn't happen, but I hope that you are able to find a veterinarian that will better meet your expectations in the future.Mike BVeterinary Practice ManagerHealthy Pet Veterinary ClinicRead more

They used something hard like a screwdriver to remove the old weights, gouging the rim in the process and leaving scratches. The PSI of the tires was not checked prior to handing the car off either. column1: Allison D.Toronto, Canada684623312/9/20183 photosI'm a big fan of Rolltation, and prior to relocating to a new office, I would very frequently either dine-in or order take-out (via Ritual) from Rolltation. In terms of "fast food", I really appreciated the quality of the ingredients and that the menu has some semblance of being healthy, with a colourful variety of veggies. When ordering, you can either choose from their set combinations, or build your own, then watch them assemble your meal. Look for the "rice printer", it's pretty neat! My favourite is the Teri Shrimp combination, with shrimp (boiled or tempura), creamy crab or "kani" salad, carrots, edamame, cabbage, cucumber, corn, and crunchy tempura bits. Delicious and refreshing, with lots of vegetables, it felt like it was a relatively well-balanced meal. The sushi burrito format does seem to be incredibly messy and awkward to eat and I found it difficult to bite through the seaweed wrap without all the ingredients falling out, although all the flavours, textures and sauces came together better in a roll (not to mention having a prettier presentation with its neat cross-section). The bowl is obviously easier to eat, but all the components are sort of separated from each other. If getting Rolltation, I almost always ordered through Ritual. I found that sometimes wait times could be long at lunchtime, and it was better for me to continue working at the office and then pick up my food when I was notified. Also, there is limited seating, while I think the tables could have been better optimized (considering the huge oval table in the middle).Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationChris W.Business Owner12/12/2018Hi Allison! Thank you so much for this amazing and thorough review. We’re super glad you were able to take advantage of our Ritual ordering to save time.See you again soon!Read more
column2: Business owner informationChris W.Business Owner12/12/2018Hi Allison! Thank you so much for this amazing and thorough review. We’re super glad you were able to take advantage of our Ritual ordering to save time.See you again soon!Read more

column1: Allison Y.Elite '2021Toronto, Canada9499230904/4/20178 photosReesor is a well known farming family in Toronto/GTA.  It is no surprise that Reesor's Market & Bakery is a miniature farmers' market.  I visited one Saturday afternoon in winter to sate a butter tart craving.  I found fresh farmers' market quality and home-styled baked good made by local producers at Reesor's.  I also expected and found fresh produce, small batch home-style soup in jars, gourmet cheese from Ontario and Quebec and gourmet cold cuts.  What I didn't expect were an array gourmet ready-to-heat frozen dinner entrees, including gluten free frozen dinner entrees, gluten free pantry and baking groceries, organic groceries, antibiotic free and organic meat, etc..  Reesor's Market is right on pulse on the food trends.  If you are not particularly in need of organic and gluten free products, you would find the shelves and shelves of gourmet and unique pantry groceries vastly interesting.  Here I found soup beanie bags (just add meat and cook a pot of stew or soup), spices and rubs, gourmet chilli sauces and cooking sauces, honey by Ontario beekeepers, local jams, speciality pasta, locally roasted ground coffee beans, chips and dried fruits, etc..  I was so amazed.  I ran through shelves after shelves.  I walked out of the store with butter tarts, a bag of soup beanie bag to make a Chuckwagon Chilli, and a can of Piri Piri Chicken Dry Rub.  My dinner mate was in for a treat that evening.See all photos from Allison Y. for Reesor's Market & BakeryUseful 5Funny 1Cool 3Business owner informationJay R.Business Owner3/13/2018Dear Allison,Thank you very much for the lovely review you wrote about your visit to Reesor's Market & Bakery. We're so glad you found lots of foods you liked.Warm regards,Susan ReesorRead more
column2: Business owner informationJay R.Business Owner3/13/2018Dear Allison,Thank you very much for the lovely review you wrote about your visit to Reesor's Market & Bakery. We're so glad you found lots of foods you liked.Warm regards,Susan ReesorRead more

column1: Sheeza M.Markham, Canada2359/23/2017Great customer service and fresh produce! It's just fun to take my son to pick food or pumpkins come the holiday season. Love the fact it's in stouffville so it's close to home too. Only minus is their parking lot is gravel and makes for pushing the shopping cart to the car a bit harder for seniors.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJay R.Business Owner3/12/2018Hi Sheeza,Thank you for visiting Reesor's Farm Market and taking the time to write a lovely review. Just to clarify for other visitors:  Our year-round store Reesor's Market & Bakery is located at 5758 Main St., Stouffville and is open Mon-Fri. 8-7 and Sat. 8-6, closed Sundays.  With a paved parking lot. Reesor's Farm Market is located at 10825 Ninth Line at Elgin Mills, just south of Stouffville. It's open from June-October, Mon.-Sat. Our farm market has a gravel parking lot, with paved walkways. We're glad you and your son enjoyed picking pumpkins at our farm market. Please visit us in June and early July when you can pick your own strawberries too!Thanks again.Susan ReesorRead more
