column1: Kate H.AZ, AZ65483310/24/2020Wow. This company is doing EVERYTHING right. I recently got a crack in my brand-new car's windshield. My insurance company initially scheduled me with another company and after leaving work and showing up, they were unable to replace it that day due to the safety cameras and recalibration and had very restrictive hours to reschedule.After asking around, I was referred to Best Glass. I called yesterday and Mary answered. I explained the situation and she was so kind and so efficient. She explained, in detail, the process and what to expect with the replacement as well as the required recalibration. She then let me know they would be able to come and install my new glass THAT SAME DAY at the location of my choice. (the last company said I HAD to go to their shop) She said the arrival time would be between 3-5. At about 220, Daniel called and let me know he would be arriving in about 20 minutes. (EARLY!!!) He arrived, let me know the timeline and went to work. When finished, he asked to show me the final product and I was really impressed to see they actually used Hyundai glass, not aftermarket. He was done in less than 40 minutes, no ugly tape put on my car, and it looks amazing. I cannot recommend this company enough. The customer service is stellar from each person I came in contact with and the work is high quality.UsefulFunnyCool 1Business owner informationBob H.Business Owner10/26/2020Thank you for all the kind words Kate. Our mission is to exceed our customers expectations and it's always nice to hear that we were successful. Thanks for putting  your trust in us. We appreciate your business.Read more
column2: Business owner informationBob H.Business Owner10/26/2020Thank you for all the kind words Kate. Our mission is to exceed our customers expectations and it's always nice to hear that we were successful. Thanks for putting  your trust in us. We appreciate your business.Read more

column1: Peggy B.Peoria, AZ1861/4/2020Signatures has been my go to for gifts for several years. They always has cute jewelry and little cute gifts. That has changed. I've been in a couple of times in the last few months and they have discontinued so many products and what the do carry now seems to be higher priced and geared to the older customer. I made mention to that effect and was told "we are trying to stay on trend." Sad, but I guess I have to look for a new "go to."Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationWendy B.Business Owner1/7/2020Peggy B.I am very sorry that Signatures won't be your "go to" gift store anymore. I understand that it is often disappointing when a favorite jewelry line or other special find is no longer available to you. Your comment was from January 4th, 9 days after our busy holiday season. The store's selections are always depleted at this time as we are waiting for new merchandise to arrive. I will be going to Atlanta market next week to purchase new merchandise.  From a business perspective, Signature has to evaluate and react to the demands of our customer base as a whole.  After 22 years of operating this neighborhood boutique, I realize that phasing out a product line when interest fades and introducing new is what keeps Signatures fresh. I strive to appeal to everyone coming through the doors, young and old. We have a diverse selection in jewelry and home goods.  Natural Life is a colorful line predominately loved by a younger demographics, gifts starting at $8.00. This has been a favorite item for daughters and granddaughters. Kendra Scott is a large jewelry line appealing to all ages and has been a big hit.  Brighton has jewelry selections from $25.00 or leather handbags as high as $460.00. Two new lines that we brought in recently are Enewton Jewelry, classic silver and gold pieces with a modern flare and Tula Blue with a boho vibe.  Both have been well received. Dealing with the fact that online shopping has taken a huge financial volume from brick and mortar stores such as Signatures, it requires me as the store owner to pay extremely close attention to purchasing trends. I do everything in the interest of my loyal customers. I appreciate the support and patronage that I receive from the familiar faces that do consider Signatures their "go to" gift store.Read more

column1: Becky L.Las Vegas, NV0101/10/2021We searched a while for a new dentist that was closer to us.  We came across this dentist office and then researched it.  Everything seemed good and there  were a lot of positive reviews.  My husband and I both have gone, and we couldn't be any more pleased.  Jessica at the front desk is extremely delightful, patient, and caring.  She wentout of her way to help with appointment scheduling.  She even called us to get us in sooner because there had been a couple cancellations.Ivy, the dentist assistant is pleasant.  She was gentle and patient with those very annoying and a lot of time painful bitewing x-ray thingys.  We both had Ashley for our hygienist.  She was awesome!She gave us both an amazing thorough cleaning and offered lots of advice on cleaning techniques and tools to use for better cleaning.  We both are very happy with Dr. Brian.  My husband had to have a little work done, and he couldn't be more satisfied with the results and with Dr. Brian.  His wife Alicia was also in on both of our appointments. She too is very nice, and we enjoyed talking with her.  Our overall experience with Nevada Trails Dental was very positive and we will be booking our future appointments with their office.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAlisha B.Business Owner2/17/2021Thank you Becky!  Our team always tries to treat you as we would want to be treated.  We are happy you enjoyed your experience and look forward to treating you in the future.Read more

column1: Kristie S.Las Vegas, NV114381610/10/2018My husband and I have been coming here for about five years now. This entire office is great! Their rates are affordable, they are organized, and they are friendly.I especially like Ashley the hygienist. She is very thorough and will scrape off any last dirty spots I notice. (I am picky!) I never feel like she is rushing to finish.Dr. Brian is professional and calm. The one time I needed a couple of cavities filled, I felt very comfortable with him.Dr. Brian's wife Alisha is often at the front desk and around the office. She is always careful to thoroughly explain all the fees for cleanings, etc.It occurred to me to write this review after my cleaning visit today. It was my 2-year-old daughter's second cleaning ever and her first at this office. I took her to a pediatric specialist office for her first cleaning, and that did not go well. That office was very busy and loud. She hated it and screamed throughout her cleaning. But worse than that, the visit was about $350!?! Her visit today at Nevada Trails Dental was a dramatically better experience. She did fine throughout her cleaning, due to Ashley the hygienist's patience and fun manner. column1: Aaron S.Henderson, NV029/24/2017NOT SO HONEST OR RELIABLE. We used Carla and her staff to do our 2016 corp taxes at the recommendation of our new bookkeeper and all I can say is that we now regret it dearly. After being told that they would work together and get things sorted out for us asap and agreeing to pay their high prices for what was said to be quality Bookkeeping & CPA work, we waited for months to even hear back from them on the status of our tax filing. This was somewhat expected due to their high volume of returns in tax season but concerned we called Carla's office and were told that an extension was filed weeks back and that everything should be done within a couple months. Sometime later we received our 2016 corp return as promised however it was not aligned accurately with what our 2016 books were reporting as promised. In addition to that, they also decided to tack on a few hundred dollars worth of extra charges to our bill which was not disclosed to us up front and seemed to appear out of thin air. We contacted Carla again to see what was going on with the differences and she informed me that she would look into it and get back to us. We paid her her fees as agreed for the work performed in good faith thinking that she would make things right in the end and guarantee her work, but here it is several months later and just a couple weeks away from the final tax deadline and nothing has been done. Maybe others have had a different experience with Carla and her staff, but based on ours we cannot recommend her services and will definitely not be using her ever again.Useful 1Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationCarla D.Business Owner9/28/2017Thank you, Aaron, for taking the time to write this lengthy review.  With over 30 years as a CPA it is always been my aim to please our clients and I take their taxes seriously.  Obviously, some misunderstandings have taken place and for that I am truly sorry.  According to my records your 2016 return was filed so if you would please contact my office at your earliest convenience I would like to get this cleared up for you.Read more

Who needs a resourse during a Pandemic that preys on the elderly and their pets.. when I requested to speak to a supervisor Lisa response was they are not going to do anything to help me. column1: M J.Mesa, AZ0925/12/2020There are so many disappointing experiences we've had at this location that I will never, in good conscience recommend this vet clinic or bring my pet for treatment here again.  Their scheduling is unreliable and their scheduling staff does not invoke compassion or concern. Our emergency appointment that was booked in the morning for mid afternoon and was rescheduled for the next day despite our pet experiencing internal bleeding.  If we would have known we'd be cancelled, we would have looked elsewhere. After calling back and practically begging to have our pet seen, he was squeezed in an hour before closing.  When we arrived, we spoke with someone else who told us to come in the following day.  We had to insist that we spoke to someone who said we could bring him in. Meds were dispensed and we were advised to return if the symptoms get worse.  At this point we will take our pet elsewhere for any further treatment.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationLisa R.Business Customer Service5/13/2020Hi there, we're so sorry to hear about your frustration with not being able to get seen in a timely manner at our Phoenix hospital. column1: Nicole E.Elite '2021Orange County, CA24538522192/3/20218 photosTop golf is located at the far end of Mgm by wet republic. It's a long walk if your walking from inside the hotel so be ready for a trek! Otherwise, ample of parking upfront and free.Reservations required for the most part but if they have open reservations they will accommodate walk ins but I definitely recommend reservations in general. If you arrive early they have an awesome bar with open seating and ample of large screen TVs. Drinks were reasonably priced and had the variety from beer, seltzer's to cocktails. The food menu also looked delicious but ate before so can't comment on the food. The setup is floor levels and can really cater to the masses! This was my first time at any top golf so I wasn't sure what to expect! Once our bay was cleaned we were paged and explained the rules and how everything works. It was greatly appreciated! We were also setup on the score monitor and released. We did an hour ($79 on a Friday) but you can add additional time if available. We also got a cocktail/ food server that kept the drinks coming. Overall, a super fun time even for a first time golfer! I loved that we could just enjoy the lounge area before and after golfing. Kept the party going and they play some good tunes!See all photos from Nicole E. for TopgolfUseful 20Funny 10Cool 16Business owner informationHugh D.Business Customer Service2/4/2021Hi Nicole. column1: Vanni C.Elite '2021Hayward, CA271964121/18/20211 photoI've been wanting to try top golf for a while now and wasn't sure what to expect .. im happy I finally got to go. It is definitely an ideal group activity or date night.During COVID reservations are required and strongly recommended particularly on weekends. We came on MLK day and called in advance but staff stated that we did not need a reservation because Mondays are slow.. I am guessing they did not anticipate the holiday traffic.. so upon arriving we were advised to make an online reservation right on the spot or else we could not golf .. luckily their were openings within an hour.. One particular staff person was very accommodating and was actually able to get us into a bay within 15 minutes of our arrival despite another staffing insisting  that he could not help us or see the avaliable time slots.. smh refusing to accommodate paying customers is literally the refusal of money for the entire establishment..Anyway staff was kind and helped us get set up..there is a 4 person group limit.We ordered food which was surprisingly good Edamame 5/5- a little salty but good Wings - 4/5 cooked crispy which i liked but they didn't have a lot of sauce/Rub Buffalo chicken dip 5/5Alcoholic drinks (spiked lemonade slushy Kentucky mule pink lemonade) all were really weak and didn't taste like alcohol or give any buzz.. id suggest sticking with the food Price is per hour and based on the level and day of the week. 4th level is more expensive than first etc.A little of everythingUseful 3FunnyCool 1Business owner informationHugh D.Business Customer Service1/19/2021Hi Vanni! column1: Desiree H.Elite '2021Monterey Park, CA27017185/31/20211 photoWalked in on a Saturday night without a reservation and got a bay within 35 minutes on the first floor. Higher leveled bays have longer wait times, but since we didn't mind, the first floor was fine for us!Our food and drinks came out very quickly and were delicious! The buffalo chicken dip was probably my favorite dish since it was easy to eat and not too buffalo-y. Both wing flavors were good, but the garlic parmesan ones were a tad on the oilier side in my opinion. Both sides of fries tasted as expected, but were a little bit smaller than expected. All this food, and 2 other pitchers of beer that are not pictured, fed 6 people easily!The golf was super fun and very interactive. They had various games that made hitting the ball more interesting and you could also formulate teams! There a variety of different golf clubs to choose from, so if you're a beginner like me, you can try them all to see which one works best for you! We spent about 2 hours golfing and it was just the right amount of time for 6 of us. We would definitely recommend if you're looking for a fun outing for friends or family!New Belgium IPA beer tower, buffalo wings, garlic parmesan wings, buffalo chicken dip, side of fries and sweet potato waffle friesUseful 3FunnyCool 2Business owner informationHugh D.Business Customer Service5/31/2021Hi Desiree. column1: Tony H.Elite '2021Chatsworth, CA50747137215/9/20214 photos1 check-inTop golf was an absolute blast, I came here with a group of friends (6 of us total) we had a hub or booth (whatever the area you hit is called) for 2 hours. The balls have some chip inside that detects where they've been hit which keeps score on the little monitor. It's kind of like driving range golf with bowling scores.My buddy reserved our space so I don't really know how all that works, but we got 2 hours to play and had to spend around $300 on food and drinks which was easy enough between 6 of us. The food was really good, the facility itself is pretty amazing. Tons of TVs everywhere to catch sports and ever keep an eye on the score for the game you bet on. The building is pretty much connected to the mgm, they have a tram from the front of the mgm that takes you over (currently cause of the Rona it's not operating) but you can walk all the way through the hotel toward where the pool is to get there or try your luck driving over to their parking lot.Useful 12Funny 5Cool 12Business owner informationHugh D.Business Customer Service5/9/2021Wahoo! column1: Wesley W.Elite '2021Monterey Park, CA1297884215/27/20211 check-inIt was just an okay experience.  Waitress seemed a little perturbed and not all that friendly.   As for the game play, the concept is good with multiple games but the programs are glitchy.  We were playing a game hit 3 balls then go to next player and hit their name on the screen.  It looked like the computer switched over but the score registered to the previous player. It wasn't like we were playing fast either.  Other people I've spoken to had similar issues.Also, balls are in bad shape.  I've seen better at range.  But these balls seemed hard and feel dead.  Probably made just for Topgolf to keep balls from going to far.  Clubs were basic.  I don't know if taking your own would make a difference with those crappy balls. As for the food, it was pretty good bar food.  We had some chips and melted cheese thing along boneless wings.  All were pretty good.  Try to get upper deck.  Much cooler view up there.This place would get 4 stars if they would fix their computer glitches.  Games are fun and the drinks good.Useful 1Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationHugh D.Business Customer Service5/27/2021Hi Wesley. column1: Danielle F.Farm Pond, Charlotte, NC0885/8/20195 photosI went there for a balayage- I have dark brown hair !! I wanted to go light brown and ashy. I got a cut as well. I was in the chair for 7 hours - no joke !!!The color I get can be sometimes unpredictable. But the technique was poor. I was charged 148 ... and I hated it. The color and technique did not mesh. it looked as though it was foils that had grown out and not placed evenly to boot. See photos. I had called Shannon the manager and she said since i " changed my mind " they would not correct it for free nor did they offer to give a discount  on correction services. The cut also was not layered it was a trim -- there was no cleaning up the layers in order to make a fresh cut.  Therefore not allowing the horrible color to even maybe look good. I was so upset they told me to come in and get a consultation to review it and see what I now wanted. I did not, instead  I went to the Savvy Salon -- and had my world rocked- avoid modern like the plague.Modern - a little advice. If a customer is that unhappy you do everything you can to correct it. You don't blame the customer and accuse them of being Indecisive and make them pay twice!!! You guys lost a customer and I will be trying to prevent everyone from going to your salon if I canSee all photos from Danielle F. for Modern Salon & SpaUseful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationModern Salon M.Business Manager5/10/2019Danielle,Thank you for taking the time to review Modern Salon and Spa.  Generally, it's not our policy to offer a color correction because someone changes their mind in regards to the service they requested.  However, our team did respond when you reached out and set an appointment to discuss options.  After that appointment was missed, Shannon then reached out to you to reschedule the service because it was not a case of negligence or bad coloring. column1: Daniel F.San Jose, CA141312/29/2015Very happy to be a Volo broadband customer. Just got a fiber install to my apartment when ITV3 refused to provide service due to lack of signups (very silly on ITV3's part, since most students have high turnover for apartments and they have done little to garner student interest). The service is actually a gigabit, you can tell from Speedtest that the speeds are only limited by backbone fiber up to Chicago, etc. The prices are very good for the speed, as compared to local incumbent telco. The install was very quick, professional, and cleanly done. (edit: 5/31/16, ignore this paragraph) On the downsides, you are getting a private IPv4 address with no native IPv6 support, but this is only really a problem if you want to run a server. This is easily alleviated with a VPN, and at gigabit speeds, I really don't mind. The IPv4 exhaustion has been ongoing for years, long before Volo existed, and old telco companies only have the advantage because they have been around longer. If you really need a public IPv4/IPv6 to your residence, you should probably look into business or metro ethernet plans.Nevermind, read the comment by Peter below and the Volo FAQ on their website, x.x.x.254 on your subnet is DMZ'd. You still don't get an IPv6 address, but that's an easier problem to solve compared to no public IPv4.Useful 6Funny 2Cool 3Business owner informationPeter F.Business Owner3/15/2016Thanks for the positive words!  I wanted to mention that even our apartment services are compatible with running your own server.  There is a NAT involved, but you actually have a public static IPV4 address assigned to you.  If you'd like help setting up your equipment to take advantage of it, just give our office a call (best hours for this kind of detailed tech question are 10am-6pm).Read more

column1: Lance S.Peoria, AZ014/10/2021On 4/3/2021 I went to the Cycle Gear on Reems Rd. to have new tires mounted and balanced. The guys they had doing the mounting and balancing made it obvious they didn't want to do the work. The guy I was first talking to told me he had to get someone else To do it because he was leaving in 30 mins. The next guy got my info and starting looking for the tubes for my tires ( I called ahead to make sure they had them ) He said he was only able to find the front tube and they wouldn't mount my tires until they received the rear tube, so i told him I would go purchase a new rear tube from another place in town and bring it to them. He seemed hesitant but I let him know I needed them done because this is the only time I could do it because I ride the bike to work during the week (went to Ride Now to get the rear tube). By the time I got back they started the front tire. Rear tire was left unattended on showroom floor. Had to find someone in the back to give them the new rear tube. Took them an additional 2 hours to get them done, only to find out they were done incorrectly on my way to work when the front end started to sway on the freeway. Which it has never done before. I called Monday to speak to a manager after work to let him know the situation and that I noticed they had left old weights on one side of the rim. The manager argued that the tires left the "shop" perfectly balanced and that it didn't matter that the old weights were still on. And after he told me he has been doing this for a long time and knew what he was talking about I asked him when his balancer was recalibrated. He admitted seemingly proudly that it was around a year to a year and a half that the procedure was done. Which in reality this should be done at the very least twice a month but in reality should be done every morning to ensure safety for anyone who gets their tires balanced (especially for motorcycle tires). After giving him this information he apologized and offered a full refund and a free rebalance. I made him aware that I would prefer to go to a different location due to the Obvious lack of knowledge and "want to" at his location. If I was a beginner Rider I could have lost my life due to the lack of attention these people had. Want to keep two wheels down? Don't go to the cycle gear on Reems Road for Mount and balance.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKiersten T.Business Manager4/12/2021Lance, we are so sorry about your experience - this is not the Cycle Gear difference we pride ourselves on. We will be sharing your comments with our team to address this right away. If you want to get in touch with us directly, please feel free to email us at cs@cyclegear.com and reference this review.Read more

column1: Leslie D.Elite '2021Las Vegas, NV84212514994/17/2019MY STORY: I've been working as a nurse for almost 2 years on a critical care floor, and it has severely affected my body the last 3 months. I always come home achy but after my hot shower, stretch, and ice routine I am good. I get a basic massage every few months and I'm satisfied. But man, the last 3 months my neck and lower back has become stiffer, sore, and intolerable. I saw a chiropractor for a month and it was immediately relief, but I'll tense up again after an hour. I thought to myself... I am too young to see a pain specialist (I'm 24F) and I need to get this under control before I cripple myself. My friend recommended me to Scott and now I'm a believer in eastern and western techniques. MY EXPERIENCE: I didn't know what to expect because I kept reading that this wasn't a "relaxing" massage but a massage that will fix me. He started off with seeing how strong my upper and lower limbs were, and if one was weaker, he would do these acupuncture techniques and press on certain areas of my body, then repeat the test and surprisingly I did gain strength. It's crazy because when I work out, my trainer would always correct my form because I would favor my right side. I'm writing this review 3 weeks after the massage, and I've noticed a huge difference in my squats in terms of balance and stability. I asked him to focus on my concerned areas (neck, shoulder, and back) and he did an amazing job with loosening the "knots and tension." There were some painful moment but I was able to relax and at some point I almost fell asleep. It's difficult to compare his technique to other people because it's that different. It's better than any other deep tissue massage I've received and at the end of the session I felt less restricted and tight. During the next few weeks (with continued stretching too), I felt less muscular pain and weakness. I also felt stronger and more balanced in the gym and at work. OVERALL: He's pricy but definitely worth it. I already booked my next appointment.Useful 8Funny 3Cool 9Business owner informationScott Z.Business Owner9/29/2019Thank you Leslie. I appreciate you giving me a chance to help with your problems as well as the positive review.  I'll put you on my cancelation text blast list.  When someone cancels with a late notice, I send a quick text out and the first person to respond gets a great deal.  That will save you some cash.  Also always check my website "specials" page from time to time.  Scott Z.  Proactive Health Therapeutic Services.                                 Eliminate Pain | Increase Strength | Improve Range of Motion     "Better Sooner"!Read more

column1: Jon W.Las Vegas, NV83343/8/2021Things have changed a lot at Port of Subs since I used to oversee the one on Flamingo and Jones and the one on Highland and W desert inn. They sliced the meat extremely thin, and the cheese was so thin it was almost transparent. I thought they were going to put another layer of chicken but no just one thin layer. I understand they're only supposed to put a certain amount of slices of meat on a sandwich but if it's the butt of the meat and the slices are the size of a piece of salami they should compensate by putting more meat. I don't know if this is their protocol now, or maybe they are trying to save on food cost but I would have liked to have had more meat. Perhaps they should weigh the meat out like they do at restaurants like Arby's so people won't unfair sizes of slices of meat, because if it was a freshly unwrapped piece of chicken the slices would have been a lot bigger. Then before I got rang up I verified that I could get the sandwich for the special advertised on the window which was $15 for a 2-foot sandwich. Then they rang me up at 15.99, I asked them about it before I gave them my card a second time and they said they hadn't applied the discount but would do so, so I assumed they did it and gave them my card but they swiped it without applying the discount, no big deal they gave me $1 in cash back but if I didn't say something a third time I wouldn't have got that dollar. So I would advise if you want the discount you have to make sure two or three times that they have done what they're supposed to do. But the sandwich was good the bread was fresh and the tomatoes looked really nice. I tipped them which I wasn't going to do if they didn't give me the discount, but mainly I was very disappointed in the small amount of meat.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationOlivia Y.Business Customer Service3/9/2021Hello Jon W.! We take the quality and portions of our subs very seriously and appreciate you taking the time to give us this feedback. We would love to make this right, please email us at feedback@portofsubs.com!Read more

column1: Allan K.Las Vegas, NV209239611/19/20181 photoI was looking for a nice way to differentiate my new Tesla Model 3. I didn't really want to spend thousands of dollars a new set of wheels, so I decided on powder coating the factory wheels. They were already fairly sporty, but I just didn't love the original finish.I called Snail on a Tuesday morning about 10am. They said they could turn around a car in a day and a half, so as long as I brought my car in before lunch they'd have it ready for me by the end of the next day. I drove over that morning, dropped my baby off and came back the next afternoon. I called in the morning for an ETA on pickup and was told 4pm. I hopped in a Lyft around 3:45 and sure enough they text me saying they needed more time but unfortunately I was already on my way. I think I drove out of their office around 5:15. That was slightly annoying but I would have sat in traffic had I left later anyway, so not a huge deal. This was a very easy transaction and I'm happy with the results.My car on the left in speedway gray with gloss finish, factory on the right.Useful 4FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJuan P.Business Owner11/20/2018Hello Allan! We're so happy you went with powder coating over buying new wheels on your Tesla, I'm confident you'll be happy with the long term results of the refinished factory wheels.We appreciate your business, thanks for setting up your appointment so quickly, it was a pleasure working with you!We are constantly working to improve our turn-around time and appreciate your patience and feedback as we become familiar with the recently released Model 3, I'm personally stoked that our team earned such high praises, they snailed it on this one! ;)Thank you once again and please let me know if there is anything else we can do for you. column1: Amy E.Elite '2021Las Vegas, NV10923620111/18/20171 photoUPDATE2 2: BE CAREFUL OF THEIR VEGAN DONUTS. NABISCO OREOS ARE NOT VEGAN- per the company itself. Oreos are made in a facility that also processes dairy and egg, therefor, there is a risk of cross contamination; hence why they aren't labeled VEGAN on the wrapper. UPDATE: I appreciate the owner commenting, but I have to call out the fact that yes, that is the reputation your donuts have. There are other reviews that have the same issues- donut quality is seriously lacking for the price. Do you even have an ETA on when you'll begin making donuts on site? It's been months since this place has took up residency with zero change.The risk is not worth the reward when there are a small handful of awesome hole in the wall places around Vegas that have been around for years. --------------------JD tried to surprise me the other day because I love donuts and he knows it. It's my favorite go to cheat meal. But this was a huge disappointment. The one donut I got, a regular cronut, was so soggy with oil. It had no crunch to it. The layers were sticking together and there was a fairly large circle of oil that had soaked around the box.JD got 3 more- some fancy, filled donuts. His verdict was that they were overpriced and he'd rather drive the opposite way and tack on an extra 10 minutes while forfeiting the cronies for Ronald's and I'm inclined to agree. He felt so bad that I wasn't able to enjoy, as was I. What a disappointment! I did read on other reviews that their donuts aren't made in location and that freshness was an issue. I can't speak on customer service, as I wasn't the one who went in, but as for the donut itself, one star is fitting as I was totally unable to consume it. Not looking too good... it's like that spot is cursed or something.Useful 5FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationBrett R.Business Owner11/28/2017Hey Amy, thanks so much for your feedback.  I'm sorry to hear that our donuts did not meet your expectations.  That definitely does not sound like the quality donuts we ave known for.  While we do make all of our products fresh from scratch each morning at our Spring Valley location we look forward to begin production on site in the coming weeks.  We absolutely appreciate your business and hope you give us another shot soon to make up for your first visit!Update:  Thanks for the update!  While I do not have an exact date, I believe we will begin production on site this week or next.  We appreciate your patience as we wrap up some necessary details.  Also, while Oreos are inherently Vegan, per their ingredients, there is always a risk of cross contamination in any facility that uses dairy which is why we identify all of our Vegan products as "Vegan Friendly".Since our inception in 2015 we have actually maintained a solid 4.5 stars.  We realize there will always be hurdles to overcome as with any new store and we intend to dominate each and every one as we have in the past.  While the reviews you reference represent a significant minority we do read and respond to every single one and take in to consideration everyone's feedback in order to improve our products and service.  Also, after careful market analysis we've found that the price of our donuts fall right in line with our competitors.  Where else can you get a fresh hot Donut Ice Cream Sandwich in town?We definitely would love to see you again soon and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us!Read more

column1: Chris V.Elite '2021Henderson, NV9401268956810/25/20177 photosMerriam-Webster defines "mania" as "excessive or unreasonable enthusiasm." From my experience, it's unreasonable to get enthused about this place.I've actually not taken the opportunity to try Donut Mania until a Yelp friend organized a get-together with other Yelpers at the newest store of this burgeoning chain all the way in North Las Vegas. This location was still in a soft opening phase, with ice cream unavailable and donuts currently not baked here but at one of their other shops, but still freshly made every morning.We had an evening date, so presumably the freshness wasn't optimal, but I had some great bites anyway. Few items were especially memorable flavor-wise, but they have a huge variety of consistently soft and chewy raised donuts that pay homage to a wide variety of dessert concepts.Reese's Pieces? Samoa cookies? Yep, they've got creations that honor both.Maple bacon bars? Oh yes, please. Their contrast of the savory, smoky flavors of bacon with the sweetness of maple is as good as any rendition.Apple fritters? With a great glaze (perhaps brown sugar) and an unusually light, almost airy interior, these monster-sized treats will make any fans of that dessert happy.Cronuts? Nope, for trademark reasons, but they have "crodoughs" that are surprisingly satisfying, despite the interior appearing more like a visual homage to a croissant rather than a true replication of the typically chewy dough with discernable layers. This version is soft like a donut, which makes it less special in my book.Cake donuts? They don't have that many of those, but we tried the vegan cake. It was oddly satisfying, although it has a different mouthfeel than traditional cake donuts, which was somewhat changing in texture.I could go on and on about the multitude of other raised donuts, including a delicious raspberry jelly-filled, but they're all fairly run-of-the-mill flavors on the same donuts - well, except one that I assume is seasonal, a pumpkin chiffon. Definitely get one if you enjoy the autumnal pumpkin pie flavor in a creamy texture.(None of my usual notes on pricing because signage wasn't up and we just pooled cash to Christie L. anyway, but that aspect is subjective. Oh, and I will add that I was not witness to other possible transgressions of their employees on other occasions, but do respect my Yelp friends' thoughts and ask that you read their reviews and take heed.)Overall, nothing is absolutely stunning flavor-wise, and some traditional donuts are underrepresented or entirely omitted from the menu in favor of a variety of delicious raised donuts, but they have a very satisfying and consistently delicious selection of those. My next craving might just land me at a Donut Mania (albeit the Henderson location, which is much closer to me).See all photos from Chris V. for Donut ManiaUseful 11Funny 7Cool 8Business owner informationBrett R.Business Owner10/30/2017Hey Chris, thanks so much for coming out to our newest location and providing us your feedback!  We're so glad to hear you enjoyed your donuts and look forward to seeing you again soon at our Henderson location!Read more
column2: Business owner informationBrett R.Business Owner10/30/2017Hey Chris, thanks so much for coming out to our newest location and providing us your feedback!  We're so glad to hear you enjoyed your donuts and look forward to seeing you again soon at our Henderson location!Read more

column1: Michael U.Las Vegas, NV3387491312706311/21/201756 photosAlways the bridesmaid when discussing Sin City's best Donut shops, the classics not on par with Friendly or Ace while innovative options lag behind Pink Box despite ownership's claim to have created the recipe for both they and Glazier's, it was largely out of curiosity about recent promotions featuring the cast of Tanked that the decision was made to attend Donut Mania's North Las Vegas *Grand Opening*on Saturday, their acquisition of rapidly shuttered Crunch Donuts a questionable financial decision considering the location almost thirty minutes by car from the Strip.Having wanted to like Donut Mania from the very beginnning, an inauspicious first visit to the Durango flagship well documented but seemingly improved upon during a visit to the Henderson location, it was expectedly to a full parking lot that the car was navigated just twenty minutes after the event's official 11:00am start time, one reality-TV star stationed at the door and the other located inside taking pictures with fans while additionally obstructing the flow of traffic.Narrow and barely an ADA-compliant space, this fact not stopping one family from completely filling the shop while spending nearly ten minutes trying to assemble a dozen, it was while talking with Brett Raymer who revealed himself as "the money and marketing" that guests waited (im)patiently, the single cashier and two girls collecting fried Dough from the case additionally slowed down when asked to make Donut Mania's recently launched Ice Cream Sandwich.Pretty up-front about my affinity for Donuts, and perhaps less obviously a former aquarium enthusiast, it was finally upon reaching the front of the line that options were properly able to be perused, the decision to order a half-dozen added upon by one of Donut Mania's $3 "World Famous Fritters" and the aforementioned plain Donut loaded with Chocolate Ice Cream and placed in a heated press, a good idea completely botched by using poorly frozen product from Thrifty and an unlined wrapper which saw glaze stuck to it, melted Ice Cream quickly dripping through and more than a quarter of the $5 item left on the ground outside.Thankfully carrying extra napkins, hands now sticky and the throng making a restroom trip to wash them a hassle, it was with additional parts of the $20.39 order taken elsewhere that the Fritter was next tasted, the "World Famous" claim up for debate but nice and crisp with plenty of Fruit while the Italian Rum topped with stiff Cream and a Maraschino Cherry was also quite pleasant, similar to when it was originally tasted on Green Valley Parkway several months back.Predictably suffering once again from either the temperature of the oil or too much gluten in the batter, both "Donutella" and Rocky Road slightly crispy on the surface with a dry crumb that fortunately benefitted in the latter's ample pocket of Chocolate Cream, it took only one bite of the Buttermilk Bar to confirm that nothing has improved since February 2015 in terms of the grainy texture, the Oreo Cheesecake not so different from the Cheesecake options at Pink Box, perhaps because of the thicker consistency of the Cream Cheese and ground up Cookie filling.Rounding out the morning with a stuffed Donut titled "Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough," the same stiff Cream from Italian Rum and Chocolate filling from Rocky Road found beneath an upright-standing half-Cookie, there was absolutely nothing about this Donut that suggested Cookie Dough save for the Cookie itself, the owner's son Steven reaching out on Social Media less than 6-hours later to state "We are actually in the midst of developing an improved cookie dough filling that is shelf stable and will really give it the flavor deserving of its name."TWO STARS:  I think it is fairly obvious that I like Donuts and I'm also pretty fond of Aquariums, so although I'm not really sure what Tanked has to do with DONUT MANIA aside from one of the Stars saying he was "the money and marketing" at the Grand Opening in North Las Vegas yesterday morning I do know that the event and product was a mess, the stars of the show placing themselves inside already limited confines and thus constraining traffic while the product was rarely worth the price.See all photos from Michael U. for Donut ManiaUseful 12Funny column1: Jessica C.Long Beach, CA23345/9/2019My son has been enrolled here for the past two years off and on, I've seen so many teachers and staff come and go and I feel that as children need to have a connection with someone their going to have to see on a daily basis instead of a new face every few months. not only that I have to call multiple times to check on my chid because the in room camera app that was offered with this center has been disabled and I've been promised that it would get back on and I still have yet to be able to check on my son in the classroom with this feature. That was one of the reasons why I enrolled him here in the first place to give a sense of security to know you have access to check on your child.Useful 4Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationMcCarran International Child D.Business Owner5/10/2019Hello, Jessica C.,We so appreciate you taking the time out of your day to write your honest review. It truly helps us to reflect on our practices and assess where we can improve in serving our families - especially our children. Upon review of your concerns, we were able to take a look at the teachers that have worked with your child, and as your scheduled days and times in attendance are inconsistent, it makes sense that you would see different teachers - we are open for extended hours, so the teachers in the morning are different than the teachers in the evening. Plus, we do have "floaters" - teachers that cover during lunch breaks - which means there may be a different teacher in the classroom at drop-off if the lead teacher is on break. As for your concern with the cameras, based on our records, you currently have access to cameras. We do go through and make adjustments regularly in paperwork, payments, and up-keeping documentation, and we await your collaboration to update the paperwork we requested - which contributed to the camera app being temporarily disconnected. Please remember this is a fee based service that requires current paperwork. We hope that we have solved your concerns thoroughly and look forward to seeing your child again soon. Sincerely, The McCarran Int'l Child Development Admin TeamRead more

column1: Alexandra M.Chandler, AZ25417144/20/20194 photosUpdate from last comment from salon: I find it funny how you decide to mix up the whole story First of, lets be honest - you do NOT have 700 nail  colors available- at all LOL! Secondly , You can clearly tell the nail you fixed was messed up and super uneven ... and to add something else - I went to my normal spot - and before I even told them what happened,  they seen your work and said "that needs to be fixed or taken of" , when my nail tech began filing the nail.. the nail stared to lift from the side .. you thought it would be a good idea to.put a nail tip on my ring finger especially seeing how it was , but yet Im in the wrong haha Lastly,  lets recap to what happened.. you had me waiting 25 minutes,  left with no explanation.  I had to go ask someone for help because your communicated soo poorly .  And as a sidenote,  I do not care about what your other "customers " wanted to do and or say . They obviously didnt say a single word while I was there, plus I like my work done with quality and  done professionally.  This is why you have all these poor reviews, haha - please do not waste your time nor my time shall we ? BEWARE IF YOU ARE LOOKING TO GET YOUR NAILS DONE,  PLEASE - RETHINK YOUR DECISION If you want uneven , unshaped , unsanitary service and poor customer service then come here ! LOL I have been doing my nails for years now, and I've never had such a bad experience like I did here My usual nail salon "Glitter Nail Bar" which is down the street was busy .. and me being on a time schedule due to an event , i decided to come here They have such a limited color variety here - The shaping to my nail that i requested pointy was horrible ( see pictures as proof) The nail popped off on top of that once I went to my other salon for them to fix this mess they caused here at Pink Lotus I waited 25 minutes for a question to get answered,  I had to get up and see what was going on . And they tell me they cant match the color . Okay , i understand that - asked how much for a nail polish change . Never got a response. I tell the lady to just cash me out for the 2 broken nails I needed fixed And these fools want to charge me $15 ( see pictures, this is not $15 nor "PROFESSIONAL" WORK The lady tells me to speak with owner ( which he did my nails) He proceeds to tell me he didnt cut the tips and it was my fault for moving around so long .. mind you my nails are all bruised and blending at this point I show the 2 other customers sitting there the comparision in nails ... they agreed as well . Owner tells me Im wasting his time - no sir you are wasting MY time .  Shame on you! I should've checked the reviews before i arrived to this hell hole .Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMinh H.Business Owner4/21/2019Good morning Alexandra M. I told you right from the beginning you should check out our color selection if it match your color and you were on the phone the whole time. You walked in the nails salon to fix two nails and were told about 30 min wait and you are ok with that. Everyone here had a appointments ahead of time. You should know my salon is full of customers and i still try to help you within 10 min not 30 min as i said. Your fingers got cuts, bruised, damaged everywhere after the trip from Rocky point. I tried to fix and glued the rest of the nails and even gave the band aids wishing it heals first before i can do anything. I fixed only two full lenght tips without .cutting them and ask you nicely is it ok because it is still shorter than your nails and you said it is ok since it is long already so it won't make any different. During the whole process of fixing nails you kept pulling the finger and move around while still talking on the phone which slowed down the process and impossible for me the perform the nails art. On one damaged nails i said i let it heal first because it will be infected if i put the nail on . Since you can't find the color match from our over 700 gel color selections, i have to let you sit there to pick out your color you wanted and move on to my appointmented customers. At the end, when you said you only paid for one nail fix, two waiting customers almost got out of the chairs to fight with you because they saw the whole things.i don't want things happen likes that so i only charge you $7 for my 30 min of works , all my clients told me you should charged her the whole things not $7 dollars. I have to let you go so my clients will continuing to have a wonderful time here. I am sorry the inconvenient which may have caused you. Happy EasterRead more

column1: Nicole G.South Forest Park, Everett, WA34722422/6/20192 photosJust want to start off by saying in short- you will not regret your experience here!!!My boyfriend took me to this place as a Christmas gift, and we went this past Saturday. Online it had told us that we needed to email to reserve a time and activity, so make sure you do that beforehand. We got there with the confirmation email, but my boyfriend had accidentally reserved the time for Sunday instead, but they were so kind & had said it was okay for us to do it right then.We opted for the Paint and Sip, which I had no idea how it worked but we were excited. Walking in, the place was so cutely decorated on the inside & was visually pleasing. We were greeted by two of the workers who were so lovely! They were very accommodating & seemed genuine in making sure we felt comfortable there. They set us up with stencils & instructions for the templates we chose, but told us we obviously didn't need to necessarily follow it. She set us up in the corner of the room while we ordered some drinks. I had the $14 bottomless mimosas (such a great deal!!!) and my boyfriend chose a beer. The instructions said mine would take 1.5 hours approximately, and his called for 2 hours so it was a challenge to see how long it took. Our 16x20 canvasses had the stencils on top, so we traced out our pictures. Mine was initially showing the silhouette of a father and a child, but I changed it up to kind of reflect me and my boyfriend's. It was kinda cool how we did have a template but we were free to do whatever we wanted essentially. The paints were available on a nearby cart, with mixing cups and paintbrushes for us to grab whenever we needed it. Very accessible and whenever we had questions we didn't feel any hesitation to do so. Painting wasn't our strong suite so it was awesome to have assistance when needed but they also let us do our thing for most of the time!We got there at 1pm, and we didn't finish until 4:30! We did take our time though and it was so much fun, we had no pressure from the workers either to leave or anything like that. In fact they would constantly check up on us, give us advice when we asked, and kept my bottomless mimosa always full ;) when we had walked in there were probably one other party there, but by the time we had left it was full of children and parents who were also having a lot of fun making crafts. Great environment!It was a Christmas gift but we used it during our 2 year anniversary weekend so the experience my boyfriend & I had was so so fun, the workers would make sure we were having a blast! Will definitely come back maybe to do another painting or experience a different activity soon!!!Mine somehow took a shorter amount of time so I'm just waiting for my boyfriend to be done hahaThe finished products!Useful 1FunnyCool 1Business owner informationBrooke R.Business Owner2/6/2019Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience. We are so happy to hear that you had a great time and can’t wait to have you back.Read more
column2: Business owner informationBrooke R.Business Owner2/6/2019Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience. We are so happy to hear that you had a great time and can’t wait to have you back.Read more

column1: Liz H.Elite '2021Honolulu, HI2802006062/2/20213 photosRecommend making a reservation. We did and noticed the place fills up pretty fast.We were sat right away at the table near the waterfall. Server was friendly and efficient.The oysters on the half shell were amazing. Love the horseradish cocktail sauce and adding a little Tapatio or Tabasco really ties it all together! Yum! I ordered the House Boil. All of the shrimp, mussels, and clams were steamed perfectly. Not rubbery or too chewy. The sauce was good, a little salty, and would have been perfect with some rice!I ended up dipping some of the  complimentary rolls in the sauce and wowza! My dad ordered clam chowder and seemed to enjoy. My brother ordered jambalaya (he mentioned that they don't mess around with the spice levels. Last time he ordered a 7 and it was too hot. This time he stuck to a 1 and was happy). Bananas foster is delicious. Perfect way to end a huge satisfying meal.Useful 6Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationMikhail H.Business Owner2/4/2021We are glad to know your experience was positive in every possible way.  We look forward to your next visit and will once again work hard to earn your endorsement. - Oyster BarRead more

column1: Dana J.Elite '2021Las Vegas, NV311334410/11/20203 photosI'm so glad this Oyster Bar is still able to operate during Covid. This place is a hidden gem located inside Sunset Casino in Henderson. Located right across the street from the Galleria Mall. You can park at the bowling alley entrance and it's a short walk to the Oyster bar. They have plenty of seating around the bar and your still able to social distance. There are also table set up around the bar for larger parties (4-5 people) if you don't want to sit at the bars The seafood is delicious. We order the charbroiled oysters, shrimp cocktail, king crab legs and drinks.  The bill was $191 but mostly because we had two orders of crab legs. A couple can eat for much less because most of the entrees are between $20-30. The crab legs were the best you didn't have to crack any shells the crab legs were given to you with only half the shell a so it makes it very easy to eat. The food I give 5 yelp stars everything was delicious and I can't wait to go back. All the staff was friendly and the prices are reasonable. Definitely one of my new favorite seafood places in Henderson for a date night.Useful 4Funny 2Cool 3Business owner informationMikhail H.Business Owner10/13/2020Well thank you for that great review Dana!  Sunset Station loves when great guests like you have a great time with us!Read more

column1: James O.Phoenix, AZ01333/14/2020Not a fan of this place! Took my truck in awhile ago for an oil change and tire rotation. When I left i was told there was a lug nut missing. Odd, I thought but okay. I left, bought another one and replaced it and in doing so, i noticed my tires and it looked like they weren't moved. I went back 4 months later for the same thing, but this time I marked one of my tires. When I left i looked at the tires and went back into the office because it confirmed my suspension, they didn't do a tire rotation but led me to believe it had been done. They gave me some story "you don't really need to rotate often (or some crap). So when my truck needed the next oil change I decided to do it myself. Low and behold, I found that they didn't put the recommended oil filter size on my truck last time. I probably wouldn't be an EX customer if they were transparent, but the sneaky deception is not right in my mind.Thank you for your replay, condescending as it may be. If you would have read my entire post, you would have learned that my issue had nothing to do with the lug nut; it was merely a explanation to my experience. The real take home, had to do with the inability to be honest and treat customers with dignity and respect; as you showcased in you reply. Also, please keep your "4 important remarks", because as a truck driver, I am completely aware of what a tire rotation is and the fact the primary weight of most vehicles are supported by the front two tires. But what I would suggest you do in the future, is not talk down or around your customers when you feel a service they request is unnecessary, and actually take them out and show them what you mean, as to minimize confusion. Because if you HAD done this, I would have pointed out that the inside of the two front tires were extremely low thread, and the back ones were't, which is why I recently had them replaced. As for the oil filter, yes I am aware that the threads are not interchangeable. However, I purchased the same brand put on at your place, but the size that was recommended for my vehicle and it was longer, almost 25% longer. So NO, I will not come by for "you to buy me a 2 dollar lug nut" (but you charge $9.50 for) because I have found someone that can do the things I either can't or, more realistically don't want to do on my vehicle. Someone that exceeds you in professionalism and customer service, as this person has honesty and integrity. I will also mention that since we share the same neighborhood, I have not been shy about sharing my experience and opinions about your business practices to our neighbors, so I am glad you were able to reply, so others can clearly see how you speak to your customers. Furthermore, I find it disturbing that you were able to access your "notes" on my vehicle from almost 2 years ago at 6pm, when your office closes at 4pm. So if you can please remove my information from your database, because I will NEVER return. And I suggest readers of this post seek alternate car service as well.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHamza S.Business Owner3/14/2020Thank you for reaching out, I’d like to make 4 important remarks to you: 1- we have no interest in losing a customer over a 2 dollar lugnut, if we said you’re missing one, then you were missing one. If you have doubts, simply ask us to review the 16 cameras we have installed in the shop2-Tire rotation is the practice of moving the wheels and tires of an automobile from one position to another, to ensure even tire wear. Even tire wear is desirable to extend the useful life of a set of tires.The weight on the front and rear axles differs which causes uneven wear. With the majority of cars having the engine in front, the front tires typically bear more weight than the rear tires which wears the front tires quicker. At the time of your visit, my notes show your front tires had higher tread, which means a tire rotation was not needed. Which is also why you were never charged for a tire rotation3-You cannot install a wrong spin-on oil filter, if it’s the wrong oil filter, it will not fit and leak all the oil before it even leaves the shop causing engine failure. Maybe you mean the height of the oil filter?! Which depends on the brand name you use. For example: filters for the same car made by Valvoline and mobile 1 have different heights. 4-when in doubt, always ask for camera footage. Come by any day and we’ll buy you a lugnut, no need to stress out over 2 dollars and a tire rotation when you can simply ask for it. Don’t let our professional advice get in the way of what you want. Thank you for sharing your feelings, Don’t be shy next time, simply ask. Have a good day.Read more

If you have doubts, simply ask us to review the 16 cameras we have installed in the shop2-Tire rotation is the practice of moving the wheels and tires of an automobile from one position to another, to ensure even tire wear. Even tire wear is desirable to extend the useful life of a set of tires.The weight on the front and rear axles differs which causes uneven wear. column1: Rachel M.Phoenix, AZ522/10/2019I took my truck in to replace a timing belt and water pump which is recommended every 60,000 miles. 16 months and 12,000 miles later I was out of town when my water pump gave out which cause my timing belt to move and my engine to cease working.I immediately called shop and they said I could bring truck in and they would look at it My problem was I was 200 miles away and I already knew what the issue was since I had two shop where I broke down look at it. I wanted to know if they would stand by the work they had done and fix my engine Their answer was no because two months after work was done, shop was sold to new owner He would NOT take any liability for work done by previous owner . I'm sorry, what?  Buyer beware just because same sign was there doesn't mean warranty gets transferred. These people are wolves in sheeps clothing. It ended costing over $6,000 to get engine rebuilt with towing 200 miles, car rental for 3 weeks and other expenses. I don't know it they are using after market parts, all I know is that I would never use this shop againUseful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHamza S.Business Owner2/20/2019Thank you for sharing your feedback Madam, but as I discussed with you on the phone previously, I simply cannot cover a warranty on a job that we did not perform. You completed your work with a previous owner (Differenty Entity, Different staff, Different LLC) at this location, 4 months before i even considered buying this shop and still resided in Michigan. I have no way to confirm what was done on your vehicle, who worked on it, whether they used after market parts or whether they were even qualified to perform the job. I understand your frustration that your water pump failed even though you had the previous company replace it, however would you be frustrated with me if i had opened a flower shop or gas station here. Whats right is right, i suggest your frustration be directed on either the manufacturer of the water pump or the previous company, please re-consider who you are holding responsible here, we simply bought the shop (with the property) and just want to make an honest living. We stand by all the work we do. Your consideration is highly appreciated, please let us know how we can help in any way. Thank you.Read more

column1: Julie D.Dunellen, NJ661216/12/20201 photoDawn provided me with a reading that gave me a lot of peace and comfort at a time when I was grieving and questioning everything that I did. My mother contracted covid in a nursing home in New Jersey and she passed away. I was devastated. Dawn absolutely contacted her and my father came through as well. I knew it was them because they both described themselves with many details ... my father showed her the crossword puzzles he did and the lighter he used to flip and how he smoked so much and how he was from the Midwest. And my mother told her what her hair looked like and how her left arm was injured and that was absolutely true she had broken her upper arm. There were many more details.  I was really amazed. Dawn's ability to connect with my parents  was something I'll never forget -  it was a truly special experience. Thank you Dawn!Isabella (mom)Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationDawn H.Business Owner6/15/2020Thank you so much Julie,. I am so happy that I was able to connect with both your mother and father, and give you the messages that your heart needed to hear. They are absolutely with you and loving you. column1: Ciara L.Chandler, AZ13546/18/2018I met with Dawn last week and I've been sharing my experience with friends and family ever since. I spent the next few days after our meeting processing everything that was said and taking Dawn's recommendations to heart. I had no idea what to expect going in to it and I assumed it would be very emotional for me. But Dawn made me feel comfortable and at ease and explained everything at the start of our session which made feel like I was in the right place. I have many loved ones that have passed that I had questions for and I went to Dawn to see if she could help provide the clarity I needed. Dawn's ability to connect with my loved ones and then being able to sense each of their personalities come through made my heart feel so amazing. Dawn gave me the reassurance I needed to know that our loved ones are always with us. I recommend anyone who has dealt with any kind of loss or hardship to go take the time to meet with Dawn and let her help you. She is so compassionate and understanding of your situation and can shed light on the answers you may be looking for. Thank you so much Dawn!UsefulFunnyCool 1Business owner informationDawn H.Business Owner6/20/2018Thank you so much for sharing your experience. column1: Marta J.Toronto, Canada17227345/14/2012Over-priced and under-friendly. An older guy who seems to be the owner does not speak to or greet his customers. 2 younger guys are approachable, but not going out of their way to give good service. They do repairs (at a high cost) and only sell new bikes (they scoff at the idea of anything "used"). The selection is small.One would imagine that a neighbourood bike shop would try a little harder. I will not be returning other than to use the free air pump outside.Useful 8Funny 3CoolBusiness owner informationHernan B.Business Owner6/7/2012We always provide a service quote before work starts.  We also 'scoff' at used bicycles because more often than not they have various issues that require alot of repairs, i.e. A customer buys a used bicycle somewhere for $60-150 they ask us what it will take to work and often to be considered in 'good working order'  requires repairs worth more than the price of the bike in the first place.  That is why we scoff at used bicycles.We also have a saying, the only good used bike is a stolen one.  Nobody is going to get rid of a bike that works well and doesn't have issues.You're welcome for the free air.Read more

column1: Mrs. R.Charlotte, NC440210/2/2020I brought my family here late last night because we were looking for decent outdoor seating. I can't comment on the cleanliness of the place, because we didn't go inside. The food did take a while to come out, and our drinks did sit empty for a while mid-meal, even though they weren't all that busy, but the food was good. The one-star rating is based upon our experience with the waitress, Alexa. I said to the waitress that I could either get a chicken nugget kids' meal for my poodle for around $7, or add bacon Mac and cheese on to my meal and two sides I had already chosen for $4, and she said yes. When the bill came, we were charged $7 for the Mac n cheese. I told her it was supposed to be $4, and she argued that it was $7, even though she and I had the little conversation about how the Mac 'n cheese was a better deal than the chicken nugget kids' meal. On a $130 meal, she was willing to squabble over a $3 difference. She didn't offer to get the manager or change the charge, even though she and I had spoken about it while I was ordering. I didn't press the issue, because most places wouldn't have even had a back-and-forth over it. I had $60 cash left over from my spending of the day, which I was expecting to leave on the table as a tip so it would be tax-free, but left $26 on my credit card instead. Principles, Alexa.UsefulFunny 2CoolBusiness owner informationBonefish C.Business Customer Service10/2/2020Hello,We’re so sorry that your experience did not match your expectations. Please help us to improve by providing more information on your experience. column1: Kristin G.Denver, NC01511/17/2020I'm only not giving one star bc of a sense of feeling a little generous/empathetic during COVID. I just left this Bonefish (where I have eaten many times over the past years). 15 minutes spent with not even so much as a glass of water and some flatware. A hostess who moseyed up to the stand so nonchalant that I wasn't even sure she worked there and then a waiter who did things like run and get extra oil for the table beside me without even so much as a greeting. If you have limited staff during off hours then it should be the job of ALL the working staff to service the guests. There was no reason for me to sit that long (on my limited lunch break) without a drink or placing my order as your hostess slumped at the stand. I walked over to Eez Fusion-promptly greeted, sat, drink delivered, and food order in within 10 minutes. column1: Bre M.Gilbert, AZ028/13/2020My husband was one of the first residents of Camden Tempe and we continued to live there until August 2020. We lived in the B4 floor plan and never felt so comfortable. The apartment was absolutely gorgeous, so well made and intentionally designed. We truly felt like Camden Tempe was our home. We went through many managers of the property but the managers right now, Lisa and Lonnie exceeded expectations. They were incredibly kind, helpful and assertive. Camden Tempe never felt better!! They both are open for conversation and take care of residents needs as fast as they possibly can. We will forever miss having apartment managers like them. Although the area of North Tempe/south scottsdale has struggled with more transient people recently, we really feel like management is doing everything they can to help this issue, and we never once had an actual issue with this problem. Camden's location is so central and extremely accessible. We were able to enjoy Tempe, Scottsdale and Phoenix while being able to drive down to the east valley as well very easily. The amenities are great, and we especially loved the pool. Maintenance was friendly and hard working as well. We will forever miss Camden and will always have fond memories there. If you are looking for a place to live, we highly recommend Camden Tempe!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCamden ManagerBusiness Manager8/13/2020Hello Bre,Thank you so much for taking the time to share your kind words about our community. Every person on our team works hard to provide living excellence for all of our residents, and I am happy o hear that we were able to do so with you! We were so sad when the two of you had to leave, but if you are ready to come home at any time please do not hesitate to reach out. We are always available to help at (480) 584-3330 or by email at tempe@camdenliving.com.Best,Camden Tempe TeamRead more

column1: John H.Tustin, CA11153/3/2021Camden's design of living quarters is commendable and they are nicely functional.  Where they fail and I mean fail miserably is garage parking and visitor parking.  For the hundreds of residents they have 15 visitor spaces and no means of accommodating friends or family or visitors. No thought. No consideration.  Simply put.  If you have friends or family don't live there.  In fact they go a step farther and hire a towing company to remove those outsiders quickly and very costly to those towed.  Its a sure bet they get a kickback. The garage, that you pay dearly for, only works if you are in your 30's or younger and super skinny.  Literally, I measured it.  My small SUV fits with two inches on each side of the door way.  Are you out of your mind?!?!?!The designers should be forced to use what they built; they would suffer!They are building more?!?!?!?  Hopefully, more thought was done in the design but I doubt it.   Shame on the cities that approve this scam and shame on Camden; thoughtless, selfish, inconsiderate, hateful, sickening.  There are not enough adjectives to describe the unprofessionalism involved and this is all the way up through the corporate level.  Yes, I contacted management and to get a space for one day you have to pay a month but only if there is one available.  I called corporate and after putting me on endless hold twice I got a person who said to find a street over a quarter of a mile away and to walk.  Hello, no side walks in that direction.  Again, they don't care.If you got family or friends... go somewhere else!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCamden ManagerBusiness Manager4/8/2021Hi There, I'm so happy to hear that you are enjoying the living space of your apartment home, but we have a ways to go with ensuring that you aren't having frustrations around parking. I'm sorry that you are disappointed with that aspect of your living experience here. Because we don't have the space, we reserve the parking inside of the gates for residents only. I definitely acknowledge that visitor parking can get taken quickly in the 15 marked visitor spaces in front of the Leasing Office. We currently have a total of 51 visitor spaces which includes the overflow parking on the West and North sides of the community outside of the gates. If you would like for me to show you those areas, please let me know and I will be happy to help. The only places that visitors can't park without the risk of being towed is the permit spaces (for residents only), the reserved covered parking spaces, or the commercial parking lot North of the overflow parking. We regularly remind residents that doing so can result in getting their vehicle towed. Camden Tempe receives no money from the towing company for monitoring and towing from our parking lots. The good news is that with our Phase 2 we will be adding somewhere around 40 extra visitor spaces between our Phase I and Phase II. Those should be available for use sometime this summer. In addition, we will be installing a pedestrian gate on the West side of the community so that guests can easily get from overflow into the community when the resident gives them access through the Chirp app. Phase 2 will only have assigned covered parking spaces for residents and no garages. I'd love an opportunity to chat with you and see if we may have the ability to switch your garage for a carport instead. We don't have a lot that are available, but depending on the size of your apartment home and your location in the community we do have a couple of possible options. If that interests you at all, please contact me directly and I would be happy to help. Also, if you are ever experiencing any future frustrations please feel free to call or email me. I'm always available to talk through these concerns with residents. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback. Best, Lisa McCartney Community Manager Camden Tempe lmccartney@camdenliving.… 480.584.3330Read more

column1: Jay H.Peoria, AZ184410/12/20204 photosIf you're going to spend $1,650/mo for a one bedroom then rent somewhere else and get your money's worth. There is trash piled up by the dumpsters all of the time and litter on the ground. The pics are just the walk from my unit to my vehicle. The office staff ignored my request by not following up. The grounds stink like dog piss and the neighbors are loud and inconsiderate. When we first moved in I approached the maintenance supervisor about an issue and he accused me of being drunk. My wife is a chronic pain patient and the office refused her the right to use doctor prescribed medical equipment in our own apartment for 20 - 40 minutes per day.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCamden ManagerBusiness Manager5/22/2020Hi Jonathan,Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. column1: Tedd S.Las Vegas, NV256214/18/2019Having lived at Camden Hayden since it was opened I've experienced my fare share of management changes and community changes. Originally the property was immaculate, with adequate and attentive staffing that held numerous community events and fostered a quality apartment complex. Unfortunately this property is not the same as it once was.Rampant theft occurs in vehicles parked in their own garages. Homeless men washing themselves in the hot tub in the early mornings. The once towel service at the pool is no longer available. The noise complaint process is broken. Landscaping occurs weekend mornings, which result in people being woken up at 7am on a Sunday. Parking is a joke. Valet Trash isn't necessary, yet they charge every tenant for it, because Camden makes a profit from the service. Lastly, my family members are forced to park outside the gate because I live in a single bedroom and am only allowed my one space.. which I pay for. Overall, the leasing office and Camden Hayden team show little regard to hiring adequate security or staff for the property to make the community feel safe in their own apartments. The once great community no longer exists.If you are looking for an apartment complex. This isn't the one.Useful 4FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCamden ManagerBusiness Manager4/22/2019Hi Tedd, We are disappointed to hear your experience with us has not been great. We would love to discuss your concerns further in person or over the phone to find a way to make it right and/or gain more insight. Please email us at Hayden@camdenliving.com with your availability. We understand parking may have changed since you first moved in, however we chose to forego this for the benefit of our residents. Last year, we received feedback from our residents in regards to no parking, as visitors were taking up a majority of permit parking. With this, we decided to only assign permits to those residents whom do not have an assigned garage/carport such as yourself. We do however offer temporary permits for short term visitors and are more than happy to assist with these, please visit our office for more details. Again, please do not hesitate to reach out to us directly at 480-584-3330 or Hayden@camdenliving.com with your availability so we may find a way to turn your experience around. Thank you.Read more

column1: Kimberly C.Mesa, AZ01022/25/2020If you are looking for a safe place to live this is not it. With no security in place and their excuses on why they don't have it has led to multiple thefts. Since I've lived here my garage has been broken into, my car has been broken into, and so many of my things have been stolen. We pay rent to one feel safe, and the amount they ask for doesn't cover any type of sense of security. And I'm not joking when I say I've seen homeless people bathe in the hot tub. And if you had access to the community messages you'd see this place is NOW a trash hole.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCamden ManagerBusiness Manager2/27/2020Greetings Kimberly,Thanks so much for your time here at Camden Hayden! We love to hear from our residents and appreciate feedback no matter in what forms it comes and I am happy that you call us home. As it turns out, or aim is not to provide you with an excuse in regarding to having security, rather, we are partnered with Tempe PD as we have found that they are the fastest route to our rescue no matter what the occurrence. Crime, for the most part, requires intent and opportunity. Part of our ongoing communication with our residents consists of eliminating the opportunity such as items of value left in view, garages being left open, vehicles left unlocked; while I am in no way implying that you have done any of the above, we ask our residents to be active participants in the battle against crime. Your comfort in your apartment home is our top priority, we would like to shield our residents from facing anything involving crime, there are so many variables involving the act its self.Your residence is appreciated, please forgive us if you were led t believe that an apartment community can give you a sense of security as it implies a feeling that Courtesy Patrol cannot deliver.In closing We care about all of our residents and wish to know which criteria you have used to determine if the persons seen in the hot tub are homeless or not. Perhaps we can even partner with you to address them in the occasions that they are seen. We are happy that our residents have an avenue to communicate between one another through the internal portal. Camden properties are some of the very few that allow this as a medium of communication. We appreciate you Kimberly, and wish that you did not feel this way. Please come in to the office and chat with us, we are happy to hear you and continue to provide you the best living experience, no excuses just a friendly chat with the people who manage your home.Kind Regards,Camden HaydenRead more
