column1: Bin X.Charlotte, NC0412/5/2014worst dental experience so far. The doc was very rough, spilling anesthetic all over the mouth. Overselling a second root canal on a good tooth even I was referred by my own dentist for one single root canal only. He then turned around charged $79 for the "inspection"Useful 13FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationRamesh S.Business Owner12/12/2014Dear Mr. Bin X.,I am really sorry that you had a bad experience in my office.  Honestly, I don't recall if I had ever deliberately "spilled anesthetics all over" my patients mouth. If it happened with you then it must have been an accidental and I sincerely apologize for that.  Is it possible that you tasted the topical anesthetic that we rub on the area before injection? Sometimes patients confuse topical anesthetic with real anesthetics as both have a similar and bitter taste. For the readers of this review by Mr. Bin X,  I would like to clarify that I do not oversell anything. I don't have to because most of my patients are referred from other dentists. If I see something that I think would prevent future problems then I will certainly recommend treatments but getting treatments on these recommendations is patient's decisions.  I believe not informing or educating patients of their problems specially if you have identified it is a disservice. As far as charging for x-ray and consultation is concerned it is a standard practice that every specialist do because we do spend time with the patient examining and evaluating. We do not accept an x-ray or evaluation of a referring dentist because of medical-legal reasons. Reevaluating a referred patients problems is a standard of care which even insurance companies are more than willing to reimburse specialists.  I hope this explanation clarifies any confusion created by Mr. Bin X's review about me or my office.Read more

column1: Michelle P.Las Vegas, NV23351410/6/2018Updated reviewRegrettably, I have to update this review as I'm not at all happy with the outcome of my healed treatment. I will preface this by saying I adhered to all aftercare instructions provided by Julia, and was communicative with her when I started to notice unpleasant results.After I had my first microneedling treatment with Julia, about a week following my healing, I noticed a dark patch develop on my skin. I was a little alarmed, so I snapped some pictures and texted Julia describing what I saw. She asked me to keep an eye on it, and if it didn't go away to let her know. By my 2nd treatment, the dark spot had faded. Now, Julia did not seem to have any reservations or concerns about treating me a second time, and we proceeded with the treatment.I texted Julia again - about a week after my treatment - alarmed because I had a dark, scaly patch that had developed on my neck. It was the same song and dance - don't worry about it, the neck takes longer to heal, keep an eye on it and let me know.This is now several weeks after my treatment and the dark patch is there. I have another dark patch on the other side of my neck as well. On top of all of this, I'm NEVER the type to break out in cystic acne, and following my second treatment, I was greeted by 4 or so very large, painful cystic pimples around my chin and jawline. All of which are causing ADDITIONAL scarring and unsightliness - exactly the opposite of the outcome I am looking for. I went to see a professional (who shall remain nameless for now) to get a second opinion on what I'm experiencing, and it appears that I have developed some hyperpigmentation and possibly SCARRING as a result of this treatment. Said professional agreed that following the initial red flag of my first treatment, Julia should have advised against treating me again. Before doing this, I reached out to Julia with my concerns and was met with defensiveness and excuses. She offered to provide me with a skin lightening cream, but I would have to pay an additional $100 due to it being a prescription or something of that nature. She refused to accept responsibility for her lapse in judgement, and emphasized that "this is extremely rare" and "has NEVER happened" with one of her patients. She later apologized for appearing to lack empathy in the situation.But above all, what is missing here is the glaring lack of responsibility for this outcome. If a client comes to you dissatisfied, you take ownership. Period. That's just good customer service. And what happened here was, I experienced a rare, adverse reaction to a treatment, and instead of advising against treating me again, she did it anyway. I spent almost $500 with Julia already to treat my face, and for her to deflect responsibility and ask me to pay MORE MONEY to fix this is just plain insulting. If it were my client, I would have offered a refund, additional resources or referrals, any sort of workaround, and do whatever it takes to make the situation RIGHT for the client - not further inconveniencing them by forking out more money for something that MIGHT work - as well as not taking ownership for the issue at hand. It's just not right. It's hard to admit when something didn't go as planned. Especially when you're a small business owner. And when you're a small business owner, it is even MORE important that your customer service is world class. I believe at the end of the day, Julia is a nice person and probably means well. I hope she learns from this mistake, and understands the importance of taking ownership. The last thing someone wants to hear when they are going through this is "well I've never had this happen before - but here you can buy this cream!" Well, I won't be buying your cream, but I will be updating my review. Apologies in advance.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJulia H.Business Owner10/29/2018I am so sorry that you had such an unfortunate reaction to microneedling and I would really appreciate the opportunity to see it in person. It’s very rare to hyperpigment however, it is a listed side effect. Microneedling is a form of controlled inflammation that stimulates skin regeneration. Sometimes this inflammation masks itself as pigment during the healing process, especially in darker skin types. Fortunately, it’s not permanent. Acne is a more common side effect and microneedling can cause breakouts even in the clearest of skin. Everyone’s skin is different and even though I can make assessments for treatment based on your skin type, I cannot guarantee any outcome. Whether you went to me for microneedling or someone else, you would’ve had the same reaction. I understand that this is not only frustrating but scary. I have and will continue to offer you any of my services to help speed healing and ease your worries.Read more7/16/2018Previous reviewJulia is an angel! When I came in for my consultation a few weeks ago, she took her time providing me with a ton of information and answered all of my (many) questions. Julia is so incredibly knowledgeable and sweet, she treated me as if she had known me forever!The procedure I had done was microneedling. She suggested this as one of the many treatments I would benefit from to help reduce my acne scars and dark spots. I didn't know much about the procedure at all, and Julia did an incredible job making sure I was comfortable. The procedure was a little uncomfortable at times, but overall wasn't bad at all! After the procedure, she gave me all the information I needed for aftercare, and I was on my way.I'm thrilled with my experience and treatment from Julia and I can't wait to return! I'm so excited for my results, but most importantly, I'm so lucky to have found her!Read more
column2: Business owner informationJulia H.Business Owner10/29/2018I am so sorry that you had such an unfortunate reaction to microneedling and I would really appreciate the opportunity to see it in person. It’s very rare to hyperpigment however, it is a listed side effect. Microneedling is a form of controlled inflammation that stimulates skin regeneration. Sometimes this inflammation masks itself as pigment during the healing process, especially in darker skin types. Fortunately, it’s not permanent. Acne is a more common side effect and microneedling can cause breakouts even in the clearest of skin. Everyone’s skin is different and even though I can make assessments for treatment based on your skin type, I cannot guarantee any outcome. Whether you went to me for microneedling or someone else, you would’ve had the same reaction. I understand that this is not only frustrating but scary. I have and will continue to offer you any of my services to help speed healing and ease your worries.Read more

column1: Barbara M.Phoenix, AZ4137/21/2019I am surprised at other reviews as I had a totally amazing experience renting through Advantage.We flew into Phoenix under military orders and was almost 18 hours late from our reservation. We arrived at the counter around 7AM and there was no line. Check in was quick and Luis was very kind explaining optional coverages and patiently answering all my questions. They were out of the car type we booked but that wasn't a problem for us as an alternate was offered. We went down stairs to pick up the vehicle and that was super simple too. Got the keys,  we were able to take our time inspecting it and getting familiar with it before driving out of the lot. As Advantage was substantially cheaper than other car rental companies I was expecting an older vehicle with no features but I was completely wrong.  We got a 2018 Chrysler Pacific and I absolutely loved it.  So many features for a great price. Return was a breeze. There was some construction so a little tricky finding the Advantage return area but followed the signs and got there.  I was alone with my two kids and a little frazzled,  Imad came right up  at car drop off, took the time to say hi and very friendly as well. He took the keys,  reviewed my total charges, and we were done! Super simple process.  I received my $200 deposit back on my credit card 2 days later.I truly had a great experience and will use them next time I need a rental car!UsefulFunny 1CoolBusiness owner informationYumarilis B.Business Owner7/23/2019Thank you for your review Barbara.Read more

column1: Maja D.Elite '2021Scottsdale, AZ141173704/1/20191 photoMy friend and I wanted to get lunch after our manicure and couldn't decide where to go. She said she hadn't been to 18 degrees since the renovations and I've never been at all so we checked it out. Got there around 12:30pm on a Sunday and got sat outside right away (our preference outside since it was nice out).The staff were super friendly. Some tables outside had umbrellas and other tables did not. Some had double umbrellas so we asked for it to be moved by us so we got some shade and they totally accommodated which was great.Their mimosa and Bloody Mary was delicious and definitely not a let down. The Bloody Mary was definitely spicy just how I like it.The food was cooked perfectly. When I get hash browns I always ask for it to be burnt so that it is crispy and most places just burn the top and call it a day. They actually fried all of it and it was awesome. Bacon was crispy and the scrambled eggs weren't runny. The grapefruit had a top that was caramel used which I thought was clever since it added to the taste.Definitely a good spot to go to for a good brunch.Breakfast!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKevin B.Business Manager4/1/2019Thank you so much! column1: Kay M.Phoenix, AZ142344/3/20196 photosSome colleagues from PA and NC were in town, so we decided to have our team outing here. When you first walk up and into the restaurant, it seemed like a really cool casual spot for a date night or happy hour with your friends. The patio area was really chill. The food smelled sooo good as we all walked in. We had a party of 17 and were seated right across from the ice rink.There was a guy working on the gate that separates the ice rink check in area from the dining area. It was loud pounding and rattling and it seemed like an inappropriate time to do this during the lunch rush.The waitress was attentive at the beginning. She took our drink & food orders and then we didn't see her until half of the table was finished eating. Several different people brought us our food but the food came out in strange batches (which I get for a party of 17, but we had to remind them about one of my colleagues' order.)My colleague and I both ordered the Chilaquiles Bennie with a side of loaded hash. BOTH of our dishes did not come out with what the description says. Her plate was missing the black bean puree and my plate was missing the black bean puree and the hollandaise crema. Another colleague was missing all of the toppings on her order of loaded hash.Overall, the team did not like the experience and came to the consensus that we will not return to this location. Personally, I'll come back to ice skate but will not be dining here again either. Really wish the experience went differently.See all photos from Kay M. for 18 DegreesUseful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKevin B.Business Manager4/5/2019We apologize that you had a bad experience! I understand that excuses are useless, just know that there was an extraordinary circumstance this specific day that through the kitchen through a loop. The cook trying his best had never done breakfast, bless his heart, he tried so hard.We strive to give the best food and experience possible and are fully aware that you and a few other tables got the short end of the stick that day. We’d love to make it up to you if you are interested, I promise this is not the norm for us. Either way, we learn and we grow and we do better the next day. Please reach out if there is anything I can do for you!Read more

column1: Lisa C.Elite '2021Markham, Canada8985579/16/20191 photoWhile the consultation and booking process were satisfactory, I cannot say the same for the actual hair treatment itself. With an unsatisfactory end result and a disappointing lack of follow up, it's ultimately a let down. I dropped in on a Sunday morning for a consultation with Bosco of what I was looking for, and was able to book an appointment for the following Sunday, which was great. They were highly communicative and looked to resolve any confusion, which I can appreciate. However, it went all down hill from there. Walking in, I already had a clear idea of what I wanted. We discussed this in the consultation session, and I had a picture that I shared as a reference as well. I emphasized that I would like ash brown/grey highlights with contrasts as apparent as my previous existing dye and it sounded like the stylist knew what I wanted. When the bleaching part was complete, I was quite happy about how the contrast came out. Then came the coloring part. I emphasized again that I would like the streak effects, and wanted to see the grey-blonde end result. However, she kept insisting that a darker tone would look better, and assured me that despite the darkness, it would still look contrasting. She even said that she would leave the dye in for 15 minutes only so it wouldn't turn that dark. I was unconvinced, but decided to lay my trust in her, as she was the "professional." Contrary to the 15 minutes that she said, I was left there to wait for 30 minutes while she went to cut another client's hair. After 30 minutes, I was escorted to wash the dye out of my hair. Unsurprisingly by that point, it was difficult for me to see any apparent contrast. I was trying to be patient and waited until it was completely dry - but again to my disappointment, it was much darker than I asked for, and it was simply grey & brown all over and there was no apparent contrast to be found. All this took 6 hours.I told the stylist I was quite disappointed with the result. Instead of trying to fix the problem, she suggested options of how I could fix it myself later at home if I didn't like it, and that I should have told her what I wanted earlier (which I did via the consultation and photo,) and she would have chosen a different colour. Lastly, she suggested I wash my hair more often for the dye to come out and make it less dark. To have to drop $440 (which was more than what was quoted in the consultation,) and to have to sit for 6 whole hours only to walk out with a disappointing result leaves a very sour taste in my mouth. Telling the client to go fix it yourself at home instead of taking accountability for what they did is also a big issue. With the amount of time and money spent here for a disappointing result and a complete lack of accountability on the stylist's part, I would not recommend this place as a customer.Top Left: expectation // Top Right: after it was accidentally washed after bleach // Bottom: final product of $400 + tips with BoscoUseful 11Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationJBon H.Business Owner1/17/2020Hi Lisa,We're sorry you had an disappointing experience. Your feedback is valuable and will be delivered to Bosco. We will continue to improve. We hope you can come back again, cheersRead more
column2: Business owner informationJBon H.Business Owner1/17/2020Hi Lisa,We're sorry you had an disappointing experience. Your feedback is valuable and will be delivered to Bosco. We will continue to improve. We hope you can come back again, cheersRead more

column1: Glen L.Las Vegas, NV16837/23/20186 photosJeff at Leisure Lawn  has a great company, but he is also a good guy. Jeff will take the time to show you all the different products he offers and listen to what your needs are. He will not try to upsell you products and will explain the difference between each one. He will make sure he understands your needs and what you expect. He came out to my house twice before I decided on who I wanted to do my lawn. He also took my phone calls and answered all my questions. Jeff is hands on and will check the job sites to make sure everything is going exactly has planned. My turf turned out great and since I always had a nice lawn. A lot of people did not know this was turf until I told them. They did a great job of hiding all the seams and gave me that high end custom looking for.  As you can see in the pictures their was a lot of cutting needed. When I lost a palm tree and added a giant cantilevered umbrella. Jeff and his crew came in a week and patched up my lawn, and it looks great again. If you need Artificial Turf Jeff at Leisure Lawn is the person you should call. He is very professional, and he has a good working crew who take pride in their work.See all photos from Glen L. for Leisure LawnUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationNaomi S.Business Owner7/24/2018Thank you Glen.  Customer Service is our top priority.  There are many artificial grass companies to choose from. column1: Karyn L.Tempe, AZ22691/30/2015BEWARE!!!Can Brian and his crew lay beautiful tile and hard wood? YES! No doubt. BUT....in the process, you will wish you had opted for a better contractor. Because if it's like my house; your kitchen cabinets that were in perfect condition originally will be MAJORLY damaged after. Brian's response "we can't we reposible for the damage our tools do when tearing up tile." They didn't try to cover, pad or offer any protection to minimize the potential for damage. Baseboards? We thought we would reuse the originals, which were in good condition. Brian supported this. And Brian quoted for tear down and replacement of the original baseboards. Ha! Brian put them back up like a damaged puzzle. Pieces were broken and glued back together, edges in wrong spots. I had to buy new baseboards and hire someone to repair them. The toilet previously functioned correctly, but after Brian removed the toilet to retile the bathroom, he wasn't able to replace the toilet without a leak, so he re-removed and text me to buy a new toilet. He scratched up my front door by scraping old tile and trash across the door as full hands passed through. And while the floors look great, he messed up the transitions. Not pretty. I'll have to pay $250 for new transitions and labor of another contractor to do it right. This 3 day project spanned 3 weeks. Aside from 3 days of delay in supplies, no fault to Brian, this project just drug on far far longer than needed. And to make matters worse, Brian broke into my house after the work was complete! I changed the house codes 1/23, as he'd stated that day he would be complete work. I don't keep contractor codes around any longer than needed for security. Saturday I noticed someone had been in my house. He freely admits it was him, but swears he used his code. He didn't have authority to be there, and I know he broke in through the back. Brian also, multiple times during the project, yelled, belittled, and called me names.Don't hire this guy (check him out online first, he lost his license previously....it might happen again, and he changes his biz name so no catches on quickly.)UPDATE 2016 - Brian agreed at the completion of service to take off $1k for damages. Not nearly enough to cover what the damages cost, but we met in the middle. After signing the agreement that the final check, less $1000 was paid in full, he sued me for that money.  After reassessing the full cost of damages, including the floor which is now coming up, because he apparently forgot to use glue?!?!? We countersued. Tens of thousands in damages excluding legal fees. The court case is ongoing, his suit was dismissed by the court. Ours still pending. I hope he loses his contractors license (again) and can't ever mess someone's home up like ours is.Useful 4FunnyCool 1Business owner informationBrian B.Business Owner6/9/2017UPDATE 2017 CASE WAS RESOLVED IN A TRIAL SEVERAL MONTHS AGO AND SHOWING NO FAULT TO BCT FLOORING AND SHOWERSRead more
column2: Business owner informationBrian B.Business Owner6/9/2017UPDATE 2017 CASE WAS RESOLVED IN A TRIAL SEVERAL MONTHS AGO AND SHOWING NO FAULT TO BCT FLOORING AND SHOWERSRead more

column1: Damanjit M.Elite '2021Brampton, Canada85653247/16/20191 photoHands down the Best Portuguese chicken I have ever tried. If you eat chicken, try this place, this is a Must. Delicious juicy chicken, fries and salad served with a hot or a mild sauce. The setting is not fancy, but it's cheap, delicious and generous.I tied this classic Portuguese Rotisserie when we went to Montreal last year. There was a long line up, it took me more than 1 hr to get to the ordering counter. There are 2 lines, one for walk in and second for order pickup. Yes you can order in advance and skip the long line. I got it packed and also got few egg tarts. Went back to our hotel and ate it after 2 hrs. I was blown away, the chicken was so flavourful and juicy. Even the egg tarts were good. I will definitely go back there. Sometimes I get dreams about this chicken, and believe me I will someday just go for a drive from Toronto to Montreal and back just for this chicken.Big line upUseful 2Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationRéponse C.Business Owner7/18/2019Hello Damanjit!Thank you for the 5 stars! column1: Bob V.Lakewood, OH13212/19/20192 photosOn July 17 my iPod stopped working and after a brief telephone conversation with Rick I brought it to him for repairs, intact and in original packaging.I was pleasantly surprised to hear from him the very next day. He told me that he had fixed the unit and it would cost $140. I picked it up from him that evening on my way to my girlfriend's house. I gave him $160 in cash, tipping him $20 for his quick turnaround time.He took it out of the box and demonstrated that it turned on, the backlight lit. I wasn't able to test its ability to play music because I didn't have earphones with me but I was planning on testing it out in my car. Unfortunately in the 45 seconds it took for me to reach my car the iPod's battery had gone critical and died. I certainly didn't think I'd need a charger while picking the unit up so I didn't have one on me. I thought it was odd that the battery died but figured I'd charge it when I got home later, after visiting my girlfriend. When I got home and charged it overnight it still wasn't working so I called Rick to complain. He already had my cash so I was obligated to give him another opportunity to repair the unit. I brought it back to him, along with another identical iPod to use for parts if needed. Both iPods were intact and in original packaging. Rick kept asking for more time to complete repairs. I relented until I had waited for four full months for my iPods to be returned to me. On November 17 I told him I was tired of waiting for his repairs and wanted to pick up my iPods. Despite my giving him several days to get my iPods reassembled, he returned my two intact iPods to me as a sack of unassembled parts, without all of the original packaging. Worse yet, Rick left a random unassociated memory card in the sack of parts which contains the personal medical information of a stranger.   So I gave Rick two intact iPods and $160, four months later he gave me back a sack of unassembled parts, and a hearty "sorry!". The idea of any refund at all (not even the tip I paid him) was immediately rejected by Rick.What I got back from Rick. Thanks a lot!This had a stranger's personal medical information on itUseful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationRick F.Business Owner9/29/2020On July 17th Bob brought in 2 Ipod classics and had crushed one of them with a car seat. He had a solid state hard drive in the crushed Ipod and wanted me to use the good Ipod and put the solid state hard drive from the crushed Ipod in it. He had 2 Ipod classis boxes with various memory cards in the boxes. The next day I realized that the good Ipod wasn't compatible with the solid state hard drive and attempted to contact Bob but voicemail was full. I tried again the next couple days with the same affect.2 months go by and I get a call from Bob and I let Bob know that I tried to contact him but voicemail was full. Bob was informed that if he wanted the solid state hard drive to work he would need to get a compatible Ipod classic. A couple more months go by and I don't hear from Bob.Then Bob shows up very jumpy and moving all over the place and wanted to pick up Ipods and I explained to him per our conversation he was to pick up a compatible Ipod. He seemed to forget our converstion and he just wanted to try to fix himself and I explained to Bob they are very difficult to work on and that I could put them back together for 35.00 and refund the rest. He explained he lost his job and needed to give his girlfriend the money so they didn't get evicted. Feeling sorry for Bob and his situation a full refund of 160 (including 20 tip) was given.Now I see a review where everything is our fault and a refund wasn't given. I can't understand why someone would lie about this when we were only trying to help. If Bob's voicemail wouldn't have been full for months he would've received our messages. I can only assume with all his personal problems he somehow was upset and working on those Ipods he probably became more upset.Read more

column1: Micki M.Elite '2021Sacramento, CA49876567769/7/2016This was our first time using Showtime for our transfer to/from the airport. We pre purchased our tickets online and had our tickets printed. When we arrived at the airport, the Showtime pick up location was easy to find outside the doors. Our shuttle arrived in minutes. The transfer to our hotel did take some time. We got on this small sized bus. Our driver loaded lots of other travelers and I would say the process of loading and checking other passengers took about fifteen minutes. Once passengers were loaded, our driver took us to our destination. We chose the MGM on this trip and luckily, we were the first stop. When going from hotel to airport, we were among maybe a few people going to the airport. We went directly from our hotel there! This may or may not happen to you, you may want to check with them to make sure you have enough to time to get to the airport. We were very satisfied with our choice to use Showtime. The drivers were friendly and drove safely! We'll gladly use them again!Useful 31Funny 21Cool 28Business owner informationJeff R.Business Owner9/8/2016Hi Micki -Thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience using our service.  I will be passing along your comments to our drivers.  It always makes their day!  We look forward to having you aboard in the future.Best,JeffRead more

column1: Brian J.Elite '2021Commerce City, CO691862564/13/2016Whatever you do, do not choose this shuttle service!  This is by far the worst you can experience in Las Vegas. We arrived late at night on a Friday night.  There was a 30 minute way for the taxis, so we thought a shuttle service may be faster.  Showtime looked as though they had the most shuttles so we decided to go with them. We first inquired about their limo/car service but the lady said she couldn't give us pricing on that because they don't take care of that at her station. Yet they advertise it right at the front of her booth?!?!?! It was late, we didn't want to argue so we went with the shuttle.  As we were walking up to the line, the shuttle that we were supposed ride leaves.  We had to wait an hour for the next one.  You got us this time Showtime, but never again!!Useful 4Funny 3CoolBusiness owner informationJeff R.Business Owner4/20/2016Hi Brian,Thank you for your feedback.  I've been inquiring internally about this one, as we don't have or offer limo or private service - only shuttle bus.   I'm not sure who you spoke with, but Showtime is only a shared ride airport shuttle.  I apologize for any miscommunication that may have occurred on our part.  Sincerely,JeffRead more

column1: Holly H.Phoenix, AZ3652/6/2019We knew when we bought our house a couple of years ago that the HVAC unit (original to the house built in 1998) was on borrowed time. So, of course, the heater kicks the bucket on the one "cold" weekend we have here in Phoenix...and why not the same weekend as we have family in town from the polar-vortexed midwest?Have no fear - Scottsdale Air is here! We called on Thursday afternoon and had a technician out (ON TIME) at 8:00 am the next day. Dave was professional, pleasant and HONEST about the most cost-effective way to move forward. We agreed it would be cheaper to just replace the whole thing and he had a sales rep at our house that afternoon. Russ Byrum (sales rep) is the most patient man on the planet. My husband and I are first time homebuyers and we had no idea what we were doing. Russ laid everything out for us and didn't try to oversell us beyond our budget. This dude is a ROCK STAR and will not steer you wrong. By Tuesday, we had the AMAZING install team at our house (Please note: they were ready to come out on Saturday, but we couldn't make it work on our end before that because of work. Russ even offered to bring out space heaters to our home so we didn't freeze over the weekend).Picture this: our HVAC system is half-outside/half-in-an-attic-crawl-space-in-a-garage that doesn't look like a human being should be able to fit in there. I don't know anything about this stuff and even I could tell you this task looked impossible. But for Jaime and Eulogio? No problem. They worked quickly, quietly and CLEANLY - wrapping the whole project in about seven hours. It was AMAZING. I cannot describe how much respect I have for these two guys. THANK YOU.Bottom Line: while this is the first time I've had the opportunity to use this company's services, my uncle and parents have been using them for decades; now they've earned one more lifelong customer. If you're looking for reliable professionals with a great work ethic that install a great product (this Trane XR15 looks like a piece of art and performs like NASA built it), the Scottsdale Air team is who you need to call.Useful 3Funny 2Cool 2Business owner informationMichael C.Business Owner2/7/2019Thank-You Holly, for sharing your experience with My Company.MikeRead more
column2: Business owner informationMichael C.Business Owner2/7/2019Thank-You Holly, for sharing your experience with My Company.MikeRead more

column1: Jill S.Gilbert, AZ40832115/18/2021Precision Air & Plumbing came to our rescue after waiting for AC repair service from our home warranty for almost two, long hot weeks. We ultimately made the decision to replace our existing AC units on a Monday morning; PA was out that same day with an extremely competitive quote,  including a generous first responder discount, and were able to install the 2 new units the following day. The team of 4 showed up on time, were professional, personable and finished the job in one day as promised. They even vacuumed when they were finished - that made the OCD side of my brain extremely happy - which was a close second to having cool air again. column1: Steve G.Scottsdale, AZ61713/16/20211 photoWe used Precision Air and Plumbing for a few years with good results. However in recent times we have had serious issues with them. We have uncommonly hard water and they had us remove our softener and. replace it with another technology which did not do what they described and caused scaling damage. They took back the new unit but charged us to purchase and install a new replacement softener. I received no response when trying to reach out to Managment about rectifying this.We gave them another chance when we had a leak caused by a hot water heater and humidifier hoping we could offset the cost of the softener debacle. Scheduling was a nightmare, they made a huge mess on our patio and although promising to clean it up multiple times still never did. I was in direct touch with service Managment and it still took weeks to get them out here to finish, and, the work area was left in a big mess inside the houseWe longer will be working with them------The business owner commented below but Yelp does not show a way for me to reply. It simply is not true that the service manager was trying to reach me. I have his cell # and was texting about this for weeks without response over and over. I imagine you dont want to post that thread on here.....Even if you were willing to come clean up the huge mess you mentioned nothing about removing our water softener on false information, causing scaling damage to our house and then charging us to put a new water softener back in!!This is how our patio was left after draining the hot water heater leakUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGina B.Business Owner3/18/2021Hi Steve-our plumbing manager has tried calling multiple times, in addition to email and text messages since our last visit onsite. We'd like to complete this clean up and have the opportunity to go out and clean the scale off the sidewalk. column1: Amy T.Elite '2021San Francisco, CA1230371387811/18/20161 photoI purchased a Groupon for a two hour deep tissue massage with 3 additional services. The three I chose were the back scrub, foot scrub, and the hot stones. My massage was with Ariana at 4PM. The confirmation email she sent out included step-by-step instructions on how to get to the exact location. Thank goodness for her instructions because I would've gotten lost otherwise. Ariana met me at the front desk exactly at 4. She gave me a questionnaire to fill out regarding my health status, my preference of pressure, and the issue areas that I wanted her to address. The pressure scale was anywhere from 1 to 8, 8 being "it hurts so good." I have gotten my fair square of professional massages so I opted for a 7.5. The room was clean and Ariana was very professional. However, I was thoroughly disappointed with my massage and 3 additional services. First of all, I asked for a 7.5 pressure, Ariana gave me about a 2/3. I understand that pressure is a subjective topic, but she never asked if the pressure was okay (not even once). She spent what seemed like hours on my back as I had pointed out in the beginning that my problem spots were my shoulders and lower back. She used the same strokes repeatedly; there was no variation. I got bored quickly. Because she did not massage deeply, she glided over my knots. It was more like a petting zoo than a deep tissue massage. I left feeling the same amount of tenseness in my shoulders and lower back as I had came with, but with a lot more residual oil from head to toe. When she flipped me onto my back, she went to go massage my abdominal area which felt weird to me. I've never had my abs massaged before and because I don't have abs, I felt as if she was massaging my organs. 2 out of the 3 additional add-ons were also disappointing. The hot stones was my favorite because you cant really mess up on rubbing hot stones across ones back. However, the foot and back scrub didn't do much for me. Oil is placed across the back and feet and a what felt like a scrub mit was used to gently glide across the skin. There was no pressure at all. It didn't feel like a scrub. I was hoping to find a masseuse that I could see monthly, but unfortunately, that didn't happen. I thoroughly appreciated Ariana's level of professionalism and the cleanliness of the facility, but she lacked skill.Waiting areaUseful 3Funny 2Cool 1Business owner informationAriana L.Business Owner11/20/2016Oh darn, every licensed massage therapist knows the day will come when they'll get a bad review...but you are never really ready for it! Especially not being compared to a Petting Zoo :)  I appreciate your very thorough review.In regards to pressure: I provide very light to very deep tissue massage. I try my best to empower clients to be in the driver's seat of their massage, letting them know they can request more or less at any time. Usually with a 2 hour session, a full hour is spent on the back if those areas are the client's chief complaint. One size doesn't fit all for clients when it comes to pressure or technique, which is why I try my best to keep the lines of communication open, while not interrupting your time on the table with needless additional chatter. I sincerely apologize if I didn't communicate this effectively and will be much more careful about it in the future. In regards to technique: Every therapist isn't right for every person and it sounds like we might not have been a match made in heaven. :) My techniques are diverse, and I use additional long flowing connected strokes to give the massage that flowy "omm" feeling. This helps those really deep massages to feel more relaxing, and reduces the chances that the client will be sore the next day. The techniques I use are meant for a deeply effective relaxation based massage which relieves stress, muscular tension and soreness. My hope is that my clients' minds will be able to relax just as well as their bodies. Now and Zen is a great choice for relaxing style deep tissue massage, but would not be a good choice for a fast paced, sports-style deep tissue massage. In regards to the relaxation exfoliation shea butter scrubs: I appreciate your feedback. These menu items were created as a more gentle/relaxing and less messy alternative to traditional salt and sugar scrubs. Warm shea butter is massaged over the back and then exfoliation mitts are used to gently exfoliate the skin, afterwards steamed towels are used to wipe away excess butter and add a little moisture. This additional moisture allows the vitamin rich butter to penetrate the skin more deeply. In regards to the abdominal massage: I sincerely apologize for massaging an area that was uncomfortable. I try my best for a very thorough intake. I think it is important to note here that even if abdominal muscles aren't highly toned (like traditional "abs" you see in magazines) that they are still there and still in use each and every day. They are quite tense on most individuals regardless of muscle tone or weight and are often overlooked in treatment. Working attachment points for these muscles gently over the sheet can ease a lot of tension in the back for most people, especially lower back tension or that "stuck" feeling in the mid-back around the thoracic spine. But there are definitely exceptions and massage isn't ever one-size-fits-all, which is part of what makes it such a beautiful art! Sometimes life is about learning what we don't want, just as much as learning what we do :) Now that we know it is something you don't like, in the future you can let your next therapist know that they can avoid that area. Additionally,  if they are doing anything to make you feel uncomfortable at all, please know you have the right to ask them to stop or adjust their technique at any time and for any reason. We never want you to be uncomfortable on our tables. You will never be asked for an explanation or receive resistance from a professional therapist - we are here to serve you and your preferences are paramount to us. These preferences are used to build a personalized treatment tailored to you and your body. I'm so sorry that we weren't a good fit, but I appreciate you giving Now and Zen a try! If you would like a referral to another highly skilled and professional therapist that might be a better fit for you please email me at Ariana@yourzenmassage.com and I can provide you with a list of well recommended local colleagues. Have a wonderful day!Read more

column1: Mark R.Gimli, Canada0913/26/2019My Indochino suit material quality is good. I am happy with the product itself but that is the only part of the experience that was satisfactory. The process of getting the suit and getting measured for adjustments is incredibly cumbersome and not user friendly at all. You'll have a much more satisfying experience if you go to any mainstream suit retailer. Their website is very misleading as to their ability to deliver on their promise and timelines. You need to budget 1-2 months to get a proper fitting suit with all the adjustments and remakes required. They seem completely unwilling to compensate clients for the inconvenience of their process. I am guessing that's why all orders are non-refundable. If they were refundable no one would follow through with their order. I will not be ordering from Indochino again. The product is satisfactory but it's not any better than the next tailor and therefore not worth the long and inconvenient process. You'll have a much more enjoyable experience getting a "custom" tailored suit from your local tailor or merchant (such as Moore's or Men's Warehouse or Tip Top Tailor)I gave them multiple opportunities to make up for the dropped ball service but they did not care to try. They could have kept my future business if they'd tried to do so. Don't waste your time with Indochino.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationChris T.Business Manager3/27/2019Hi Mark, We're sorry to hear about your frustrations with your order. Since there are no additional fitting appointments while your suit is being constructed, we work backwards and make adjustments to the finished garments to achieve your ideal fit. Once your profile is updated with the new measurements, future orders will fit out of the box and you will not have to go through the same process again. When ordering for a special event, we recommend ordering 6 weeks in advance to have enough time for any adjustments. We can see that your remake suit has been submitted, please reach out to our team if you have any further issues.Read more

column1: PJ K.Elite '2021Richmond Hill, Canada21181453/17/2016Don't be fooled, investing in a made-to-measure suit (a.k.a. custom suit) is not the same as investing in a bespoke suitThe truth is that made-to-measure suits still conform to a design template being mass-produced by a company to make its sales.Brands that offer made-to-measure suits have made the process a fairly easy and a quick one for all types of men. Measurements taken by a consultant or calculated by an online tailoring system are sent off to a factory machine that is programmed to know basic proportions. In a matter of days, the suit is ready for wear. If additional alterations are required, they might be done on site, but these days little or no hand-made elements are incorporated into the assembly of a made-to-measure suit.Ultimately, the effort in creating a suit that is unique to a single wearer is lost in the made-to-measure process. The one-on-one consultations between client and tailor are compromised to simply submitting measurements, picking a lining, choosing some buttons and possibly having the suit monogrammed. Other than that, you end up with a swatch that has been customized to fit you in the best way it can.There is nothing wrong with purchasing a made-to measure suit and here are a few pros:- Affordable- Personalized- StylishI ordered a 'made to measure suit' from Indochino last year and here is my experience with this company.The consultant was friendly and knowledgeable about the products. The process begins with selecting a material, buttons, a lining, a suit jacket style (i.e single or double breasted), notch style, vent, etc. They than proceeded to take my measurements which is also available online through the website. In the end, I was happy with my experience and was anxious to receive my suit which they shipped directly to my home.Unfortunately when I did receive my suit, the suit length was cut so short it looked like I was wearing a toddlers jacket. There was a few other minor issues, sleeve length and pant length but I chalk this up to inexperience from the consultant. Indochino, at no extra cost, had the minor issues tailored and replaced the jacket with a properly measure jacket.Overall, if you are a first timer looking to have a 'made to measure' suit or 'custom suit' made, I would recommend Indochino.Useful 13Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationChris T.Business Manager3/29/2016Pat, Thanks for taking the time to write a such an informative and refreshing review.  I'm glad that in the end we got your fit right, but please feel free to reach out if you ever need anything else.Warm regards,Josesocial@indochino.comRead more

column1: Courtney L.Mesa, AZ05817310/25/20154 photosMy fiance and I came across a project pie in Vegas and fell in love with the concept, so when we saw this opened up right down the street from the house we were all over it.The owner was holding the door to greet customers which was very nice customer service he explained the concept him and his wife decided to implement into the restaurant and thanked us for coming. All the employees were very nice and the inside was decorated perfectly. Since it is new there was a lot of people and limited seating (understanable). I am a plain pizza person so I only get pepperoni and my fiance gets meat lovers, he enjoyed his pizza although for myself it came out soggy and floppy. I also noticed there was no corn mean on the dough.... To me that's what makes a pizza, also they use ovens like dominos or pizza hut would use instead of a fire oven or brick oven which changes the taste completely. It was good but I would drive further to another place with the same concept next time. It's a shame becuase I wanted to really like this place.Useful 3Funny 1Cool 3Business owner informationBecky M.Business Owner11/9/2015We took a lot of time to test out our pizzas, and we get the best finish on our crusts with the conveyor ovens, as opposed to the wood-fired ovens, which left us with unevenly cooked pizzas & even soggy crusts. But we do appreciate your feedback and will keep it in mind--thank you!Read more

column1: Jayne Y.Elite '2021Las Vegas, NV66732262/13/20209 photosMichael Mina is a Michelin-star chef and well-known for his flagship restaurant in San Francisco. I had no idea who he was when I ate here, but my coworkers from San Francisco spoke highly of his food so I was excited to dine here.When we walked in, the ambiance felt inviting, relaxing and elegant. Our server was excellent...customer service was top-notch! There were 8 of us and he arranged for additional staff to help serve our party. They anticipated our needs and accommodated us throughout the entire time. The food was AMAZING!!! We all chose the Tasting Menu (6 course meal for $148 per person) to get the most out of our experience. Everything was delish, but here are a couple of standouts:Ahi Tuna- wow! The server said that they get the ahi from Hawaii. It's mixed with an egg yolk, sesame oil-based dressing and pine nuts. One of the servers will mix all of the ingredients for you. Lobster Pot Pie- decadent and delicious! The pieces of lobster were HUGE. It's mixed with brandied cream, black truffle and baby vegetables. We drank bottles of red and white wine to complement the various dishes (fish, red meat, etc.). They provided an excellent selection! The Goldeneye Pinot Noir was my favorite! Dining here is a splurge, but it's worth it. A handful of employees thanked us for coming in as we walked out the door....first-class service! This was truly a 5 star experience!!See all photos from Jayne Y. for Michael MinaUseful 12Funny 5Cool 11Business owner informationMgm Resorts I.Business Customer Service2/20/2020Thank you for the amazing comments and feedback! The photos you posted were great. Thank you for sharing for our other guests to enjoy! I have to agree the signature tasting menu is a fantastic culinary adventure! Looking forward to your next dinner with us. With appreciation,Lamson NguyenAssistant General ManagerRead more

column1: Kristie P.Elite '2021New York, NY27022859910/21/20194 photosWas able to sneak away from work for dinner and we landed on Michael Mina, as it was easy to get a table and it wasn't too far from our hotel. You do have to walk through the crazy Vegas crowds to get to the restaurant, as it is nestled a bit inside of the Bellagio. We were seated right away and ordered a bottle of wine to start. We decided to do the summer tasting menu with the shellfish. Here's how it went:-First course - trio of raw and chilled: the hamachi was my favorite, then the snapper then the squid. The snapper did have some crispy scales that felt like I was biting into something I shouldn't be eating so I do wish they had removed that. Overall, very fresh and a good variety of flavors in the three -Second course - sweet corn gazpacho: man oh man, was this delicious! The gazpacho was fresh but very thick and full of rich crab. Third course - shellfish: everything you could want from this course. Fresh, flavorful, and light. The scallop was buttery, the oysters had the perfect amount of miso garlicy goodness smothered all over them, and there were some shrimp cocktail as well. -Fourth course - filet mignon: the steak was as good as you could expect but the real star of the show was the shallot-potato cake. It was super crispy and warm and I wish I could have that with my breakfast everyday. -Fifth course - chocolate cake: not gonna lie, I was not a fan of this at all. I honestly think beet tastes like dirt (LOL) so a sorbet out of beet isn't high on my list of foods I'd recommend. All in all, was just an okay experience. I think there are much better restaurants in Vegas for the same price tag.Useful 2Funny 1Cool 4Business owner informationJorge P.Business Manager10/24/2019Dear Kristie P.,Thank you for your feedback and 4 star review. We are glad you were able to try our Summer tasting menu and will share all your detailed comments with our culinary team. Please come back and try our Signature Tasting menu next time you are in town, our classic Tuna tartare and Lobster Pot Pie are the stars of the menu. Sincerely,Jorge PaganiGeneral ManagerMichael Mina Las VegasRead more

column1: AnnaMae M.North Las Vegas, NV415294/22/20183 photosCame here on a Saturday evening.  My Brother called me on a whim asking if I wanted to try it out,  wasn't doing anything so said why not. Lol We were registered for the 5:15 slot,  showed up on time, one of our team was running a little late and they were completely understanding of it and didn't have an issue.  Registering was super easy,  you pay and sign a waiver and you're all set.We did the "easy" room called Underworld.  We had a blast.  I won't talk about how to solve anything but we were a little thrown off in the beginning as the guy told us that we do not need to do anything crazy, break stuff etc.   so we were a little hesitant with some of the props in the room and this easily set us back as we were extremely  hard headed to ask for hints. Haha.   (The employees will give you 3 hints if you ask for them) Let me just tell you.... TOUCH AND MOVE EVERYTHING, LOOK AT EVERYTHING.  LOL Aside from losing my soul to Hades in the underworld,  this place is a must try if you've never gone.   It is super fun and extremely interactive. I will say that Hades voice in the initial preview movie they show you is a little too..."nice" for me.  I almost wanted to laugh cause I always imagined him with a meaner raspy voice. But hey,  a God of the underworld should sound powerful so I guess they got that right. This is the second escape room location I have tried and this one is significantly more organized compared to the other one I tried.Useful 2Funny 2Cool 1Business owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager4/26/2018AnnaMae, Thank You so much for this amazing, detailed review. We are so happy to hear that you had a great time! We really hope to have you back soon!Read more

column1: Rich L.Anaheim, CA72171421/20/2019This review is long over due. In Vegas for work, so my wife and I had to do an escape room (or two). This one was walking distance from our hotel room at the Rio. They room had only been open for about a week or 2, so there were some bugs. Hopefully they have fixed it by now.We did their Underworld and Mayan room with just the 2 of us.Underworld is a Greek/Roman myth theme I believe, and it wasn't too hard. We only had to use 1 clue. It was pretty good. Not much tech, but fair puzzles.The Mayan room looked much cooler, and much harder. They warned me that it would be harder, but I had never done a Mayan room before and I wanted to try it out. I would recommend 4 people for this room. To date, that was the only Mayan room I have ever done, so I guess you could say it was my favorite. One of the puzzle props were not set properly, and it was just laying on the floor. It was a pretty good puzzle too. But we definitely had so much trouble with it for just the 2 of us.I would come back again to try their other rooms in the future.Useful 1Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager2/25/2019Thank you so much, Rich! column1: Katrina N.San Diego, CA204281/21/2019I would give this more of a 2.5 stars than 3 stars. First off, the game master gave our group a lot of attitude and was not very welcoming. He seemed very annoyed as he was giving explanations or hints. For the room itself, we did "Underworld", which is an easy room with props that seemed very cheap. All the puzzles led to a number or letter combination that opened a lock that gave a key. Finally, the end of the room was very anti climatic because it was just unlocking an object with all the keys we gathered. One of the boxes was not securely locked, and I was able to just reach in and grab the key. Also, some of the hints are useless or worn out. We escaped in 29 minutes.... waste of money. Overall, there are other rooms at Lockdown, but I don't think I will be coming back.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager2/25/2019We are very sorry to hear that you did not have a 5 star experience, as that is always our goal. column1: Callie G.Las Vegas, NV01451/5/2019I did the Mayan room with my brother at the Flamingo location. The quality of most of the room was nice which is why I gave 3 stars, and the guy working was also nice, however there were multiple issues that were extremely unfortunate. To begin, on the website the Mayan room is labeled a difficulty of "Medium" which is why I chose it for my brother and I since there would only be 2 of us. When we got there, he tells us that it's actually "Hard" and recommended at least 4 people and that it has a success rate of 18%. Okay, not a huge deal. We like a challenge and have both successfully competed every escape room we've ever done so we decide to still try. Our time ran out right before the final puzzle (I know this because the guy working came in and told us that we only had one left and explained what we did "wrong" on the one we were "stuck" on. We spent a significant amount of time trying to complete a puzzle that had to do with 5 balancing balls... after struggling for at least 10 minutes we ask for one of our 3 clues. He then tells us "oh yeah two of the balls are broken that's why we wrote the numbers." The thing is though just because they wrote the numbers doesn't fix the problem, if the balls don't work how they're supposed to then there's no way of knowing why they came up with those numbers if you don't know that the balls are broken. If we had known this BEFORE we even entered or if he had told us when he saw we were at that puzzle we would have made it out 100%. It was because of their broken equipment and not telling us it was broken until we asked that caused us not to make it out. Very disappointing especially finding out from him right after that we were at the last puzzle. Fix the equipment or tell people before they go in if something is broken and clearly not part of the room. Also, change the description on your website please. If we had know the difficulty we would have done our second choice at a different location.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager2/25/2019Thank you very much for your feedback. We really are let down when we see that you weren't completely satisfied. We are addressing your concerns, one by one, and we do hope that you will be back to visit us again in the future. Thank you, Callie.Read more
column2: Business owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager2/25/2019Thank you very much for your feedback. We really are let down when we see that you weren't completely satisfied. We are addressing your concerns, one by one, and we do hope that you will be back to visit us again in the future. Thank you, Callie.Read more

column1: Jared N.Elite '2021Henderson, NV3097105928/18/2018My dad wanted to get me something different for my birthday this year and an escape room was suggested by my aunt. I had never given much thought to escape rooms but it sounded interesting enough so the research began. And let me tell you, there is plenty to research. There are so many escape rooms in Las Vegas. I looked at several and the room I was most interested in was the Western room at Lockdown Flamingo. So my dad booked it for three of us. He and a friend of mine accompanied me.Neither of us had done an escape room before so we didn't know what to expect. We started with a briefing of the rules and watched an informational video giving us the back story of the room. We were then taken into the room and our 1 hour clock was started. The three of us were split into two jail cells which we had to break out of. I'm not going to say we cheated but we did not fully complete the first couple of puzzles. It was taking too damn long to get to the meat of the challenge. Once we were out of the cells we were on to the good puzzles that had more clues with which to work. We were on the right track with most everything and maybe even figured out a couple of clues but we were starting to run out of time. 45 minutes were gone and and we were given our 15 minute warning. But we weren't anywhere close to unlocking the final locks. Then we remembered we were allowed three clues. We used them. I'm not even going to lie. After the first two we were on top of our game. We knew exactly what to do for the last clue. Or maybe not. We used that third clue and with that the final lock was opened. We found the giant key and recovered the stolen totems thereby ending the cursed drought. All with four minutes to spare. Phew.This experience started out frustrating as all hell. But once we started finding our groove it became a lot of fun. What I am most fascinated by is the attention to detail. The thought that must go into creating the puzzles is staggering. Plus the atmosphere was spot on. It was dark as if in an 1880s jail lit by lantern. The headdress and arrows. Wanted posters and furniture. Everything matched the theme of the room. I appreciate the care that went in to this. Without giving anything away, if you come here or any escape room I imagine, be sure to bring your attention to detail. As they say, the devil is in the details. Things that seem inconsequential may have the biggest impact in either solving or not solving the puzzle and thus escaping the room.Useful 2Funny 1Cool 2Business owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager8/29/2018Thank you so much for your detailed review, Jared! We are so happy that you chose Lockdown for your first escape room experience. We hope to have you back for our other themes here in Las Vegas!Read more
column2: Business owner informationMelissa O.Business Manager8/29/2018Thank you so much for your detailed review, Jared! We are so happy that you chose Lockdown for your first escape room experience. We hope to have you back for our other themes here in Las Vegas!Read more

We tried to get it to work for awhile and then he finally came in..he had a hard time but he got it to give us the next clue...I think that spoiled it for us, pulled us out of the game play...and was uber disappointing. There were a few other snafus in the other room as well..it just led you to failure If you went a different direction...we like difficult rooms which is why we selected this one...but it just wasn't that fun. column1: Brian F.Elite '2021San Francisco, CA26270343/23/2018Five stars all the way for this property! I stay here at least a couple of times a year, and for one of Marriott's limited service brands, the staff here really go out of their way. For example, when I changed reservations in the middle of our stay, they got me a better room and actually moved our luggage to the new room while we were out for the day. They also address me by name when I come and go. In particular, the woman at the front desk on weekday mornings is delightful, as are the two guys who work overnight.  I had even provided some constructive feedback the last time I stayed, and one of them remembered me and still treated me very kindly.  Even at the breakfast, the woman comes over, clears my plate, and asks if she can get me anything else. I have never had anybody speak to me at a limited service hotel morning breakfast buffet before!I also observe whenever I am in the lobby. column1: Betsy W.Huntington Beach, CA023189/12/2020Stayed here during COVID and this was the first hotel I've stayed at where I was sketched out by the lack of cleanliness. Most hotels have been taking this really seriously. The first room they gave us, had a dead bug on the floor right when we walked in so I checked out the room closely like maybe the bug came in after cleaning? I don't think the bathroom had been cleaned other than fresh towels. The floors also didn't seem like they had been cleaned based on small things throughout the room. So the first desk changed our room ... okay second room - glitter! Glitter all over the floors and the bathroom. But it was 1 am so we chose glitter over dead bugs. There was food left in the fridge from the last person and a while milky film all over the floor. Seemed like the floor received soap but not cleaned up after maybe? Glad we had our own disinfect spray and pillows.   Also, be aware of an $8 parking fee, which no biggie BUT there's no security for that $8. I thought it would be enhanced like gates since we were paying for the parking lot in front of the hotel... nope just standard parking lot no gate. Overall, I'd stay somewhere else during COVID just the be safe.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHotel M.Business Manager9/12/2020Dear Betsy,Thank you for reviewing your stay with us. column1: Blair H.Loves Park, IL2342112/6/20182 photosStayed here for 9 nights. When I checked in, I needed to shower quick before heading off to work. As I was showering, I stepped on something. It was a cockroach. I almost fell down. Immediately disgusted, I called down to the front desk and told them what happened. They agreed to switch rooms. Fair enough. When I went down, I told the gal I wanted to be compensated with points for this inconvenience and quite frankly I was ready to leave. She assured me I would be. As a Platinum Elite, I think I have enough options to move, but I thought I Midas well just stay. Then I was moved to another room. Air conditioner not plugged in. Ok, I can live with it. Had to call maintenance again. Stayed for the 9 days. Fair hotel. Cleanliness obviously an issue. As I left, I ran into the General Manager.  I asked her if she knew what happened on my first day and she said it was noted in the computer and that I would be getting points for this. Now, I asked for 100k points when it initially happened, and that didn't seem to be an issue. After spending nearly 2k for the 9 days, I thought that was more than fair for stepping on a cockroach the size of my big toe while showering and deciding not to check out right there and then. Come one month later this hotel refuses to compensate me. What they did do however was insult me with a whopping 250 bonus points. Completely unacceptable.  Can't recommend staying here for a number of reasons, but mostly they seem to not care about their customers. I definitely won't be back after not getting what I was assured I would get.  Bugs happen but when they do you take care of the customers, not treat them like it was noBig deal.  Enjoy the photos.Useful 3FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHotel M.Business Manager12/7/2018Dear Blair, Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay.  We would like to offer our apologies for not living up to your expectations. Although we make every effort to be perfect, sometimes we fall short. We hope you will consider giving us a second chance in the future so we can prove this is not typical of our usual service.Lori Halm Area General ManagerRead more

There are plenty of dining options nearby, but only a couple that are within a quick walk. Just a heads-up in case you are traveling without a vehicle/rental.If I had a need to visit Scottsdale with my family (hubby and tweens), I'd likely use this hotel, seemed very family friendly.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHotel M.Business Manager11/16/2017Dear Rebecca,Thank you for recommending us to future guests. We were delighted to read that you enjoyed the quality of our service and facilities and that we delighted you in every way. Our goal is for you to enjoy every aspect of your stay and we are so glad that you did. We appreciate your recognition of our efforts and look forward to welcoming you back to SpringHill Suites North on your next trip to Scottsdale. Lori Halm Area General ManagerRead more

column1: Maya D.Elite '2021Redondo Beach, CA634132649/20/20189 photosI had a brief but nice stay at this hotel for a business trip. The staff was very friendly, particularly those working at the check-in desk, the shuttle driver and the lady working in the breakfast area. They are currently upgrading all of the guest rooms and I was told that I was in one of the newer rooms. The hotel is quiet. There's no restaurant in the hotel. However, they have snacks and drinks available for purchase downstairs, there is a nearby restaurant that delivers (menu was in the room) and breakfast is complimentary. Breakfast had a great spread including croissants, bagels, toast, muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, boiled eggs, oatmeal with several mix in, cereal, eggs, sausage, potatoes, juice, tea & coffee. There is always ice water available in the lobby if you have a cup or reusable water bottle to refill (great for those triple digit days!). There is a free hotel shuttle that will take you within a 5 mile radius of the hotel, which is super helpful since there are a ton of shops and restaurants nearby. There is a safe in the room that will fit a laptop as well as a microwave and mini-fridge. Overall a very nice stay!See all photos from Maya D. for SpringHill Suites Scottsdale NorthUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationHotel M.Business Manager9/21/2018Dear Maya,Thank you for being our guest and for your positive feedback. We are delighted to read that you enjoyed the quality of our service and facilities and that we delighted you in every way. We appreciate your recognition of our efforts and look forward to welcoming you back to SpringHill Suites North on your next trip to Scottsdale.Lori HalmArea General ManagerRead more

column1: Krysten F.Toronto, Canada136311/5/2013I am glad we have another café other than Balzacs and the Americano at Furbo is excellent.  They have a nice selection of baked goods in the morning, and the cheddar chive scone is to die for!I love the atmosphere in the café and the ever changing artwork make it an interesting and sophisticated space.  Kevin, the owner, always greets me with a smile and knows my order inside and out.  Overall, Furbo has been an excellent addition the distillery, and it is definitely worth a visit.Useful 1FunnyCool 3Business owner informationKevin B.Business Owner11/6/2013Oh my! this is the best compliment ever, thank you so much for taking the extra time to come see us Krysten;  and bringing your friends with you!  I love making your Americano (Boom!). You make my day always.all the very best to you and yours,KevRead more

column1: Renee R.Clifton, NJ3049111/7/20131 photoService here is excellent! The owner was kind to ask us what we wanted and specially crafted our coffee/hot chocolate to fix our mid day slump. This guy knows his stuff! Best Baileys and coffee I've had in awhile. The place is super modern and chic inside with interesting and unique art installations. The prices are good and - although I didn't try the food - it looked excellent (smelled good too)! Come here while you're passing through the Distillery District!Doing what he does! Thanks!!!Useful 6Funny 2Cool 4Business owner informationKevin B.Business Owner11/7/2013Jersey grrrrls rock! You made my week you guys, thank you for stopping by, see you again soon.xokevRead more

column1: Jeremy M.Mississauga, Canada069/20/2014If there was an award for the worst espresso bar in Canada, Caffe Furbo would win by a landslide.The space is beautiful, provided you like seeing mice. As I sat there I watched not 1, but 5 different mice run along the walls, across the dining area, and up the pillars.And they somehow figured out how to create the worst tasting cappuccino ever created. The milk was scalded to the point of curdling. There were chunks in the foam. And the espresso was pulled from an over hot machine creating a bitter, ash flavor.And this single shot cappuccino cost $4.39!I didn't complain or return the coffee, because I was there to meet a person for a business meeting. I just put aside the coffee and buried my disgust.I can't believe this place exists. Do yourself a favor. Don't get suckered in by the intriguing, artistic space. If you're craving a coffee walk over to Balzac, and don't even consider this place for food. If the mice are running around the dining room, just imagine the state of their kitchen.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationKevin B.Business Owner9/24/2014Jeremy, thank you for your candid commentary.  I disagree with everything you said except for the mice you saw.  Please drop by and have a look at our spotless kitchen and enjoy a beverage on the house at any time, I enjoy talking about my work and enjoy a friendly rapport with the community.  Mice are not a pest issue for us as acknowledged by a moh quarterly inspections.  The cafe has a compassionate pest control system where live trapping and release is the norm, not using poisons and harmful chemicals in an area that is used for the handling of food.  That said I have alerted the property management to step up the caulking from outside walls.  Again sorry you left our humble little place unnerved, this is not our intent in any way.Please direct any questions or comments to me personally at kevin@caffefurbo.com Jeremy, peace.Read more
column2: Business owner informationKevin B.Business Owner9/24/2014Jeremy, thank you for your candid commentary.  I disagree with everything you said except for the mice you saw.  Please drop by and have a look at our spotless kitchen and enjoy a beverage on the house at any time, I enjoy talking about my work and enjoy a friendly rapport with the community.  Mice are not a pest issue for us as acknowledged by a moh quarterly inspections.  The cafe has a compassionate pest control system where live trapping and release is the norm, not using poisons and harmful chemicals in an area that is used for the handling of food.  That said I have alerted the property management to step up the caulking from outside walls.  Again sorry you left our humble little place unnerved, this is not our intent in any way.Please direct any questions or comments to me personally at kevin@caffefurbo.com Jeremy, peace.Read more

column1: Tom M.Toronto, Canada1210/26/2013Garbage americanos--bitter and served in a &$@#%ing glass (when are these pretentious coffee shops going to get it through their thick skulls not to serve hot liquids in handle-less glassware?!?)"Oh," says the clueless counter girl,"would you like that in a paper cup instead?" Yes, please, I'd like to retain my fingerprints thank you very much. Ham and brie sandwich is decent. Decor is cool. But I won't be coming back here.Useful 1Funny 2CoolBusiness owner informationKevin B.Business Owner11/3/2013Thank you for coming to our humble café Tom;  for 1st timers I suggest a single Americano to get yourself acclimatized to its taste, this cup will be as strong as most people like their drip coffee...the next time my clients try the standard 2 shot Americano that has won so many hearts here.  Tom, I serve hot drinks from a glass because in my opinion it is healthier, paper cups are lined with long-chained synthetic molecules (Bisphenol A)  that when heated release harmful chemicals into the drink....we provide a bpa-free paper cup alternative with an insulated cardboard cup sleeve that fits both paper and thick glass cups for easier handling.   best to you and yours, Kevin Bonnicicaffefurbo.comtwitter.com/caffefurboRead more
column2: Business owner informationKevin B.Business Owner11/3/2013Thank you for coming to our humble café Tom;  for 1st timers I suggest a single Americano to get yourself acclimatized to its taste, this cup will be as strong as most people like their drip coffee...the next time my clients try the standard 2 shot Americano that has won so many hearts here.  Tom, I serve hot drinks from a glass because in my opinion it is healthier, paper cups are lined with long-chained synthetic molecules (Bisphenol A)  that when heated release harmful chemicals into the drink....we provide a bpa-free paper cup alternative with an insulated cardboard cup sleeve that fits both paper and thick glass cups for easier handling.   best to you and yours, Kevin Bonnicicaffefurbo.comtwitter.com/caffefurboRead more

column1: Melissa F.Chandler, AZ0123/3/20212 photosSo this is the second time I come here and I should have learned my lesson the first time I came here but I decided to call in and let them know about my experience the first time and the manager asked me to give them another try so today I did and I realize I should have never given them a second chance I actually left my phone on translator and listen to the whole conversation and how badly they spoke about me and my children but that's not all I asked them to do simple design and she messed up on it I let her know that she messed up on my design and then she got lazy on the whole design and didn't do what I had initially asked her to do so overall my experience here was trash I just truly wouldn't recommend this place!!!!!Price was not the issue it was length. Make sure you have your translator on ladies it's pretty horrendous how they speak about their customers.Example of what I wantedVs what I gotUsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJenifer N.Business Manager3/3/2021Also, regarding the designs our technician indicated that you didn’t want them because you thought it’s not feasible, ie., you didn’t want to pay for the cost of the design.Read more
