column1: Emily H.Kingman, AZ4546234/3/20213 photosThis salon was a nightmare, I went to them twice for a full set and a fill because they are close to my neighborhood. I had Kelly the first time and it was a good experience the second time I got an older woman and she was super aggressive during the visit and kept yanking my hand so I didn't go back again. Yesterday I went to get a fill at a different place and they found fungus growing underneath the acrylic nails. I called today and spoke to the man at the front desks and he denied that it was the salons fault for the fungus and would not issue a refund for the unprofessional service. I've been getting my nails done with acrylics for 10+ years and have never had this happen. I'm honestly disgusted at what happened and the response I was given.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJenifer N.Business Manager4/28/2021Hi Emily.  We’re sorry that u had a negative experience at our salon.  Regarding the fungus on your middle finger, it is rather difficult to determine the cause.  Typically this happens when there’s lifting on acrylics.  And lifting can happen when a patron does not get refill on time.  It is recommended that refill should be done every 2-3 weeks.  Base on your purchase history, you’ve gone beyond 4 weeks in between refills.  The last technician who serviced you has more than 20 years of experience and she never had any fungus issue.  We would be glad to take care of your next refill with compensation, regardless of the cause of fungus.  However, refund is not an option because our services are NOT refundable.  We wish you the best and remind you not to go beyond 2-3 weeks between refills.Read more
column2: Business owner informationJenifer N.Business Manager4/28/2021Hi Emily.  We’re sorry that u had a negative experience at our salon.  Regarding the fungus on your middle finger, it is rather difficult to determine the cause.  Typically this happens when there’s lifting on acrylics.  And lifting can happen when a patron does not get refill on time.  It is recommended that refill should be done every 2-3 weeks.  Base on your purchase history, you’ve gone beyond 4 weeks in between refills.  The last technician who serviced you has more than 20 years of experience and she never had any fungus issue.  We would be glad to take care of your next refill with compensation, regardless of the cause of fungus.  However, refund is not an option because our services are NOT refundable.  We wish you the best and remind you not to go beyond 2-3 weeks between refills.Read more

column1: Chris K.Minot, ND5027143/21/2021I have had two gel pedicures here now and plan to go back for a third very soon. The salon is clean and always promptly had me seated and soaking my feet at my appointment time. They have a lot of chairs so social distancing hasn't been a problem when I have been there. I usually try for a mid morning appointment. My first pedicure was perfect, the second wasn't quite as great, but still very well done. I can't believe how long a gel pedicure will last!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationJenifer N.Business Manager5/2/2021Thank you and we look forward to seeing you againRead more
column2: Business owner informationJenifer N.Business Manager5/2/2021Thank you and we look forward to seeing you againRead more

column1: Kelly M.New York, NY40062122/4/2017AVOID THIS CAR SERVICE: ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE A WOMAN. I called the main # because I couldn't find my car, while waiting in the lobby of my hotel. No driver called me back to find me or confirm, so I called the main number back 15 min later, worried I might miss my flight. When I finally found my driver and went to throw my suitcase in his trunk, he yelled at me and proceeded to argue about not being able to find me. I tried to explain that I'd been trying to reach him by calling the main #, but he continued to blame me for the situation, and the situation escalated quickly. It's surreal to type/share this, but he started yelling at me, called me "a F*#ing B@$th" and threatened to "punch me in the face" if I didn't get out of his car. It quickly became a verbally abusive situation. After getting away, I called the manager/owner (?) immediately to relay the exchange and he was defensive and asked me what I expected him to do about. How about apologize profusely for a driver that verbally abused a woman and threatened to hit her? What a horrible, irresponsible company.UPDATE-RESPONDING TO THE OWNER'S RESPONSE: I called your company twice while waiting for my pick-up, because I'd gone downstairs to the lobby of my building at 8:45am, when the pick-up was scheduled. I called your company at 8:49am (from my phone log) to try to reach my driver, but I received no call back. I waited and then called back at 8:58am. At this point, I was worried I might miss my flight and I was upset. I've used professional car services for a long time and I've never encountered a company that doesn't give the drivers the passenger's contact number and/or have them call if there's a Miscommunication or they're unable to connect.What is most troubling about your response is thatyou're taking no accountability for your driver's actions or your company's inappropriate response.Your driver, after calling me a horrible name, THREATENED TO PUNCH ME IN THE FACE. He never de-escalated the situation and once he said that, I feared for my physical safety. SO, IN EFFECT, IN YOUR RESPONSE YOU'RE CONTINUING TO BLAME NOT ONLY YOUR CUSTOMER, BUT A WOMAN WHO'D BEEN THREATENED BY PHYSICAL VIOLENCE by your driver.And regarding that first pick up in PITT three days earlier? Your driver showed up late and I had to call you twice to find him. (Flight changes happen. I was delayed out of LAX due to fog. I called you as soon as I knew about every change.) Review stands. Very unprofessional. I'll let Yelp reviewers decide.Final update: The fact that you're continuing to argue with a female customer after YOUR DRIVER THREATENED TO HIT HER just illustrates what a tone-deaf manager and deeply misogynistic person you are. You should be ashamed of yourself.You've been defensive and horrible throughout this entire exchange, as evidenced by your need to continue blaming me. You only apologized the day of the incidence on the phone after I started crying. I was thinking of deleting this whole exchange because I want to put it behind me, but women in Pittsburgh need to know your drivers are potentially dangerous.Useful 1Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationDavid S.Business Owner2/5/2017Hello.  I am the owner of First Class Limousine Service, established in 1985.  First let me say that I am VERY sorry that you were disappointed in the service you received from my driver.  Being in business for almost 32 years, surely, our services are very dependable, or I wouldn't be in business this long, particularly in that we service the largest universities, hospitals, museums, businesses, etc.  It's a difficult business to be perfect at, but we try very hard.That said, I'd like to address the specific issues of Kelly M:The property where where we were scheduled to pick Kelly up for an airport transfer is an old style apartment building that operates as a hotel, therefore there is no front desk, of sorts.  There is no way to enter the building.and the office is a block down the street in another one of their 5 or 6 buildings,  At these properties, the drivers are instructed to sit in the vehicle until the passenger comes out.  The driver was on site 13 minutes before the scheduled pick-up time, which I verified with our vehicle GPS tracking.  At the scheduled pick-up time, the driver (who has been with me over 10 years) called the main office of the property.  The office clerk phoned the room twice, but, nobody answered.  So, the driver waited.When Kelly M. finally reached me about 15 minutes later, she was EXTREMELY hot under the collar!  I apologized to her, and told her that the car was simply sitting in the driveway.  By the time she walked outside to to the driver, she was VERY upset, which set off an unfortunate, and likely avoidable, verbal exchange with the driver.  Supposedly, she violently threw her bag(s) in the trunk.  The driver (claims) he tried to de-escalate the situation, suggesting to her that she "forget all of that, and let's go"!  I'm sure it could have been handled better, and I DO apologize for that!  Believe me!I believe the entire incident could have been avoided if my driver had simply walked up to the front door to the building, or if Kelly had simply walked outside the building to see that the car was sitting in the driveway.Kelly, as I said to you on the phone, I'm VERY sorry that you had this problem with my employee, as this is certainly not the norm.  That said, you were upset that the driver didn't call your cell phone to tell you he was there.  In practice, we normally don't do this until 15 minutes has passed from the pickup time, as people are usually finishing packing, or eating.Once again, if you read my other reviews, you will find NOTHING even close to a story like this.  One thing my company is known for, above all else, is having extremely friendly drivers.  To say that women shouldn't use my service, I believe, is a little over the top, as, some of the most prominent women in Pittsburgh are long-time customers of mine.Thanks for taking the time to read my reply.DSEdited to add:  I wish Kelly would add how she praised us over the phone, because of how readily we accommodated her when she arrived at PIT airport 3 days earlier, when her flight routing was changed twice with minimal notice, from 7:42 PM to 9:39 PM, then to 11:20 PM.In response to your comment about the driver being late:  Your flight arrived 20 minutes early.  I remember CLEARLY when I spoke to you on the phone from the airport.  You were very understanding, and quite happy to wait a few minutes while I called the driver, and I got the two of you together in less than 5 minutes.Further reply:  I apologized to you 3 times in my reply above, for anything my driver may have said to you that upset you, and multiple times on the phone.  I'm really not sure what else you would like me to do for you at this point.  I have spoken with the driver, but I can't vouch for anything specific that was said to you during your interaction, as I wasn't there.That said, the personal attacks you made about me, are unsubstantiated, COMPLETELY without merit, and simply, don't dignify a response from me.Read more

column1: TC R.Pittsburgh, PA046/23/2014Other people may have had a better experience with this company but that was not the case for us.  We had rented a limo/bus for a bachelor party.  Our driver Scott, was completely clueless in navigating the city. Constantly making wrong turns and missing exits. All of this after very thorough instruction as to where to go. Each destination took 3-4 times longer to reach due to his incompetence. This caused us to have to skip a couple of our originally planned stops. After returning to the bus after one of our stops we were informed by Scott that the police had come onto the bus and searched it with dogs. Really?!??!  Why??!!  How??!!  We found that our bags had been rifled through and we all felt a little violated and confused. By this point we decided to call it a night. More than half of our passengers didn't care to step back onto the bus and took cabs home. Just when we thought the worst was over we were wrong. As we enter the highway we realize that Scott has driven all the way up the ramp and onto the highway going THE WRONG WAY!!!  He starts slowly reversing down the ramp while oncoming cars honk and swerve all around us!  Truly terrifying. After that, we were very upset and just wanted to get home. So after several more wrong turns we finally get home. Absolutely terrible night. So if you'd like to book a party bus that will include a geographically blind driver, unecessary police involvement, a near death experience and just an overall sense of frustration mixed with panic then go with these guys. Otherwise, I would suggest staying far, far away!Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationDavid S.Business Owner2/4/2017This is simply a case of mistaken identity. . . .Hello, I am the owner of First Class Limousine Service, established 1985.During almost 32 years in business, I have NEVER had a limo bus - of ANY type!  Nearly 100% of our business is airport transfers in regular everyday type sedans.There is another First Class Limousine Service from somewhere in West Virginia or Ohio that services Pittsburgh with limo buses, that has ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to do with my company.  I frequently get their erroneous phone calls.DSRead more

column1: Stacey L.Elite '2021Madison, WI20791186326312/2/20191 photoThe subs at Firehouse aren't mindblowing, but they definitely feel a step up from Subway's, Milio's, etc. I'd been to the Fish Hatchery location a few times last year, but this was my first visit to the westside store. We stopped on a Sunday night and it was pretty quiet. It took a bit for the clerk to notice us standing there, but he was overly apologetic once he did. I gave one of their turkey sandwiches a try, with everything on it except for the onions. The smoked turkey didn't have a discernible smoked flavor, but the quality was on par with Quizno's. The bread was good and nothing got too soggy despite their steaming schtick. I appreciate the pickle spear on the side and the price for a medium isn't too crazy. The restaurant space itself commits fully to the firefighting theme, including Dalmatian-print tables and a mural with Bucky Badger hanging out in front of a burning building - you know, like you do. This location was less steamy/smoky than the other location I've been to, and everything was clean and orderly. For a quick sandwich, it's not a bad spot, especially now that Sliced is no longer in business.MuralUseful 4FunnyCool 3Business owner informationGuest Services at Firehouse SubsBusiness Manager12/3/2019Stacey, thank you for the feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated. Susan/Guest ServicesRead more
column2: Business owner informationGuest Services at Firehouse SubsBusiness Manager12/3/2019Stacey, thank you for the feedback! We can't wait to see you on future visits, your loyalty is greatly appreciated. Susan/Guest ServicesRead more

column1: Adem D.South Jordan, UT1443111/9/2020Waited over 20 minutes for my sandwich before I went and asked them about it.   They didn't have a ticket.      I should have expected it since half way through me giving my order the girl at the cash register checked a text message.     I had to start all over with my order because she obviously wasn't focused.    Now I'm going to be in trouble at work for taking a hour lunch.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGuest Services at Firehouse SubsBusiness Manager11/10/2020We strive to offer our guests hearty and flavorful food in a timely manner and the long wait you described truly disappoints us. Adem, we take our guest's experiences seriously and we'll be sure to share your review with the private owner to address internally. Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We hope you'll offer us another chance to prove we are better than this.Sabrina/Guest ServicesRead more

column1: J B.Madison, WI8365/24/2020I wanted to support this business during the pandemic. column1: Sabrina R.Pooler, GA4010126/25/20206 photosI went in with a picture in hand and idea  in mind I did my research and read up on all the reviews so I thought sure enough I found a place for me. Nope I will not be back! When I received my pedicure I had to ask for her to cut my cuticles. After my subpar pedicure...they didn't remove the plastic covering the chair they just wiped it down with the same towel used for my pedicure. The plastic covering the bowl was not removed either. Nothing was wiped down or sanitized. To top it off,While getting a NEW full set I asked to have my cuticles removed she said it would be five dollars extra.  (Guess Nini has a thing against cutting cuticles) before we even began my full set I showed her the picture of what I wanted she said ok. Then I clearly specified that I wanted the ballerina shape on my nails. I had to correct her over and over  on the length and my shape that I just gave up! When it came time to polish she asked to see the photo again and  I showed her then she states oh you want Gel glitter and Gel color that will be Five dollars more since it is a design. I said no ma'am it's just a different color I don't want any designs. She said well you want more than one color it is like a design. I chose to just get one color since I had already paid $5 to cut my cuticles! So in total I ended up paying $97.00 for a BASIC pedicure and Basic Set! Oh I apologize I did get gel polish on both feet and hands!Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMason P.Business Manager8/13/2020Thank you for visiting our salon. We are sorry for your lack of a great experience during your visit. We do hope that you give us another try, and to be place with a different technician. column1: Anastasia K.Lake View, Chicago, IL0318/6/2019This dentist takes advantage of people who are actually fearful of going to the dentist! About two years ago, they told me I had four pockets of cavities to be filled and they recommended that it be done within two years. In that time, I moved to another state to go to college and didn't have the money to pay for any of their services (which are honestly through the roof). Fast forward to going to Hilldale Dental where I had an excellent visit, I was told differently. Two years later, I have ZERO cavities. I want to emphasize that this has not just happened with me, but also to my sister and her boyfriend. They both got recommended to do extensive work to their teeth for a ridiculous price when it wasn't necessary. They both felt weird and like their recommendations didn't make sense, so they got a second opinion and it was confirmed that they needed minimal work done. No Fear Dentistry is really only out for money. Save your money and save your worries for real problems. I highly recommend Hilldale Dental with Fred Jaeger. He is super personable and accurate in his recommendations and won't make you do any unnecessary crap to your teeth. He and his nurses took great care of my teeth, were funny, and made sure to inform me on everything they were doing during  appointment. SHAME ON YOU for taking advantage of people who are truly fearful of going to the dentist. You are preying on people who seek your office out as support to have healthier teeth. For many people going here, people haven't been to a dentist for years out of fear, and they take advantage of that by saying you need to have crazy work done on your teeth. Don't support them if you have the choice through your insurance.Useful 6FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationCameron L.Business Manager7/22/2020Good afternoon Anastasia,  For starters I would like to personally apologize for never reaching out to you before this time. Yelp has always been one of those online platforms we've never fully understood until now. As for your care, we strive to gain our patients trust and loyalty through the greatest experiences possible. While as a team we understand we've lost your trust in us, we still stand by our treatment diagnoses for your care after further review of X-rays and intra-oral imaging. By using some of the most advanced radiographic and imaging technology available, we are better able to diagnose any form of oral disease at its earliest stage and review our findings instantly with the patient. In turn, we gain our patients' trust by educating them on treatment, and help to save them thousands of dollars in possible future care that may go unnoticed by those using less advanced diagnostic equipment.If you would like to view your imaging for yourself and speak with a doctor that can help explain why we back our decision please give us a call and we would be happy to assist you.Read more

column1: CalGal V.Henderson, NV12344/3/2020On a Sunday afternoon I noticed that I had a nail in my tire.  I stopped in Tire Works to see if they could put a plug in it, and was greeted by Kumanu, the Assistant Manager.  He took a look at it and told me what I kind of already knew... the tires were old... and he said that putting a plug in might crack the tire.  I didn't have time to get all new tires put on because I had to pick up someone at the airport in about an hour.  Instead they put my spare tire on to get me safely to and from the airport and back home.  When I went inside to pay Kumanu told me "no charge" even though I insisted because I felt bad for not paying them SOMETHING.  I have so much gratitude for Kumanu in helping me late on a Sunday and easing my stress.  The best customer service ever!Useful 5FunnyCool 1Business owner informationJeffry G.Business Manager4/6/2020CalGal V, we are always happy to help! column1: April B.Glendale, AZ211112/26/2018I was very disappointed with the poor class on this past Sunday. The instructor was not informed it was the first time she had ever did this type of class, her supplies were low because she had no idea how much she would use. I also realized late in the day that her quality of paint and supplies was a very low dollar option. It was obvious to me that the finished product was that of someone who was using substandard paints, flow, and silicone. Other people brought their own supplies and their pictures turned out better because their supplies were better quality. I will not return whether it's for a pour class or painting class this was not a fun experience at all I feel as though my money was completely wasted thank you and goodbye.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAmy M.Business Owner10/10/2018April, I know we had emailed each other back in February. I'm not sure why Yelp just alerted me of your public review. I am sorry that you had such a bad experience.  Pour Painting has been on the rise and there are a LOT of people doing things differently.  My objective of this class/workshop is to give everyone a taste of what it's like.  The one you attended was my 1st attempt at offering it to my customers.  I admit, I didn't expect so many people to sign up and that so much of my materials would be used.  As far as the quality of paint, etc. we use the same paint that most other paint & sip studios use.  Almost everyone from that class reached out to me for additional pour painting classes.  Since then, I have learned not to allow so many people in each class and I have made the process much simpler.  For the record, only 1 person brought her own heat tool. She is a personal friend of mine and an artist.  Again, my apologies.Read more

column1: Uneka H.Elite '2021Charlotte, NC13143028049/19/20208 photosROTD 12/13/2020So I just joined yesterday and I have to say this gym is NICE!!! So as you all know the gyms all across the US has been closed due to Covid-19. I just moved to this state about a week ago however in Jersey (Jersey girl!) the gyms opened up about 2 weeks ago. Needless to say, I needed to get back in the gym (as safely as possible) ASAP!First let's start off with, this gym is HUGE! When I first walked in I was automatically greeted by the gentleman at the front desk. Alex (who was AMAZING btw) showed me around and was very patient with me while I asked a ton of questions. Afterwards, I had to ask the million dollar question "How Much Is it per month!!??"  The answer I was given blew me away- $10 A MONTH! I could not believe it! I even told them I wasn't looking for a contract because I didn't want to be locked in and guess what?????? He still said it was $10 A MONTH for all of this! (See pics). Today was the first day that I worked out and was very satisfied. The machines/facilities were clean, staff was helpful and made sure people wore their masks. They even had a "woman's section" where women could work out comfortably and with other women If they should choose. Overall, great gym - glad I joined!See all photos from Uneka H. for Fitness Connection - UniversityUseful 11Funny 4Cool 8Business owner informationRobin F.Business Manager9/22/2020Hi, Uneka. column1: Anisha H.Elite '2021Charlotte, NC32529926488/1/2018Had my first experience at Fitness Connection. My friend works out here and suggested I try the 5 day Fitness pass. Pulling out to the facility at 7:00pm, the gym was super packed. I presume this would be the case because the time was so late. But the number of people in the faculty was overwhelming. I had trouble accessing my free pass online, so in route to the location I contacted I was able to locate a treadmill on the first row which was nice. I did my 20 minutes until my friend arrived. Once she arrived I joined her in what I call the chaos jungle. It was an absolute madhouse in the weight/machine area. So many people using machines, not cleaning them properly and worst of all leaving weights ALL OVER THE GYM! No common courtesy for the next person that possibly wants to use them. And staff wasn't anywhere around to address the matter. What normally take an hour for me to workout took and hour and thirty minutes It was the worst. I used my 5 day pass that day only. column1: Kaitlin P.Mesa, AZ175585/30/2019I have never seen a more disorganized medical office. Inaccurate Billing statements, lack of structure, and unethical policies. The office staff are all very uneducated in billing, insurance, and standard practice. I had a billing discrepancy that two hours and 5 staff members to solve. Apparently a previous contractor who managed their billing didn't run my primary insurance for an office visit 16 months ago. The contractor told shafa medical that I had over $500 in outstanding payments, so shafa medical sent me the outrageous bill, and the shafa medical clinic office told me to contact THEIR previous contractor. Clients should never be responsible for those discrepancies. Why am I at fault for the contractor's mistakes? Also beware, "standard office practice" is charging $94 for an office visit, and not regarding a copay. The only focus is the deductible and if that has been met. I tried explaining a what a copay is to the office assistant and she replied that copays are not eligible until deductibles are met. She replied that she called our insurance, but she didn't talk to any representatives from our insurance company. We called our insurance company in front of her and he confirmed that she never spoke with a representative. He explained that we have a $25 copay with in network providers. She then had to be educated on the phone by the insurance re about how our insurance works, and how she should bill our company. Would not recommend.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. We have made changes to our contracted billing service and our clients are very happy with our new billing service.Read more
column2: Business owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. We have made changes to our contracted billing service and our clients are very happy with our new billing service.Read more

column1: Chelsea B.Chicago, IL1081867/26/2018Well, I saw the Dr. back in January 2016. Her practice worked with the  insurance I had at the time. It was a one-time, 5-minute visit for an RX refill, as I changed jobs and had to find a new doctor. I never heard a peep from this office again. Fast forward 2.5 years, and here we are. I just received a call this morning from a debt collector, telling me I owe $185 in bills. I've NEVER received a bill from this office (I would never not pay a doctor's bill), and despite talking to the office, the billing department and the debt collector, not a single person is able to provide a breakdown of the cost of my visit. My insurance covered an additional $145 of this bill - So what I'm really wondering is a) What happened in that 5 minute visit to warrant a total of $300+????? and b) WHY DID I NEVER RECEIVE A BILL? Turns out - they wrote my address down wrong. Now I owe a debt collector $185 for a 5 minute visit in a dingy office to get an rx refill of a medication I had been taking for over 5 years.Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. column1: nakeshea l.Altadena, CA758/10/2018I had been a patient here for several years. I recently had an appointment scheduled when I received a phone call, probably two days before I was scheduled to go in. There was an employee from the doctor office saying I owe almost $500 in doctor visits bills dating all the way back to 2016. How does a patient who comes in routinely, suddenly have $500 worth of bill that are two years old!? The employee told me, if I can't pay about half of what I owe, I can't have my appointment with the doctor. I told her, cancel my appointment then. I asked the billing person to send me an itemized list of all of my visits and billing from 2016 to present. That was about a month ago. Haven't received the letter with any details. I've been getting called by a debt collector instead. I may need to contact my old insurance to check the claims. I haven't been back sinceUseful 1Funny 2CoolBusiness owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. We care about our patients. column1: Leigh M.Tempe, AZ84132/6/2018Updated reviewI want to share an update that I thought was important. When I first came to this clinic it was for chronic fatigue and other symptoms. I have a history of thyroid problems and was concerned things had gotten worse. I got bloodwork done and it came back positive for thyroid antibodies and low low low iron, but even in light of this Dr. Modesta-Keyhani ignored the results and instead told me I had a gluten allergy. I am a researcher, and all the hard evidence points to gluten "allergies" not being a real thing - and the fact that she had test results in front of her telling her verbatim what was wrong with me and she STILL went for the gluten is ridiculous. 2 years later and I have been treated for iron anemia and Hashimotos by an endocrinologist and all of my symptoms are gone.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. We care about our patients. We are very pleased that your finally feel better.Read more10/26/2015Previous reviewDr. Modesta-Keyhani is friendly and knowledgeable, appears to have a very solid medical background, and it is fairly easy to schedule quick appointments.  Unfortunately, those are the only positives in my 6 weeks working with this clinic.While the doctor is friendly and capable, I really got the impression that she is incredibly overbooked and this showed in the service I received.  Every appointment I had was extremely hurried, which made it really difficult to process information and ask questions.  I left appointments feeling confused and like my case wasn't given the attention it needed.  It seems like they are trying to churn out as many patients as possible, rather than giving proper time and attention to fewer patients.  One particular frustration is that any time I had test results, I had to come in for an in-person appointment instead of just receiving a phone call letting me know what results meant.  This resulted in 3 appointments that I felt were completely unnecessary and could've been handled by phone.  That may be office policy, but I've had doctors in the past who call with test results and that just saves everyone time and frustration.Even more than this, my main qualm is with the support staff and with repeated mistakes made by them.  While they are friendly, they seem to not know what's going on most of the time.  My first round of blood and urine samples were lost with no explanation, no one had any idea who had handled them or where they had gone (which is totally unsettling...where did my blood go??).  I had to come back in to correct this, a real inconvenience considering the 30 minute drive and 12 hours of fasting.  Recently, the doctor ordered an out-of-office procedure for me and I was told that I would be contacted by the specialist in one or two days to schedule, and after not hearing anything for a week I called Shafa to follow up only to find that the paperwork hadn't been sent to the specialist until 5 days later.  It was just a simple fax.  I can't count how many times I heard "oh...I don't know what happened, I don't know how that works", etc. in my really basic questions to them.My 6 weeks at this clinic were very frustrating, and I am going to look elsewhere for a PCP.Read more
column2: Business owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. We care about our patients. We are very pleased that your finally feel better.Read more

column1: Susan S.Phoenix, AZ12717/23/2017Initially, I loved the really tiny  office and ridiculously long wait times cause the doc was so nice.  As time wore on, this became tedious.  The last straw was going to her office for "clearance" before an eye operation.It took me 6 months to get the eye operation and I needed all lab results to be in before a certain date or I would loose the OR spot.  I repeatedly called her office wondering why they had not sent in the results to the eye doc.  The latter also called her office up until the day before my scheduled OR appointment.  Needless to say, my OR appt. was cancelled and I have to wait another 6 months of seeing double before I can be scheduled again.Evidently Dr Modesta saw an elevated cholesterol and liver enzymes in my lab work, but I never heard a word from the office.  I could have explained both as a side effect from a drug I was taking, but I was not given the courtesy of an explanation.  Unprofessional is inadequate to describe this doctor/patient relationship.Doctor Modesta needs to retrain her professional staff or hire some qualified folks to run her office.  And get back to your patients in a timely fashion.  This practice is poorly run.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationAlexis G.Business Employee11/11/2019Thank you for your feedback. It appears there may have been a miscommunication regarding your case and you may have not received the message regarding your labs from our office. At times communication gaps may happen in medical offices. We make every effort to communicate by phone with our patients regarding labs. We have also added a new feature of text messaging in order to improve our office communications with patients. Additionally, with our new Electronic Health Record we have added a secure patient portal which allows patients to communicate with our office confidentially and directly at the convenience of their home. Our patients are very happy to be able to obtain copy of their labs via their secure portal and send messages to us for prescription refills and medical questions.Read more

column1: Raven B.Elite '2021Peoria, AZ77147493/30/2021At this location I had my first experience with a lady sales(wo)man. Everytime I go to a dealership, it is only men. Maddy assisted me and she did amazing. I felt so much more comfortable talking to her than I have felt with male salesmen. She wasn't intimidating, didn't bully me into a purchase nor was she pushy. However, She was still very effective at her job. She followed through with all of the things she told me she would do. Texted me from both her work number and personal cell number. Kept great communication throughout.She went above and beyond by offerring me incentives for a brand new car that I hadn't even known about at all. I went in for a freaking used 2012 Honda CRV from their inventory, got paperwork started on a 2021 Toyota Rav 4 instead! Maddy was a pleasure to work with. I definitely recommend to anyone! And that says a lot coming from me. I absolutely HATE working with car salesmen and dealerships in general because most are crooks that don't care..Maddy made my experience different. You go girl!Useful 1Funny 1Cool 1Business owner informationCustomer RelationsBusiness Customer Service3/31/2021Hi, Raven! column1: Drew C.San Antonio, TX82211/20/2020Bought a used Toyota Highlander here.  Spouse and I noticed body blemishes on the vehicle. I noticed one on the door. Our salesman Chris noted it for repair by the dealer.  I did a once over of the vehicle and found a scrape down the grill.  He said he'd catalog it too.  When we went inside we worked our financing over the phone with our lender.  When he produced the paperwork to take to the back to deal with the finance department, I noticed he didn't add the second issue I found.  We were headed to the back to complete the transaction and brought it to his attention.  He said to go ahead and head to the back and he'd update it for the service department.  They are the ones who really needed it. I didn't hesitate to trust him.  My mistake. I should have pressed him. I expected to get a call from the service department in the week. Once I did I we coordinated the repair.  By that time the 2nd issue repair just about left my radar, But I remembered and brought to their attention.  Despite everything, they wouldn't acknowledge the 2nd item.  Chris either completely forgot or didn't want to acknowledge.So, my takeaway for other customers is to make sure you do a complete inspection of a used car.  Take lots of pictures.  Ensure you don't leave the sales person's desk without them documenting any issues you found for them to repair later.  Toyota of Surprise is NOT worth spending your hard-earned money at.Go someplace where your sales person's attention is not just about cashing in the sale. BAD customer service here.Useful 2Funny 1CoolBusiness owner informationCustomer RelationsBusiness Customer Service11/22/2020Drew,I am concerned to learn about any miscommunication regarding the services provided for your Toyota Highlander. Your feedback is important to us and I would like to discuss this matter with you to better understand what happened. column1: Ou L.Las Vegas, NV2232276/30/2019I came into switch from sprint to T-mobile so I can access email and internet while I'm on a call.  The employee told me it would be easy switch, but it took 2 hrs and I they had to order the phone.  At first I wanted to keep iPhone 8 Plus and they told me I can get red for $699.  After being there for almost 90min she told me they don't have that deal anymore and I should get XR so I did.  They had to order phone for me and it would take 5business days.  When I got the phone and called customer service to activate the phone, they lady told me my phone should work soon and ended the call. After 24 hrs It didn't work.  I called customer service and they asked me to stopped by the store.  When I came in to store they told me the SIM card they gave me was not registered and gave me new one and it worked.  But it took them another 1hr to figure that out. I asked them how I'm supposed to send the phone back and after another 30min  on phone with their back office the employee told me to call the customer service in 2 days.  I called customer service again after two days and was on the phone for 49 min since they didn't know why the store didn't just process the ship my phone.  Manager got on the call and told me to go back to office.  After I demanded to return my phone ,  somehow he found the shipping label and emailed it to me.  What a waste of time.UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationT-MobileBusiness Customer Service7/2/2019I’m sorry to read about the service you experienced at our location. That is not the experience we would like for our customers. I will ensure the message regarding your visit is expressed firmly so similar miscommunications won’t happen again. Your next visit will surely be a better experience!Read more

column1: Hollis H.Sula, MT011/18/2020I had a quote from another auto repair shop and almost had a heart attack.  I decided to call Jakes Auto Repair. I spoke to Greg and based on that conversation, i decided to have him check out my 2006 Nissan Titan to confirm all the repairs i was quoted from the other shop. After looking at everything, Greg called me and explained that the only thing that was needed was brake fluid flush.  That was a 2000.00 savings for me.  I'm a single grandmother and i'm planning camping trips this summer to get out of the heat and i need an honest and competent mechanic in otder to my grandchildren and i safe.  After that experience, i am happy and relieved to know i found a repair shop with integrity.  Oh the icing on the cake, i have had a tire pressure and air bag light on for over a year and the other shop ignored my request two times to check them and turn them off. I did not ask Greg to check them...but i sure was happy when i noticed they were gone...UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGregory B.Business Owner1/28/2020Thanks Hollis! column1: Chica G.Phoenix, AZ4249/11/2018These are 2 new males who bought it off Jake within 4-5 yrs. is what one of the guys told me. They did an oil change the 1st time I went, then a coolant flush the 2nd time.  AND NEVER AGAIN!!  Please BEWARE taking your vehicle here!!! Dishonest people!  Women, take everything out of your car. AND  men also...   they stole  some classic CD's out of my car.  It was them, as I forgot to take them out the night before & the next day I went on a trip the next morning.  I went to   plug one in the player & find them GONE! They weren't stolen at my home as I have a RING doorbell & shows every movement. So what do you have to say for yourself guys??  A...N...D, My cabin filter was gone that I had installed myself.  I haven't felt good about one of the mechanics, Warren, but they're both in cahoots together.  Greg backs him up. He gave me a bad feeling.  I didn't trust him from the start! I did nothing to him but be nice.  Warren even asked me if I was married!! What the 'H_ _ _ does that have to do with my car??? Of course, he's going to say, "I did not"!  That's none of his business! I had NEVER been asked that at a repair shop! Greg proceeds to tell me, it couldn't be Warren, as he has everything on bluetoothe, whatever and  I was with him the whole time..  No, he wasn't!  A few times, he comes in & works on the computer for quite awhile, while Waren is out in the garage  where my car is.  He could have given my CD's to his folks or friends, etc., etc.   I'm NOT stupid!! The police agreed with me! I have never been violated like this at a mechanics place of business!! Nervy!!  you can't trust ANYONE!!I wouldn't review this place but I have to click on '1' star..don't know what his problem was but I did Nothing to him but be a customer.  and why he picked on me - I have no idea!  I don't know them from Adam!!  And who knows, they could do something bad to your vehicle....  Just Beware - Not To Be Trusted!!Useful 2FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationGregory B.Business Owner12/4/2018I would like to apologize for your negative experience with us.  If we understood correctly, you did not have any issues with our work but after you arrived home, you discover that some CDs were missing. We are sorry to hear that, and we are sorry about the question he asked you.  We offered to reimburse the cost of the CDs.  We would like also to inform that Jake is now working again at our location. We hope that you will come back one day for your car service and we apologize again for your experience.Read more

column1: Leonard E.Elite '2021Toronto, Canada721133126542/26/201912 photos86 check-insNow that most New Year resolutions have faded, I decided to engage myself for the better but with a budgeted plan squarely in place.A recent flyer brought me to this place after I  signed up online for a one year basic membership with no contract.  The only commitment was a $44 sign up fee and $4.99 every 2 weeks for 26 weeks.  That's all!Now, the trade-off is you get no nonsense access to a 24 hour 7 days per week gym; banks of small lockers (..bring you own lock), single change rooms like those found at clothing retailers, no showers, and a community coat & shoes check-in area.  No nonsense rate includes classes, cardio and strength equipment usage only.Members signed up for the Black Card Membership get additional privileges; tanning, massage chairs, half priced drinks.  This is a $10.99 fee or $6.00 extra over my basic membership.Time to start my workout now...Membership scan keyUseful 1FunnyCool 1Business owner informationMoe K.Business Owner2/27/2019Hey Leonard, thanks so much for taking the time out to leave some feedback. column1: Melissa G.Elite '2021Chandler, AZ21911451/29/20214 photosWe absolutely love Joyride Taco House. The atmosphere is super hip and cool. They also have a super cute backyard style patio that is dog friendly. We love the happy hour that has $5 pitchers of beer or $5 margaritas along with $2 tacos!! They also offer many gluten free items and they are all marked on the menu for your convenience! The chips and salsa are really good but not very spicy however you can order the habanero salsa for the heat! All the tacos are really good and you can't really go wrong with any of them. My personal favorite currently is the pork taco and my husbands is the fried fish taco. We also like to order their veggie side. Sometimes this changes seasonally it seems but this particular time it was roasted mushrooms with poblano's and they were delicious! I also love the tropical margarita which is a mango and coconut base. We hit this place up at least a few times a month and It would be a great place to bring out of town guests as well since it is so hip and you get such a great service. Be sure to hit them up on taco Tuesday for specials all day long!!Useful 1FunnyCool 1Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner2/4/2021Thanks for the Love Melissa!Read more
column2: Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner2/4/2021Thanks for the Love Melissa!Read more

column1: Liz F.Elite '2021Gilbert, AZ3382411498/16/20203 photosYummm! Im a big fan! We ordered takeout tonight - a total of 7 tacos and two margaritas. They included complimentary chips and salsa.When picking up takeout, you'll have to find street parking, as they don't have a good pull up spot. To the right of the main entrance, on the side patio, you'll find you take out food bagged on a table with your name on it. We got the following tacos:CARNE ASADA - meh, meat didn't have the texture of a quality steak. Seasoning tasted like what I'd get out of a packet at the grocery store. THE STANDARD - slow roasted chicken, my husband loved this one! I'd give it an a-okay! Tenderness was perfect,  though I thought seasoning could be more interesting BAJA FISH  - really good! Not too fishy. Perfect texture. Lots of flavor VEGGIE - my husband was a big fan of this one CRISPY FISH- very good! Not overly breaded, perfect amount of crisp. CHIPOTLE SHRIMP - my personal favorite! One of the best shrimp tacos I've had. It does have a bit of a kick. CARNITAS - very good! Tender meat and lots of flavorAll in all, their fish tacos were my favorite!  The salsa that came with the chips was really good. The verde was creamy with a bit of spice. The red salsa was mild with smokey tomato flavors.The blood orange margarita was bomb! I will deff be ordering that again. The joy house margarita was good, but a bit tart (tasted like a lemonade margarita). They even acknowledged my nut allergy,  which I had noted while online ordering,  and wrote it on all the boxes are food came in. I will be back. Can't wait to dine in here when more comfortable with COVID numbers.Useful 3Funny 1Cool 3Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner8/17/2020Thank you Liz! We are happy to get the feedback on the Asada taco and Standard. Glad the Fish and Veggie were a home run!Read more
column2: Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner8/17/2020Thank you Liz! We are happy to get the feedback on the Asada taco and Standard. Glad the Fish and Veggie were a home run!Read more

column1: Kayla R.Elite '2021Henderson, NV320935145393/24/20211 photo1 check-inCame here on the first night we were in town visiting friends. They asked if we wanted Taco Tuesday? Uhhh duh.We arrived here somewhat later on, maybe around 7 or 8, and they were POPPIN! Definitely recommend getting here on the earlier side. They have a sweet deal for tacos & margaritas on Tuesdays that honestly, I don't know if they can be beat. The wait was about and hour and a half, so we put our names in and thought if anything, we could go grab dinner elsewhere and then head over back to Joyride Taco House for a nightcap margarita.As soon as we finished dinner down the street, we got a text that our table was ready at Joyride. Perfect timing! We walked back over and were seated in a booth. The inside of this place is also so very Arizona. Super cute. I loved it. The bathroom even goes with the theme and had a stoplight in it. Truly amazing atmosphere here. Our server was very attentive. We told her basically we were there to drink some margaritas and not really eat anything except some chips and guac, and she was super cool about it! I ended up ordering a Ranch Water because I wanted to try it out. Our server explained it to us as basically a margarita this is sparkling. I ordered the pomegranate one. It was super delicious but I always forget that sparkling drinks sometimes mess with my stomach. So for the next round, I ordered an original margarita on the rocks with salt. They have some pretty tasty margaritas here.To keep the party going and the fact that I was on vacay, I ordered us all shots of tequila. Let me tell you, when you order a shot from here, the pour is extremely generous. It was more like a full drink. You get what you pay for, and no complaints there!We ended up staying till they closed and even a little after while we waited for our Uber. No one came over to rush us out. It was so nice. They even turned on the lights and started cleaning and still, no one told us to leave. That's some good customer service right there. Eventually we decided we shouldn't make them come over to tell us to leave, so we got up and waited outside for our driver.I definitely would love to come back here again next time I'm in town and hit them up for the tacos, because I saw others ordering those and they looked delicious.Ranch waterUseful 30Funny 10Cool 24Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner3/25/2021Thanks for hanging out with us!Read more
column2: Business owner informationBailey U.Business Owner3/25/2021Thanks for hanging out with us!Read more

column1: Ricky D.Phoenix, AZ30561610/8/2015Everyone, heads up!I used be a loyal customer of Water Mill Express because they service the machines daily, clean and convinient but recently noticed the water tasted off and also noticed the daily service stickers are missing. Checked other locations too. Tried to contact by phone as before but no longer an option, only Email. So I wrote them about my concerns and they just side stepped my questions and said they would send me some free tokens that I didn't ask for. That was 2 weeks ago. No tokens.My summation is that they no longer service the machines daily as before and am now going to a nearby Water Store. It's a little more expensive and not as convenient but at least I know the water is good quality and tastes better too! I recommend you all do the same!!! Watermill is now exactly like the Glacier water machines outside of every Circle K and Walgreens which are rarely if ever serviced!Useful 17Funny 6Cool 6Business owner informationDave W.Business Employee4/13/2016Ricky for your safety our Watermill Express locations are serviced and sanitized daily, which is something we have done since 1993 when we opened our first Watermill in the Phoenix area.  Our skilled technicians follow a rigorous 29-step checklist to ensure that every location is clean and functioning. In keeping with our exacting standards we have also created a proprietary monitoring system which allows us to check the status of each of our locations, 24-hours a day.  Thank you for your feedback Ricky.  Please send me a private message if you would like some tokens and I will make sure you get them.Read more

column1: Weslie S.Phoenix, AZ4258/20/2017Absolutely terrible customer service. I went in not knowing what I needed and hoping she would be able to give me some guidance. She fully took this to her advantage trying to sell me $150+ worth of products for a minor breakout. When I said I wasn't interested in that, I was just looking for a facial, she said she doesn't do that. Very rude. I walked out.UsefulFunny 1CoolBusiness owner informationMaku M.Business Owner8/22/2017We would have loved to help this person clear her skin and I am truly sorry it did not work out that way and for any misunderstanding. We sincerely hope she finds what she is looking for. We specialize in acne and problem skin. We do not provide any pampering services as stated on our website. We also do not provide false hope. We love what we do and we do it with honesty and integrity. To treat most skin conditions we do consultations, advise lifestyle changes, customize corrective home care products, and provide professional treatments. When people come to see us with skin care issues that cannot be resolved in one treatment we offer them a 1 hour detailed consultation for $35 where we discuss all of the above and more. Our clients are given AM/PM Home Care instructions, cheat sheets, and ongoing skin care coaching. Our consultations include periodic follow-up visits at no extra charge while using our products. This is what we offer to all of our clients. We care deeply in the success of our clients obtaining clear skin. Our clients appreciate what we offer and we sincerely appreciate them in return. Our goal is to give people healthy glowing skin for a lifetime and it takes more than one or a few facial treatments to treat acne at its core. All of our information, prices, and services are clearly stated on our website.Read more

column1: Shalea S.Glendale, AZ0622/6/2019This might be the worst VI I've ordered at. I picked up an order for country fried steak breakfast with hash browns and coffee... coffee was burnt and unpleasantly bitter, it couldn't be fixed with cream or sugar, I tired.the hash browns looked like they hadn't even been browned! I took a bite and potatoes in the center were COOL AND CRUNCHY, you know.. like a regular old uncooked potato. I swear they didn't even touch a pan.  The eggs and "hash browns" had been thrown on top for steak, not set in their own compartment as usual and I had to pick everything apart. The pancakes were burnt as well and I didn't even get butter. I got to work and had THREE bites and threw the whole thing including the coffee away. Thanks for tuning into my complaint. Y'all shouldn't eat here.Useful 1FunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMatt R.Business Customer Service2/7/2019Hi, Shalea.  I'm really sorry to hear about all the issue with the food.  We'd like to follow up with you about this.  If you could email us at guestrelations@villagein… with some contact info (phone number, email), we'd really appreciate it.Read more

column1: Rosemary O.ASTORIA, NY0166/6/2019I've been coming to this restaurant for 3 years. This last time: ordered 1 simple salad. After 15 minutes of waiting  the waiter says to me "we only have 1 cook, its the chicken. It will take a few more minutes" I said OK. I will wait a few more minutes." After 10 minutes  the waiter comes to my table again and said "the apples were taken by the order of the customer before you. we don;'t have any more apples."I got up and left. When the manager saw me get up he turned around and walked the other way...Very bad management, the restaurant is going down the tubes. Never again!!!UsefulFunnyCoolBusiness owner informationMatt R.Business Customer Service6/12/2019Hi, Rosemary.  I'm so sorry about the last visit you had at our Scottsdale location.  We'd like to follow up with you about this.  If you could email us at guestrelations@villagein… with some contact info (phone number, email), we'd really appreciate it.Read more
